text:
Tons of citrus. Apricot. Some other fruits. Opaque murky orange/brown Amber. Moderate off white head with fair retention. A good bit of lacing left behind. Orange. Grapefruit. Peach. Earth. Crisp bitter finish. Medium bodied. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, Kuma¬ís Too. Pretty exciting to finally get hold of one of these legendary Three Floyds beers! This was deep amber almost copper in colour, much more caramel malt and resulting sweetness than I expected. White foam, medium carbonation. Very hop plant hoppiness, fresh. More than any beer I¬íve ever had it tasted like you were sucking on the hops, or maybe their juices, before they go into the kettle. Grapefruit, citrus, a bit of pine, but also quite...hoppy. Quite bitter. Clearly a great brewing effort to get that intensity and faithfulness of flavour, but was it actually the nicest or most drinkable pale I¬íve had? Probably not.
Appearance is a deep amber and thick white head. Aroma is a little sweet. Taste is creamy with a nice balance of medium bitter hops and some sweeter malt.

Pours coffee brown with a golden tan head. Aroma delivers roast malt, coffee, and a hint of charred hops. Flavor offers smoky roast malt, coffee, woody hops, and a bit of licorice. Mouthfeel presents thick body and good fizz. Long brew the king!

355ml bottle. Holy ___. I can not believe for a second that this is 6.5%. Everything about it is huge, and the hop profile is incredible. Pours a beautiful hazy rose-tinged orange with a beige cap. On the nose, CONCENTRATED resinous notes, passion fruit, grapefruit, caramel. Fuller bodied, and above average sweetness with peach, apricot, passion fruit, and light caramel that tames itself into caramel, with light fruity notes under the resinous bitterness. This is like a DIPA hiding in a pale ale. I am beyond impressed with this. The best APA I¬íve had by far. Wow. Wow.

Great flavor, smooth finish. Cloudy appearance aroma is vanilla. Not much bite for an IPA but a good drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This to me is every bit the equal to Zombie Dust. A bold citrusy pale ale that¬ís just crushable. Putting down a six pack is no problem. Juicy and delicious!
Draft. Copper color with a short tan head. Aromas of brown sugar, orange rind, and alcohol. A little apple, caramel, citrus, and a hoppy bitter finish. Medium body.
Bottle. Medium orange with a big white head. Bright orange juice, honey, resin and slight alcohol aromas. Has a medium sweet flavor with a resiny bitter finish. Medium body with a bubbly feel

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 First try: Bottle, shared at a tasting in Tokyo. A bit too old I think (bottled August 2016?). Hazy amber color. Sticky off white to beige head. Aroma¬ís: sweetish, sweet fruit, brown sugar. Retronasal it¬ís caramel, sweet fruit, resin. Flavor is moderate bitter with some hoppy sourness and light sweetness. Light bodied. Finish is rather bitter. Need to retry with a fresh bottle sometime. 6/3/7/3/14
Second try: Bottle @ home, bottled 04/27/17, enjoyed 06/20/17. Appearance: see above. Aroma¬ís of resin/spruce, flowery hops, some bready/caramel malt. Retronasal there¬ís fruity hops, sourness, spruce. Flavor is moderate bitter, a bit hoppy sour, light caramel Medium  bodied. Long hoppy finish, but only mildly bitter. Much, much better fresh. 8/3/8/3/16

Cloudy copper color. Aromatic spicy citrus aroma. Taste - caramel malt sweetness and a hoppy bitterness that balances it out with perfection. A mix of citrus, earthiness and a something herbal. Sweeter than your typical APA but very well balanced. Easy drinking and flavorful. Wonderful!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours a deep golden orange with a billowy 2-3 finger head. Aroma is a mix of pine and earthy grass with floral notes. Taste is more earthy grass/floral with a touch of pine and the slightest hint of citrus. A solid malty background is in symbiosis with the hops and makes the taste exceptionally balanced. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, it is easy to see why this is 3F¬ís flagship ale, and a trendsetter in the pale ale community. While not the absolute best anymore, you can never go wrong with a swig of Alpha King.
From tap at CBC 2016. Hazy amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, malt, grass, crispy and bitterness.
Bottle at Craftheads in Tokyo. Reddish copper colour. Sweet caramel, biscuit malts, floral/grapefruit, hoppy finish. Absolute phenomenal.

Thanks to my GF for bringing these back from her Indianapolis trip. Pours a cloudy caramel-amber colour with a beige frothy head, excellent stay and some good lacing. Loads of fruity aromas with grapefruits, raisins, oranges and plums. Caramel malts blending things. The taste has the same with some good bitterness in the finish. Dry mouthfeel in the end. Great unfiltered brew, but feels more like an micro IPA than an APA.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle from Old Town. Pours a clear amber with a finger of foam that lingers. Big punchy grapefruit and pine nose with some orange zest. Clean and well-balanced on the palate. More pine and caramel on the palate with zing of grapefruit zest on the finish. Bitterness is big, but not overly done. Solid old school IPA.

On tap. Pours a brown dark amber with moderate head. Aromas of piney forest floor with a bit of candi sugar and wet toasted malts. Flavors of dull grapefruit, pine, bitter citrus, and toasty malts. Nicely constructed. Very good

Draught. Pours a hazy amber with a thin lasting off white head. Aroma is of grapefruit, pine, caramel, orange. Taste is of grapefruit, resinous pine, orange, caramel. Slick oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

This beer is good, but it's not a great beer. It's not too hoppy. It's a darker pale ale and it's not as smooth as some other pale ales. Slight citrus hops. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle pours a clear copper with a large khaki head. Citrus aroma, oranges and pineapple, light pine, with caramel malt. Sweet taste big citrus flavors, pineapple, light resinous pine, with clean caramel and toffee. Solid!
Tap @ Stocks & Blondes, Chicago. Orange, brown, good head. Vanilla hop aroma. Toffee hop flavour. Bitter citrusy aftertaste. Good but expected better for a top 50 pale ale.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear orange with a large foamy tan head. Aromas of floral hops, caramel, citrus, herbs. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Rich roasted flavors into a rustic hoppy astringent finish.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is of orange, citrics, pine and some herbs. Taste is bitter with low sweetness. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation and a very aromatic finish. Bitter and somewhat malty aftertaste

Bottle shared at esp0rs place, june 24th 2016. Amber body with a big offwhite head. Aroma of grassy and piney hops, with spruce and mild caramel notes. Taste is toasty with pine and resin, heavy bitter, with grapefruit in finish. Hoppy lasting aftertaste. A decent apa!

On tap at Hops & Pie. Orange to amber and clear in appearance. Aroma of piney, herbal, zesty and light resinous hops. Similar flavor, adding moderate hop bitterness. Medium body with a crisp feel and a light dry finish. Pretty fresh and tasty overall.
BOTTLE. Golden pour with foamy white head, good lacing.. Floral notes & musky aroma.. Easy pale, long soft malt body with resiny hops at back.. Sourced GD

Tap at the map room, Chicago. Pours deep copper color off white head. Aroma is orange, citrus, pine, caramel malt body. Flavor is really simple. It¬ís very balanced but it¬ís also very malt forward. I¬ím surprised. I guess I expected a beer more like pseudo sue. It¬ís good. But it¬ís just a really balanced APA.

On tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Pours golden amber with medium white head. Hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel malty. Sweet with moderate to strong bitterness. Medium bodied. Nicely balanced.

Bottle from Virby44, thanks again! 

Poured into a shaker showing lightly filtered dark brown and about 2.5 fingers of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of sharp pine and notes of cannabis. 

The palate is light bodied and full carbonated. Sharp flavors of pine and light pineapple shown throughout ending on a moderate bitterness. Well malted as the malt note appears underneath all the intensity. As the descriptions states, this is aggressively hopped and a bit too sharp for my tastes.

Acquired as a gift from a good friend. Pours an average size frothy off-white head and has a golden amber appearance. Some nice thick dirty lacing. Aromas of bready malts and earthy hops. Flavours are again with the bready malts as well as toasty malts, earthy and resin hops. Also some notes of cereal, some bitter citrusy hints as well as some caramel. Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. Medium bodied mouthfeel. Great retention. Good stuff!
Draft at Three Floyds. Pours a copper color. Aroma and taste are citrus and some caramel.

Shared by Maakun at Maakun back from US tasting. Hazy amber, greyish head. Sweet caramel malts, biscuits, caramel, light metallic note in not a bad way. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, very dry and supple feel. Very nice dank marijuana/caramel/toast finish.

Sweet citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, sweet grain malts, caramel. Clear gold, medium, creamy, off-white head. Light sweet and bitter. Bittersweet citrus fruits, orange, ripe lemon, creamy, sweet grain malts, caramel, light pine, soft carbonation. Outstanding APA, complexity of aroma and palate is off this planet. Keg at The Map Room, Chicago.

From notes (March 2015). Bottle from starcross -- cheers! This is a rock solid IPA that¬ís got a little more bitterness than some of the newer ones on the market but a ton of flavor. It doesn¬ít reinvent the category or anything for me, but it is refreshing and tasty, and really, who needs anything more from a beer?

Bottle from Three Floyds bottles three days ago. shared. Clear amber with creamy off white head. Mango, orange peel, caramel, light resin, light wood and green leaves, bit of roasted malts. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied. Very drinkable.

Draft at Winking Lizard. Smells a little hoppy but not much taste. The appearance in colors a beautiful copper, amber in color. Taste is a little bready, earthy, a little thicker than basic beers. Smooth on the palate with a little after bite. Overall this is a pretty nice beer.
Tasting session @ Budapest. Very solid pale ale. While three floyds is a bit over rated alpha King and zombie dust are two of the best

Growler pour into glass,nice copper color and excellent head retention.aromaw of sweet malts and tropical fruits and floral resins.taste sweet malts and tropical fruits with a bready carmel flavors.a great beer from 3 floyds!üç∫

Hazy copper Amber color with off white head. Aroma is sweet fermented pear, apricot and mango. Flavor is herbal and sweet up front then becomes more traditional hoppy pale: pine, mango, apricot, and citrus. Finish has slightly grassy and some malt.

Great citrus hop aroma. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel lets the hop flavor really shine. Great citrus flavor, still maintains a touch of juiciness. All citrus hips flavor but the malt adds a softness to it to keep the IBUs down. Easy to drink and a ton of flavor. Not as bitter as a true IPA but seems to allow more flavor to shine. Finishes dry with citrus flavor lingering and a touch of bitter 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle pours golden with a off white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel and pine. Taste is caramel, citrus and grains.
On tap in Chicago and bottle at Sholl¬ís wedding. Pours copper, white head. Aroma is sweet malts, citrus, pine, peach. Flavor is fairly malty, med sweet, fairly traditional sweet citrus flavor.
Pours a dark amber with a white head. Light mouth feel. Citrus fruits flavor piney flavor very hoppy. Refreshing taste.

Bottle. Pours amber/brown with intial frothy head and lots of lacing. Nose is fruity and caramel. Flavours of caramel, grapefruit, earthy bitterness. Taste is medium sweet medium/big bitter. Full sticky body with lively carbonation and lasting bitterness.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Yellow session, K√∏benhavn
Pours clear deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, grape and pine. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grape and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Dunkelbraun in Glas, fester hellbrauner cremiger Schaum, angenehm tropisch fruchtig in der Nase, sch√∂n ausgewogenes mundgef√ºhl, sch√∂ne fruchtige bittere im Abgang

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 Tap. Surprisingly dark brownish color with big head. Aroma is hoppy, tropical fruits, resinous, . Taste is bread, nice mango & grapefruit hop punch, honey and caramel as well. Bitter finish. Quite full-bodied as well (not surprising at this ABV). A very good APA, but it doesn¬ít hold up well.
Very strong hoppy aroma and flavor. Pine, lemon, honey taste. Strong malt backbone. Prefer ZD, but anothet excellent brew from 3F

Bottles at home. Super refreshing, mountains of citrus hops but nicely balanced. Good body/palate but not overwhelming, exactly what a pale should be. One of the best pales I¬íve ever had, and IMO better than Zombie Dust.

Cette bi√®re me surprend. C¬íest amer et sucr√©, c¬íest malt√© et caramelis√© en m√™me temps, et √ßa me surprend. J¬íai l¬íimpression que le liquide se perd dans toute ses subtilit√©s. On a √©galement un gout savonneux du houblon qui me d√©stabilise. Bref, tout √ßa me surprend et laisse en incompr√©hension face au hype de cette bi√®re recherch√©e.
How: tap Appearance: almost clear copper with a medium sized white head. Aroma: pine, grapefruit, lemon peel, floral, mango and honey. Palate: medium body, average carbonation.

341ml bottle from trade with Hop Citizen. Aroma: caramel, earthy, grapefruits, shy citrus. Malt really up front. App: cloudy copper, medium off white frothy head, good lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, velvety and soft for the palate, light to medium sweetness, light moderate dry bitter finish. Overall: hmm. The aroma and the taste definitely disappointed me. I¬ím so more of a fruity hop forward fan than a malt forward or even balanced. Mouthfeel is pretty good though and drinkability is high. Just wish it was more fruity. Date was scratched out so no idea how fresh it really is. Disappointed again by FFF. On the bright side, the look and mouthfeel are really good. Just ok.

A 12 fl oz. bottle bottled on March 31st 2016 and poured into a mini Mikkeller long stemmed tulip glass. It poured a clear copper colour with a one finger off white head that had decent retention and left nice lacing. Aromas a bit light but grapefruit and pine come through along with some caramel malt. Tastes of bitter citrus grapefruit, lemon and orange peel, sweet lemon tea, lightly sweetened tea, pine and caramel malt in the background. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall nice and well balanced. Good mix of bitter and sweet.
First time having. I can't believe I waited this long. I drive past the brewery way too much for this

At Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Yellow session.
Golden with off white head
Aroma of hops and citrus
Taste bitter citrus and bread
Pours clear dark amber with white head. Aroma; Resin, pine, caramel, grass, citrus and some grapefruit. Taste; Citrus, pine, caramel, bread, malt and resin.
A: Nice clear brown coloured with a one finger white head. N: Malty, some orange zest, papaya, some wet wood T: Pine, grapefruit zest, honeydew O: Quite malty with a nice (but small) piney touch.

Tap at mikkeller bar ; 3 floyds tap takeover. Hoppy aroma of citrus, tropical, pine, grapefruit and floral notes. Quite malty of caramel. The flavours starts heavy sweet but finish bitter with fairly long duration. The body is medium and the texture is juicy. A nice one...
Super fresh bottle from trade. Aroma is loaded with pine, resin and fruits. Taste is pretty sweet with peaches and grapefruity, citrusy hops. Dry and a bit strawy finish. Lovely. Super-tasty.
Tap @CBC16. Grape and peach aroma. Light malt. Similar flavor with some lasting piney bitterness and some biscuit malt.
On tap at CBC 2016. Clear amber pour with a very tall off-white head. Citrus, grapefruit, unripe tropical fruit. Smooth and refreshing.
Tap cbc. Pours hazy deep amber. Aroma of old grains, caramel, old hops, grassy, light grape. Taste us huge caramel and grains, quite. Bitter. Old

Pours very nice clear deep golden with large lasting head. Hoppy citrus floral, pine aroma. Crisp and nice subdued caramel backbone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, Copenhagen. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, caramel, sweetness, hops and malts.
Tap@ Mikkeller bar. Piny aroma all over. Some caramel, pine, wood in flavor. Drinkable but pine dominates, perhaps too much, at least for me.

Pine citrussy nose, amber caarmels on nose. Med odied, bitter,p piney resinous, pinespinespines in finish. Really tasty nice ipa.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours amber with an off white head. Malty aroma with citrus and pine. FlAvo is citrus with caramel malt and biscuit notes. Fruity citrus flavor with a pine and herbal hop finish. Thanks to Maxbier for sharing.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Bottle thanks to free beer week and StFun. Pours a hazy golden brown with fluffy off-white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of piney hops and a hint of oxidized caramel malt. Taste is more along the oxidized malt and bitter hop notes. Seems old, but package date is less than 3 months old. Still a solid pale ale though.

0,355 l bottle bottled 28 Jan 2016 
amber-orange color, slightly hazy, creamy tan foam. 
spruce, citrus, hints of caramel and cereal, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Pours dark orange, nice head. Aroma: white fruit, pine tree, some flower aroma, bread aroma as well. Taste: pine tree mixed with white fruit and some long kind of floral taste. Interesting long and pretty heavy palate on the flowers side. Good brew. Not sure it deserves the 100/100 though.

Very solid pale ale. While three floyds is a bit over rated alpha King and zombie dust are two of the best 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured dark, reddish amber; nice off white head, some lacing on the glass. Aroma of fruit and hops but with a strong malt and biscuit presence. Taste is consistent, VERY well balanced, starts sweet and bready but finishes with a nice hoppy (and citrus fruit) end. Very good, very enjoyable and quite easy to drink.

Poured from a bottle dated March, 2016. 
Aroma is malty with some toasted bread, cracker and biscuit notes. Some medium hop notes of grapefruit and pine resin. 
Pours a slightly cloudy, dark copper color with a medium sized, slightly off white head that lingers for quite some time after slowly receding to a thin film. High lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet with some toasted bread, darker cracker and biscuit notes. Medium to medium high bitterness. Some grapefruit and pine resin notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a decent pale ale but a bit malty for my preferences. A rather boring, somewhat old school hop profile as well.

Flaska fr√•n Mikkeller butik i Torvehallerne, K√∂penhamn. Hyfsat f√§rsk, tappad 3 mars. B√§rnstensfr√§gad, disig med h√∂gt kr√§migt skum. Ingen humlebomb vare sig i doft eller smak det √§r faktiskt malten/kroppen som verkligen imponerar. Massor av honungsnyanser, som en dr√∂m (sm√•kakan) som sm√§lter i munnen, mjuk och subtil men rej√§l och fyllig. Den bygger scenen f√∂r en fr√§mst ganska gr√§sig humleprofil, med lite citrus, aprikos. Sn√§ll beska. S√• otroligt snyggt, v√§lbalanserat och gott. Wow.
Wow. Amber honey in the glass. Nose is rosy floral citrus, palate follows right in step. Great hop profile. Complex, balanced and right on. Think I¬íll have another.

Slightly sweet with nice malt notes. Pours dark golden with a short frothy head. Hints of blood orange on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Enjoyed pint from the brewery as well as a case purchased. Golden color. Strong hop aroma. Carmel notes.

Bottle. Copper pour with white head. Great hop aroma. Caramel malt mouthfeel with nice hop balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Has a reddish dark color. Has a huge malt taste. Sweet caramel flavor. Nice mixture of grassy floral hops. Pretty unique pale ale.
Perfect pale ale. Nice hops...not a strong citrus taste, but well balanced. This has more malt than im used to...but it works.

Aroma: sweet citrus notes, herbs.
Appearance: hazy amber color and white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, yellow citrus, mango, pine, dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Really good APA, but I should say that I expected something more.

Much like anything 3F this is a pretty aggressive pale, drinks more like an ipa. Pours a clear amber color nice lasting off white head. Huge pine lead aromas, lemon led citrus. Pine on the forefront, followed by a sweet malt bill with caramel flavors, finished by a bitter palate. Everything works in this pale, nice color, carbonation, palate, flavors and finish.
Pours hazy red amber color. Aroma is piney and citrusy. Rich taste with piney, citrusy and apricot seed notes. Very good.

Bottle from Dale. Almost as good as Zombie Dust. This could be the benchmark for rating APAs. Other than an average pour, this brew¬ís got it going on, an and then some. Aroma is perfect blend of hops and malt, taste follows with equally excellent blend of sweet caramel malt and bitter hops. Bliss!

Pours a hazy orange Amber with a white head. Aroma of plum and berry. Taste is malt forward with notes of tea. Very well balanced. Finished nicely with a good dry Balance that didn't have a lot of bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from my buddy J. Reddish orange hue, murky clarity with mostly lasting white fizzy head. Virtually no lacing. Crisp orange hop aroma, grapefruit and sweet floral notes. Orange hop taste up front with more of a floral hop finish. Crisp on palate.

Pours copper orange with a medium white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: mango, tangerines, citrus, crisp malt, herbal hops, coriander, spices, pine bitterness, tropical fruit, caramel, leaves, herbs, grass, floral and slight peppercorn. TASTE: pine bitterness, coriander, citrus, mango, spices, leaves, herbs, tropical fruit, hop oil spices/acidity, caramel, grass bitterness, crisp malt, tangerines, lime zest, pine bitterness and light peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: citrus, pineapple, spices and crisp malt with an oily spiced finish.

Amazing aroma of tropical fruit. One of the best smelling beers I¬íve had. Pours a nice copper color with lacy white head. Initial taste is grapefruit/citrus. Goes down very dry and slightly bitter. Dry aftertaste lasts a while. Overall it¬ís good but expected better from a 100 rated beer.

Many thanks to jsquire as my Secret Santa 2015!.  Great smooth floral beer. Moderate bitterness, great floral aroma. Pine, citrus, tropical fruits. The sweetness is moderate, the floralness of the hops intense and long lasting! Great stuff!

Sampled from a bottle from Macy's in Chicago. Pours a clear copper colour with a white head. Aroma of orange peel and syrup. Very full mouthfeel, and a taste of mango, orange marmalade, hay and coriander. Very long, dry finish. A characterful, well-balanced and very tasty American Pale Ale.

Pretty much an IPA. Will rate on how I liked beer not that it¬ís not really a pale ale. Huge pine hop aroma and citrus. Poured orange and clear. Nice malt balance and bitter almost to harsh arena but pushing envelope in good way. Awesome beer tipping the edge on a pale ale.
On tap at Mikkeller bar. Very tasty american pale ale, rich and not too sweet with great balance on the hops.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy deep orange/copper color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, apricot, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, light pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome balance and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical hops and moderate dark/bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, apricot, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, apricot, mango, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, pine, caramel, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible robustness, balance, and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky, and fairly creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible pale ale! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

On tap at Three Floyd¬ís with koleminer20. Aroma is light, some tropical fruit but a ton of malt. Appearance is rust orange/yellow, off white head. Taste is pine, lots of malt, earthy hops, not so tropical. Mouthfeel is strangely thick, medium carbonation and body. Overall, they have done better.
Meh.. Floral hop juice, basically. Little nuance, to be honest. Somewhat watery as well

Light/medium stylish aroma with bit sweet dark notes of mango and fruits. Bronze color with small white head and slightly hazy liquid. Medium slightly hoppy and balanced taste of slightly matured fruits and some malts. Only a hint of citrus. Medium taste spectrum and medium smooth aftertaste with malts and hops. Medium body with medium/light carbonation. Overall smooth and classy product with everything in great balance.
Amber. Northwest hops. Kinda malty. Super IPA/APA flight with John (Schlafly TIPA, Founders Harvest Ale, Pliny the Elder, Zombie Dust, Alpha King, Sierra Nevada Celebration ale).

Bottle from the source At three floyds brewery. Brewed only three days prior. Poured into dogfish head glass. Floral notes of lime, citrus and fresh hops. Hops are not over powering but do have a lingering resin taste on the back end.

It has beautiful white foam, a great aroma of hops and citrus fruit. The taste is rich and saturated with good fruit, hops bitterness is strongly defined, reminiscent of an American IPA. It is both thirst-quenching and at the same time fantastically tasty and expressive.

Fair. This has a little to offer in a lot of areas but doesn't excel in any one area. I feel it's just an average at best pale ale. The hop characteristics are far too muted and dull for my liking when it comes to a good apa. Plus the prices point is far too high. 6 pack of this avg apa for $14 or an amazing say fist city 6 pack for $9. Or a half acre daisy cutter. Not about the price though. The beer here is nice to try but average at best for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle, pita a dark amber with a nice head. Smells of malt and hops. Taste is malty with some good bitter hops. An excellent pale ale.

Map Room CHI: pours dark golden Amber, cloudy with sticky foam head. Aroma of hops, fruity...mild kind buddish. First sip hits with the hops, follows with the fruit. Nice aftertaste, very nice drinking. One of my all time favorites in the IPA Realm.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a slight darker pale ale with a modest head and some lacing in a tulip. Lizardville. Aromas of citrus, hay and straw field, cut grass and weeds, some pine resin. Taste is the powerful hops but a malty backbone to balance. Good carb, pushy and aggressive finish. Great pale ale.

Disclaimer: this review is more a rant/blog entry than a blow-by-blow version of tasting notes. The first time I had one of these it was 1999, the world was (relatively speaking) a happier place and Nick Floyd and his sons were just starting to make a name for themselves regionally, brewing in Hammond... and hadn¬ít yet turned into the arrogant, money grubbing bastards they are today. Times have changed and so has my palate. 16 years ago, this was one of the happiest beers available in the Midwest, today this is pretty mainstream. Still good (black pepper, crackers, citrus, solid appearance and palate) just not earth shattering as I remember it to be (amazing what progress in American brewing will do to perspective). I will say I like the old label better... wonder if they¬íll replace with the statue of AK out front of the brewery with a comic book character version too.

So I finally found a bottle of this, Pale Ale my ass. It¬ís pretty darn colorful, nice reddish hue, off white head. Tons of aroma, grapefruit and pine mostly. Nicely carbonated and very smooth.

Stopped at the brewery on the way home from Ohio during spring break. Picked up a case of my favorite 3 Floyds - Gumballhead and split a case between Yum Yum and Alpha King. At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, slightly hazy deepish orange color, aroma of pineapple, grains and shrubs with some jam, flavor of bread with some marmalade and a lingering herbal bitterness, with a metalic hint creeping in at the aftertase. Fair and drinkable.

(On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Feb 25 2015) Pours copper with a small dense off white head leaving lots of lace. Aroma is orange, lemon zest, fresh pine, grassy florals, faintly spicy and a little dank, TF house style for sure. Bit of a caramel backbone. Palate has a bit more caramel backbone, with pine, orange rind, lemon, herbal, a bit of white pepper from the middle on? Sweetish. Finish is dry and even softly sour with a fairly light astringent bitterness of orange peel and a spruce/cedar sort of character. A little grain. Lightish mouthfeel and average carb. A pretty good APA, but it¬ís definitely not as good as Zombie Dust, being a little less fruity and bright.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 141024. Caramely and hoppy with notes of citrus, grapefruits and pine, light sweetness, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and bitter.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance ¬ñ The beer pours a burnt orange-amber color with a bit of redishness and a nice three finger head of pure white foam. The head has an amazing level of retention, very slowly fading to leave a fantastic level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma of the beer is heaviest bready smell mixed with a lighter level of a grapefruit hop. Along with these aromas comes some grass and pine as well as little bit of caramel to produce a rather nice aroma overall.

 Taste- The taste begins with a great bready and slightly doughy taste. Along with these flavors comes some hop notes of a mainly grapefruit hop taste along with a little bit of a caramel and some light toast. The toast and caramel remain rather light throughout the taste, with the bready and doughy tastes fading just a bit. Other hop flavors of a grassy and pine flavor join the now slightly stronger grapefruit to leave a rather bready and nicely hopped flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the brew is average to slightly thicker than average with a carbonation level that is on the average side. The feel is very good for the hop and bready flavors of the brew and makes for a nice more mouth coating medium, but is not overly thick to kill the more refreshing pale ale characteristics of the beer.

 Overall ¬ñ A very nice pale ale overall with tons of great flavors and a nice hop blend. This is renowned for a reason¬Ö it is very good.

Should¬íve probably had it when it was all fresh but I simply forgot I had it. Lol.

I enjoy the aroma. that¬ís my favorite part. It¬ís so sweet like a salt water taffy factory, like watermelon stewing in sugar, like better days. However, it¬ís not what I expected. It may be the off kilter realm I found myself in today. That could be it. Or it may be my general unwillingness to be completely satisfied. Maybe. But really I think it¬ís more simple, I really just wanted more of a traditional pale ale taste on a warm summer night. Something familiar like driving down the street I grew up on. The taste is certainly good and it¬ís growing on me with each sip--the alcohol power. BUT, This beer and I, victim¬ís of circumstance, A situation of right beer at the wrong time. But that is the thing, Life isn¬ít fair. You will get a good beer in a inappropriate space. C¬íest la vie. I am a goose staying put in the heat wishing their was a more hoppy beer going down my gullet. Forever longing. Always bitter. Staying true. I just wish there had been a warning. The lights could have flashed. The gods could have told me. It¬ís more of a fall thing! You¬íd like this better in a different season! No, that¬ís freaking fate.

On tap at Public House in Chicago. Pours dark amber, smallish head. Citrusy aroma. Nice hop bitterness, but still mellow. Crisp carbonation, but easy drinking. Overall, really flavorful APA.
355 ml bottle. Hazy amber with off white head. Aroma with loads of caramel, sweet malt, pine, resin and fruit. Taste is sweet, caramel, pine, resin with a lingering bitter finish. Very nice
Excellent pale ale. Dark amber with fairly frothy head. Floral and citrus nose. Hops hit with bitterness but fade fast. Nice and drinkable. Solid in everyway.
This is an amazing American pale ale. Great taste of hops that doesn¬ít last long and leave you wondering. Great looking brew. Pours a wonderful color with great lacing. Enjoy!
Another amazing APA from this rocking brewery, a tad more fruity maybe than the Zombie Dust, with notes of berries. A perfect treat for all hop addicts, don¬ít even try to resist!

Pours a slightly cloudy amber with a thin head of light tan foam. Nose is of hops. Very creamy and silky on the palate. Hops flavor is pronounced on the front end with a slight bitterness throughout. Finished dry. A good example of the pale ale style. Pairs well with brats or burgers.

Larg3e frothy cream head misty deep amber pour strong carbonation the aromas floral citrus rich malt pine the flavours resin pine medium bitter toffee lovely mix of fruit honey lemon nectarine apricot smooth yet crisp on palate the finish thoroughly proven good ale and once again it gets good marks a lovely bit of brewing a high class ale good hops crisp lasting bitter sweetness good all you need

Wasn¬ít like anything I was expecting as this beer is there flag ship brew, piney floral notes kinda sticky/choppy, not bad for a pale ale, Love the bitter notes that stick around on the tongue but wasn¬ít what I was expecting. Not bad..

Bottle: A hophead's dream. Strong hopped up nose delivering a punch (for a labeled ale).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Very citrusy aroma, straight forward peach, grapefruit and some pineapple. 

Really a great pale ale, but I had this next to Surly Furious, and I got to say Surly Furious was a bit better, overall easy light malt body, hop carries it, not a lot of bitterness hop, but a lot of grapefruit and aroma, well crafted, 
but not perfect, still, very drinkable and enjoyable.

[8-4-8-4-18]

Had this again, on tap, next to Zombie Dust.

This one wasn¬ít much worse at all, just different, more crystal, more aggressive, a bit less balanced, with less hop aroma. But this time it was a lot worse from memory, Hoppiness wasn¬ít there that much except bitterness. 

[7-4-7-4-13]
Cloudy orange with a soapy head. Malt aroma is masked by mandarin orange and mild spice. Citrus flavor but not bitter. Malty sweet finish. A nice pale.
Pours dark amber good white head smell is hoppy citrusy (grapefruit) with some sweetness from malts. Taste is citrus, some honey and light caramel. Straightforward and very nice.

I¬íve had this beer many times. A good solid go-to beer since it is easily available year round in Wisconsin. Pours a light amber color. Good floral smell. Taste is a nice balance of bitter hops and sweet malt.

Bottle. Citrus aroma with a murky brown appearance. Thin whit head that dissipates over light carbonation. It's hoppy and has caramel flavors. Well balanced and nice complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear deep amber with a thick rim head, cascades of lace. A good looking brew. Taste is caramel malt with an immediate overtone of floral and citrus hops. Both sides compliment each other (rare in IPAs) as they move right through to a lingering finish. Sometimes the best beers are the simplest. This seems like one of those, because all aspects are in such perfect balance. Exceptional.
Bottle to shaker - deep rust with an average head and lacing. Nice hop aroma and an orange-lemon hop taste. Somewhat dry finish. Refreshing.

Another FFF brew thanks to gumballdust. Pours a slightly murky reddish amber. Much darker than I was anticipating. Has a frothy off whit head that seems to be sticking around pretty well. Aroma is heavy on the hops. Pine resin, big floral notes, and hints of sweet citrus. Flavor is slightly more balanced than the aroma was letting on. The hops are still at the forefront of this beer but there is a malty sweetness throughout. Has a bit of a maple syrupy kind of sweetness to it actually. Overall a solid beer. Not sure if it quite lives up to the "100" rating but a solid beer nonetheless.

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends @ home. Bottled 16 january 2014.
App: Hazy and deep redish/orange amber with a short thick yellowed head.
Aroma: Grapefruit, caramel, spun sugar and then a good pinch of resin and pine. Pretty simple but very nice.
Taste: Sweet with spun sugar/caramel, grapefruit, blood orange, litchi that blend together really nice and then finishes with a robust resiny and piney bitterness.
Palate: Medium bodied, soft carbonation, slight oily.
Overall: Very good APA that really shows FFFs high class. And though it¬ís four mounths old it¬ís very tasty and doesn¬ít feel all too tired. Sturdy enough to almost count as an IPA. Very good.

Copper colored pour with thick tan head. Nice mellow citrusy aroma. Malty, grapefruit notes, slightly bitter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Vey good. Great taste and body. Critique is with some expectations. Wanted a little more fruity citrus flavors and less oily component. Yet still really enjoyable and world class.

4 days in the bottle. To glass. Pours a clear perfect amber color with a thin light tan head. Aroma is fleshy, tropical fruits, light molasses sweetness. Light to medium in body with an oily mouth feel, lingering bitter and sweet. Very very tasty!

Burnt orange color, pours a thick creamy head with good lacing. Smells of strong, sharp hops on opening 12 ounce bottle. Centennial and Cascade hops detected, indeed very hoppy, reminds me of an IPA. Good bitterness on the aftertaste. Very drinkable for hops lovers. A favorite.

Blind tasting with the S&G Tasting group. THX to Mathieu87!
Only wrote down some small words and the score.
Probably the best on of the first part of the tasting. (IPA + American Pale Ale)

23/IV/14 - 33cl bottle @ The Great Belgian Beer Dinner (Gent) - bottled: 27/III/14 (2014-383) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark orange bee, big irregular creamy yellowish head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus fruits, grapefruit, pineapple, bit sourish, bit piny. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: wow! Lots of citrus fruits in the start, very bitter, refreshing, bit lemony, sourish touch, passion fruit, some mango. Aftertaste: bit piny, resinous, sweet malts, bitter hops, lemony touch, lots of grapefruit, nice hops, lovely stuff, very nice!!!

Aroma is floral, citrus, honey, beautiful light-caramel malt note also an oppressed herbal, minty scent. Just a wonderful bold balance of APA qualities. 


Mouth-feel is light with soft carbonation, but it glides smoothly across the tongue. Taste is sweet citrus, grapefruit on front palate. Toffee honeyed malt seizes the initiative driving the flavor towards a lasting medium-bitter finish. 


Flavors are a little more pronounced than Zombie Dust and were more suitable for my palate. Really tasty if it was an IPA but I am conditioned to prefer my APA¬ís a little more refreshing.

Pours slightly hazy brunette with moderate pale tan head. Aroma is fruity - tropical, circus, pineapple. Flavor starts slightly malty, then layer upon layer of hops builds on top of the malt. Long hop finish. Very solid, dry, and hop dominant. Part of me suspects an older bottle, because as good as it is, I was expecting more. Shucks, I?ll have to try it again.

Poured from a bottle purchased at the brewery into a pint glass clear amber with a huge thick light beige head.
Aroma is citrus with a touch of malt.
Flavor is off the map. Hop everywhere so citrusy quite juicy. One of the most drinkable APA ever. A small bit of caramel is evident . The bitter finish is right on. Quite the balanced beauty.
On draft. Amber color with one finger head. Tropical aroma. Earthy and citrus flavor. Very drinkable.

Finally got my hands on a 3 Floyds Beer. Thanks Mike. Bottle, poured a very nice looking clear amber with full frothy head. Floral citrus hop resin aroma, some slight caramel also. Medium light bitterness. Quite smooth. Nice floral citrus aroma with caramal notes and bread. Nice mouthfeel. I was trying not to get sucked into the hype, but I have to admit this is good. Well done.

On draft, served in nonic pint glass. This beer hits you with the aroma of juicy, citrus hops before you even taste it. A full flavored classic from FFF. Flies under the radar with all the excitement over Zombie Dust but absolutely holds its own in the APA category.
Pour from a bottle is a nice hazy amber with a white head. Has a very sweet citrus aroma. Taste is a little nutty with hints of grapefruit. Goes down smooth with a clean after taste.

An aroma of floral hops, reisling wine, lemon starburst, a touch of grapefruit, cranberry, some cinnamon, and a bit of hidden sweet caramel. Appears a reddish copper with white foam and minimal lace. Taste starts sweet like caramel and cereal, but fades into a lingering grapefruit bitterness that grows as time passes. Palate is fizzy, filling, not syrupy or watery, almost a 5. Overall, very good!

Bottle. Dark copper/blood orange. Bready nose. Full body. Taste has some complex malt quality, slightly sweet, a bit of a surprise at the front. Lingering hop bitterness comes off piney at end of sip.
Had on draft, big citrusy aromas on the nose, with some floral notes as well. Citrus, grapefruit, lemon and a bit of orange on the palate, with just a hint of pine. Some toast on the finish.

12 oz. bottle. Thanks Ian! Pours orange, with a medium, pillowy, off-white head. Big aroma of grapefruit, grainy malts, and some bitter orange peels. Mild malty sweetness, with a fairly assertive bitterness, and a long, bitter aftertaste. Light to medium body, astringent, and sticky. Overall, this is a pretty nice pale ale, with a nicely balanced flavor, and pleasant aroma. Nothing special, but just a quality beer.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 Served: 12 oz bottle
Look: pours a dark honey color, slight cloudiness to it. 1 finger head, evaporates into a thin film on top. Thin laces on the edge of the glass as it evaporates. 
Smell: definite smell of hops in the beginning.
Taste: hop flavor, slight bitterness to it.
Feel: Better flavor with slightly larger than normal head. Not too heavy, good carbonation level.
Overall: Better served in a pint glass than a tulip. 
First Drank: Mom & Dad's XMAS eve 2013

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2014 Bottle from Mikkeller Online Shop. Wow, what an appearance! Deep copper, slightly hazy body, with a beautiful, huge, stable, creamy, frothy, slightly beige head, that leaves a massive ring-shaped lacing. Complex, fruity, aroma of wild berries, citrus, tangerine, orange peel, peach, pine, candy. Taste is an almost perfect combination of crisp hop and smooth malt notes, with about the same aromas again, but also a distinct biscuit malt backbone. Incredible balance! Mouthfeel is medium, slick, oily, with just the right amount of carbonation and it finishes smooth, moderate bitter, fruity and malty. Simply amazing! Close to perfection, one of the very best beers APAs I know, close behind their Zombie Dust in my opinion. I didn¬ít have many beers before, with such a perfect balance, high drinkability and complexity at the same time!
12oz bottle pours a copper brown with a two finger head. Around of, citrus, herbs, and malt. Mildly bitter. Tasty beer.

Six pack from Ashland, Kentucky. Deep golden. Aroma is citrus fruit then citrus citrus citrus. Taste is the same (citrus citrus) with some hop bitterness and caramel in the mix. Good finish. Nice pale, though citrus flavours aren¬ít my favourite in beer.

Three week young bottle pours a nice clear copper orange with some gold in the thin parts, eggshellish suds. The aroma is sweet and fruity with a malty tint. It starts malty and bready with a large pale ale feel, rich on all sides. The hops have a fresh deep complexity with some earthy green stalk, floral, light citrus pine, and light tree fruit flavors. The finishes with a little sparkle of carbonation and lasting floral orange peel hop bitterness with a touch of malty sweet. Pretty nice beer, strattles the line between a malty ipa and an overgrown American pale ale.
Tap. Light copper pour with half a finger of head. Citrus, pine, spice, and metallic. Easy to drink. Smooth with a nice balance of bitterness and sweetness. Long finish
tap. Amber with one finger head. It¬ís hard to find a brewery better at making hop bombs. This is an outstanding IPA.
Perfect!!! A great beer!!! Citrus hops with a little but of pine and sweetness to it. Smooth and delicious. The hops aren¬ít over powering and the hops blend really with the malt
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Deep fruity smell with dried fruit, citrus and hops. Similar taste. Very easy to drink. Just the right level of bitterness to balance out the sweetness.

Duft: citrus. lime grapefrugt. gran, appelsin

Amber malts hit the nose paired with some Citrus hops. Mouthfeel is adequate but the balance is great. Malts are loud but the hops keep up. Finish goes on a hoppy journey from earthy to citrus with a finish of grassy/piney. Really fun!!

---That dog will hunt!

Pours clear, dark golden, finger, thick, creamy head. Aroma citrus, earthy, piney floral hops, bready malt, slightly fruity. Taste fresh citrus, pine, earthy up front, bready malt, floral hops mid mouth slight bitterness lingers. Mouthfeel medium, medium carbonation, balanced finish . Overall tremendous, complex, balanced, huge flavor yet extremely drinkable. I do not see how a better pale ale could be made.

Bottle: pours a hazy orangish color with a big foamy white head. Aroma is resin, and some strong piney citrus smells. Some caramel as well. Taste is all hops at first, smacking you in the face with a bitter grapefruit and pine taste, after a bit, the nice biscuits and malt comes through. Very active carbonation makes this one a joy to drink.
Beautiful color, surprisingly sweet floral scent, full mouth feel. Everything you could want from the style, save a slightly more balanced finish.

Very good, but not even close to the best I¬íve had for a saturated style. Maybe circa 1999 this was ahead of its time. Now it¬ís just a well-balanced pale ale that does a great job of balancing the hop heavy nose with a malty body. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Soft carbonation, light bitter finish with some malt. Bottle thanks to bmoosey.

Great APA offering from FFF. Being in NY it¬ís hard to come by their beers, so I¬ím always happy when I can get them. A subtle dankness upon first pour subsides to a more grassy and citrusy hop smell and taste. Also has hints of maybe some caramel and nuts? APA is my favorite stlye so I was overall pleased with this.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 12 oz bottle poured into a vase-like glass. The very first whiffs are a skunky, marijuana-like smell, but this fades quickly. This is replaced with a sweet lemon and orange citrus aroma. Underneath that, there¬ís a heavy dose of resin, bubblegum, and pine. Later on a light, toasty bread aroma comes through. The body is a slightly hazy amber orange color topped by a soft, gelatin looking yellow-brown head. The head is big, soft, and fluffy, but slowly recedes to a sheet of light head on top. This leaves lots of lace down the glass. The taste strikes a beautiful balance between medium levels of sweet and bitter (Three Floyd¬ís strikes again!). The medium bodied beer has lots of active carbonation with resin-ish texture. The mouth starts out with a moderate pine and resin feel, but shortly gives way to sweet citrus and a hint of bubblegum. The sweetness becomes more prevalent as the drink warms. The finish is dry, crisp, and clean with mostly lemon and resin notes. This does linger for a bit, but it¬ís refreshing. After awhile, some toast and toffee notes start to come through in the finish and, more notably, in the aftertaste.

Old rating rerated 17.03.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, pine needles, sap, hops, nuts, knekk / toffee, grass, leafs, hints of licorice. Taste is slightly sweet, caramel malts, leafs, sap, nuts, pine needles, hops, knekk / toffee, bark, hints of licorice. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice, but maybe a little too sweet.

355 mL bottle. Dark and hazy for a pale ale, but who¬ís keeping track? Small, sticky, beige head. The aroma is citrus (orange) and melon, and is neither sweet nor overpowering. Very appealing. The flavour hits you all over up front - the citric hops are joined by mild caramel - and seems to stick to the inside of your mouth. Bitterness is perfect. The rare APA whose flavour doesn¬ít fade before it¬ís down your throat. This one is confident in its APA-ness - not trying to be an almost IPA.

12 oz bottle from Steve pours a dark cloudy thick looking honey colour 
smells like an IPA with more malt citrus grapefruit etc 
mmmm thick chewy bitter hops and malt very nice

Bottle @ home. Clear amber, big off white head, great lacing. Aroma, malty base, lots of hops, pine, citrus, grapefruit, floral, caramel. Taste, hops, pine, fruity, orange, citrus, grass, passion fruit, caramel. The bitterness doesn¬ít kick in at first, but then it hits you and last quite a while. Slightly oily mouth feel. Bitter aftertaste, with pine and caramel. Great pale ale.

Pour a slightly hazy amber, with a frothy one-fingered size white head.
Aroma has lots of citrus, slight lemon peel, floral, grass and slight caramel. A little mellowed up front, but plenty of hoppyness from the middle and out... A little strange at first, but works fine... 
The taste is pretty darn bitter, but has some sweet n¬í slightly malty notes ti back it up. Medium bodied, with plenty of fizzy (almost prickling/stinging) carbonation. I¬íd love to see how this is super fresh... Guess I¬íll have to plan a trip to Indiana...

Color cobrizo con espuma color crema densa. Aromas de frutas tropicales, miel y melocot√≥n. Textura melosa y sabor afrutado de inicio para acabar con un amargor resinoso equilibrado, aunque duradero. Muy rica, aunque pr√°cticamente es una IPA.

Growler from Historic Casanova Liquors 2 days after fill. Pours a quintessential amber with large, lasting beige head that leaves excellent lacing. Appearance is near perfect. Aroma is bright with orange and other sweet citrus, with some nice malt balance. Taste is lip-smacking juicy hops and a little pine with some sweet malt balance, into a moderately bitter finish that dries out but fades quickly, encouraging you to take another drink. Malts are bready, and some sips occasionally give a slight hint of roast. Really good overall.
Wow, fresh pour at the brewery. Great hop aroma and flavour. Definitely passes through the 4 pint test.
Bold, citrus hops, floral on the nose and palate as well. very bitter with an earthy flavor.

Pours dark amber 
good white head
smell is slightly hoppy, some malts . Bit sweet . 
Taste is hoppy ( cirtussy ) some honey , good mouthfeel. Bit bitter . 
Pretty simple, but nice

American pale ale
6.66% ABV 68 IBU 

APPEARANCE: Poured out a vibrant rust color. Star bright clear no haziness at all. Great big pillowy egg shell white head. Great retention and lacing. 

AROMA: Strong pine and citrus right away. Smells like breakfast of fresh squeezed orange juice and warm toast. Malty sweetness and carmel. 

TASTE: Another 3 Floyds APA that drinks like an IPA to me. Very piney and citrus right up front. Hops hit in the middle and rounds out with that great maltiness I got on the nose. Literally taste so good makes you want to slap yo mama!

MOUTHFEEL: Medium to light body along with the carbonation. Dry snappy finish that almost leaves you thirsty. 

OVERALL: Once again very impressed with a 3 Floyds brew. Still can't believe this is an APA reminds me of a wonderful low key west coast IPA. Would for sure try and get more of this goodness. 

RATING: 4.4/5 Zombie Heads! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Crystal clear crisp clean. Very well balanced citrus and a bit bready. Great body very smooth

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Amber/orange with thin white head. Big pine on the nose, caramel and sprucey notes in there, grapefruit coming in too. Taste gives plenty of pine and grapefruit, touch of pineapple, mango and orange in there. Good caramel backbone, some light nuttiness. Pine needles linger, as does orange peel and pithy grapefruit. For those drinkers out there looking for a legit ¬íbalanced¬í APA, this is your boy.

Citrus dominates the nose. Pours a clear burnt orange with a nice pillow like head, leaves some lacing behind. Taste starts with a citrus blast and ends with a wonderful dry bitterness. Full bodied palate, pure excellence. This pale is better than most breweries India. I wish I had three hands to shake all the Floyd¬ís hands.

Bottle. Pours a golden-deep orange with white head. Aromas are pine , caramel , tropical fruits and citrus. Taste , caramel , pineapple , sweet , citrus. Easy drinking with dry finish.
Average...
Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with a 2- fingers white head. Aroma and taste is sweet hops, malt, pine, and grapefruit. Just the right amount of bitterness. Top notch APA.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2014 35 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with an off-white head that leaves a lot of absolutely beautiful lacing. Aroma and flavour are plenty of caramel, grapefruit, and pine - with a dry finish. Not exactly the hoppiest of beers, but very nicely balanced. 

21/2 2014: 35 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with an off-white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, citrus, pine, and pepper - with a dry finish (3.9).
Pours a nice golden orange with a head of white foam. Aroma is really nice citrus and fresh pine. The taste is super smooth and easy drinking. Really nice.

Bottle thanks to FullObs. Pours dark amber with a big foamy head that fades normally but never goes completely away. Leaves great soapy webbing. Aromas are caramel apple, lemon, grapefruit, and flowers. Taste has almost no sweetness with a mild to moderate bitterness. Caramel apple is what I taste mostly and it¬ís really nice. The finish brings in the complexity with flowers, pineapple, grapefruit peel, and light pine. Mouthfeel is just a tad foamy. This is really good but not in the same class as Zombie Dust.
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2014 On tap at winks. Beautiful copper color. Full foamy head. Full glass lacing. Hoppy pale ale. Tasty.

Fresh 12 oz. bottle at home. Pours hazy copper with tall white head. Smell is lemon, and citrusy. Taste is a mix of hops and malts. Caramel and citrus taste. Not my favorite Three Floyd¬ís, but definitely a good overall beer.

Fresh bottle. Pours hazy copper with tall white head. Aroma is lemon, apple. Taste is nice hop bitterness balanced with strong malt backbone. Caramel, lemon. Very well balanced. Almost creamy on the tongue. So smooth and delicious.

Pours a dark orange with a big beige head and leaves very nice lacing. Aroma is citrusy, some pine, strong caramel backbone. Taste is decently hoppy with a hint of citrus, bigger floral and pine notes, the caramel flavor is very present as well. Pretty good beer, but zombie dust is still far better than this.

Pours a deep golden-orange gorgeous white fluffy head, nice retention and full, filmy lacing. Nose is bright and citrusy. Taste is incredibly balanced. The hop profile lends itself to this deliciously sweet malted backbone very well. The hops almost take a back seat to this sticky finish. Very long, very sweet and juicy. Just a classic beer.

12 oz bottle acquired in a trade. Pours bronze with a beautiful dense head. Nose is as good as it gets, full of citrus, pineapple and grapes. Taste is elderflower, citrus and some breadcrumbs. Quite sweet finish. Very enjoyable! Even better than Zombie Dust...

A - Hazy dark copper with a dense off white head, nice lacing on the upper portion of the glass.

S - Vibrant citrus hop aroma, caramel malts, hints of pine mixed in.

T - Candy citrus, lemon and bright orange flavors, green hops, a solid background of toasted barley and caramel, bitterness starts in the middle with and pairs with the carbonation for a peppery bite. Citrus peel and oils start coming out toward the end along with apricots and general stone fruit flavors. Finishes bitter with some orange oils left on the tongue.

M - Medium/heavy body, lively/stingy carbonation.

I¬íve been waiting a long time to try this beer and it did not disappoint. Fresh bright aroma, zesty citrus hop flavor with a spicy bitterness on the back end. Malt bill was perfect for the amount of hops used. Well crafted and highly enjoyed.

Serving type: bottle

08-24-2013
Gorgeous, absolutely worth the wait to try this one. Wish I was having it in July, not November, but oh well. Citrus and grapefruit hop deliciousness. Well done.

Bottle. Medium gold pour with a nice white head. Lacing is apparent here. Aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, and caramel. Wonderful flavors of mango, lemon, toasted grain, and finishing with more tropical fruit. Nice carbonation and body. Insanely drinkable and a joy in a glass. Damn

bottle. hazy amber. sweet floral whiffs with berries. full to medium bodied. flavors are bitter with pine, berry, fruit, and floral. several dimensions to this one. the slightest hint of tart. spicy centennial. solid. evergreen.

On tap at the three Floyd's Brew pub. Pours a beautiful copper amber, clear. Slight hops on the nose.full bodied with a nice bitterness. Smooth though. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big sticky sweet hop smell. Beautiful redish copper color. Nice full flavor citrus bitter with soft malt undertone.that keeps the flavor in a delicate balance. Stains the mouth with a grainy hop taste that fades slowly.

Color is a medium dark translucent amber. Smells of fresh oranges and hops. Taste of bitterness like an IPA. Pine, spruce and citrus flavor with very nice hoppyness. Very drinkable, gets better with each and every sip. Gets you wanting another and another. Best served at about 45 degrees. Very good APA from 3 floyds. Better than Zombie Dust in my opinion.

So this is a crazy good APA. If it weren¬ít for pseudosue stealing my heart a few days ago.. I would have a new favorite... Amazing tropical fruit nose. Mango, papaya, and melon. You great sweet fruity notes in the mouth with a citrus hop bitterness. I could drink this all day.

12oz bottle (12/3/13) pours semi-clear reddish brown with 2 finger head. Nose is malty pine, floral, and subtle lemon. Taste is smooth malt and juicy fruit, pine, lemon. Finish is smooth mild bitter pine and sweet fruity malt. Nice.

The aroma fills your nose with citrus with just a little bit of piney. Appears a deep amber with a quarter inch head that dissipates but leaves sticky residue as it settles. Taste is juicy grapefruit up front and tapers into a bitter rind and ends with just the right amount of bitter citrus. Palate has a good amount of carbonation with a slightly sticky feel but doesn¬ít hang around for too long. Overall, a great apa that brings down what others call their ipa.

On tap at three floyds brewpub. Pours dark amber with moderate white head. Good lacing on the glass as you drink. Sweet malt and piney hop aroma. Not very bold aroma. Taste is hoppy and dry initially finishing with a malty, caramel sweetness. Very good and smooth. Good pale.

I really wish I could get this locally. Easy enough to drink that it is sessionable, but so beautifully crafted that each taste deserves appreciation. Read someone else¬ís review if you want the opinion of someone with a great palate - All i know is this is delicious.

Thanks (again!) to Jrod1969 for this extra!
Poured to NB globe.

A: Pours a cherry orange ale with supreme clarity. A 2.5 finger peanut head falls to 0.5 finger. No apparent carbonation. Jesus, lacing like a corset!

S: Mmmm. Beautiful malts help accentuate the herbal, piney, resinous hop profiles. Goddam, this keeps me leaning in. The nose reminds me of a really good red ale, not really so much a Pale, but I ain¬ít a hater.

T: The malts die down a bit here. Allowance for the hops to shine, provide the bitterness and balance I anticipated in the nose. There¬ís a woodiness and oaky profiling that nearly dominate the entire palate experience. 

M: Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Slight slickness initially, then dies out within seconds. Average.

D: This beer is drinkable. However, the taste puts me off a bit. Wish there were less early bittering hops to prevent such severe dryness.

Serving type: bottle

02-16-2011

Bottle from my personal Santa - thank you so much, Blafa! The APA poiurs out in a amber colour with steady low head and medium body. Nice aroma of hops and citrus. Wonderful taste of fresh hops, spices, coriander, herbs, spruce and citrus. Light hints of caramel and torf. I enjoyed this beer big time, really quaffable and refreshing at once.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Never ever I would have expected to drink a 100 score beer tasting like...puuh. This is the first time ever I met a beer which tastes like pure medicine. Bit of wood in the first nose, some malt maybe, but in the end just pure chemical bitterness. Crazy stuff. Maybe my toungue is an exception but it does count as any other. Awful stuff.
Pours an amber color with little white head. No lacing. Happy and slightly bitter at first. Has a nice citrusy flavor with hints of pine. Great carbonation and overall a good beer.
Ive recently discovered 3 floyds and ive been nothing but impressed. Great flavor.....

Recently had zombie dust by Three Floyds which is one of the best beers I've ever had. Decided to try Alpha King. Tasted from bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber with off white head. Good lacing. Aroma of citrus, flowers and pine. Taste is moderate sweetness with a nice lading bitterness. Very well balanced. Tastes of citrus, caramel, pine. Medium bodied with a fairly creamy mouthfeel. Very good pale ale but a step below zombie dust in my opinion. Can't go wrong with Three Floyds. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber hazy. Fresh pine needle notes. Resins. Good carbonation. Dry light ale body. Fine balanced bitter finish. Not that exceptionel.

The King. The easiest 3F beer to find, and easily one of their best (which is obviously saying something). Darker appearance, hop bomb with an interesting malt balance. The taste is equally amazing and unique; one that would be hard to miss in a blind taste test if you were familiar with it. Just a phenomenal beer, period.
Great blond beer. Very balanced taste. No weak points. Good taste. Awesome.

Bottle thanks to J. Pours deep amber with frothy offwhite head, decent retention, some lacing. Aroma: citrus, caramel/candi. Also cat. Surprisingly thick texture, almost viscous. Taste: moderate sweetness, lasting bitterness, a little cardboard. Overall: tasty enough brew, but doesn't really set itself apart from any number of tasty pale hoppy brews out here. Maybe age matters a lot for this one? Bummer on the lack of bottle date.

Bottle shared at a tasting at tom¬ís place. Thanks RobertDale for the trade! Hazy amber with white head. Sweet fruity aroma, very faint citrus. Re orange bitterness in the mouth, but soft and very drinkable. Full-bodied, mildly citric, very smooth finish.
Orange nice head. Nose is piney with grapefruit. Very creamy mouthfeel. Orange blossom and some herbal qualities. It¬ís very good. Like drinking bitter and citrus rose petals.

One of the best Pale Ales that I have come across in a long while! Now I know why this is Three Floyds Flagship beer! Very glad it is easy to come by locally!

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Citrus aroma with hoppy smell. Taste is pretty standard IPA with citrus taste (similar to grapefruit juice). Pretty good.

(24/11/13, Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends, CPH) Pours clear deep orange with a bubbly head. Aroma of malts, alcohol, lots of grapefruit, a bit of mango, pear and orange. Quite sweet taste, very smooth, grapefruit with a slight bitterness, not as fresh or hoppy as I had expected, and has a weird malty-burned body. Was told this was fairly fresh, doesn¬ít taste so though.
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with hops, citrus, caramel, peach and resin. Bitter taste with citrus, resin and floral hops. Exquisite american pale ale.

Very good beer, as good as any other in this style I have tried. Pours a deep amber with a thick light tan head. Strong citrus aroma and bitter flavor throughout. Good malt undertones in the background. A bit too bitter to be considered as very refreshing.

Hazy Dark Brown Color, Huge Long Lasting Foamy Head, Decent Strings Of Lace. Fresh and Lively Pine Floral Hop Aroma. Malty, Mild Pine, Floral Hops. Balanced sweetness with Bitter Finish. Smooth Medium Body. Real Easy To Drink. Tasty. Enjoyed It. Recommended. Good Luck Finding It....
Bottle via unknown, trade. Pours a medium brownish orange, little to no head. This was a gusher! Aroma rich, boozy, malty. Body somewhat lively, finish dull. Could suffer a bit from age...

Solid Pale Ale, great balance of malts and hops. Well rounded and balanced all the way. Nice balance of toast and hoppy goodness. Makes an excellent session beer!

FROM NOTES: July 22, ¬í12
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass. 

A: Huge pine, citrus, and tropical fruit with a faint buicuit malt body. 
A: Pours a translucent, slightly golden amber with a thin layer of head that dissipates into spotty lacing.
T: Grapefruit and pine with an earthy and dank finish. Lightly bitter and clean, very complex and unique for an APA. 
P: Medium with nice carbonation and a creamy texture. 
O: For those of you who can drink this all the time, I am insanely jealous. Tons of hop flavor and aroma, but enough balance from the malt that it never crosses in to IPA territory. Incredibly well balanced with a nice hop bitterness.

Bottle from chalet party shop. Pours clear copper with a medium sized off white head. The aroma is full of tropical fruit, mango, pineapple. The taste is lightly bitter, sweet mango, a bit more pineapple.
Very nice citrusy, piney aroma. Taste is pretty consistent with the aroma. If this was my style of beer, I would likely rate it higher. It¬ís very refreshing.
On tap at the Three Floyds Brewpub. Dark amber pour with lots of lacing. Warm citrus aroma. Full flavor. Very hop forward. Nice flavor. Slight bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a bright clear reddish gold with a light head. Floral and herbal hop notes with a sweet taste and a touch of rhubarb. A flavorful and mildly bitter finish. An excellent pale ale.

Bottle sample at a tasting at tom¬ís place. Thanks kerenmk. Pours orange to brown hazy with a medium head, aroma of marmalade, malt, caramel and some floral notes, flavor is bitter with grapefruit, orange, malt, sweetness, medium bodied

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin white head. Clear amber pour. A lovely hoppy beer. Very smooth.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with 2 fingers of a white head. Aromas of sweet hops, malt, pine, and grapefruit. Tastes follows the nose with heavy caramel, followed by a resinous bitterness. Another great beer from 3Floyds.
Aroma:, citrus, caramel. App: deep red, small head. Taste: hops and citrus. Palate: medium mouth good finish. Overall: very enjoyable

12oz bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Citrus, caramel, fruity. Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. Excellent pale ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2013 Tap at the Map Room, Chicago. Poured a clear medium amber with a thin white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is hoppy grass citrus fruit. The flavour is medium bitter with a malty liqourice hoppy bitter citrus palate. A pretty damn good pale ale!

Growler. Pour is red amber with white head. Aroma is citrus, roasted malt, spices, pine, slight resin. Taste is roasted malt and grain, earthy and pine hops, some citrus, rich bitterness complemented by some sweetness.
Bottle->SA. Copper with big frothy offwhite head. A: medium citrus hops, sweet grass. T: bittersweet citrus hops, fruit. Excellent. Best APA that I have had.
Great citra pale ale. Clean pour, excellent citra aroma. Tatse is citra smooth, great mango flavor. Excellent beer - just a notch below zombie dust!

Bottled. Clear amber beer, thick creamy head. Aroma is loaded with citrus, mango, pollen and some resins with a hint of creamy caramel malts - very fresh indeed. Its has nice, dry pale ale maltiness, some darker caramel tones and even some nuts. Good body without being sweet. Residaul sweetness is swept away by resiny bitterness. Very good balance.

Draught at the Three Floyds Brewpub, Munster, IN.
Clear red golden colour with a small foamy off-white head.
Fresh hops, fruits, sweetness, caramel malt and some sugary sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavour is incredibly balanced. Fresh hop cones, fruitiness, mild resin, pine, moderate bitterness and malt in the flavour. Smooth. Very tasty. Extremely tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 On draft at Three Floyds after the Bourbon County debacle in Chicago. The pour is really dark. Ambery caramel orange with a thin white head and lots of soapy lace. The aroma is incredibly malty. There is a resounding bitterness and a light sweet caramel at the end. The flavor is just as not good. There is a bitter caramel and a light sweetness. Tons of malt. The mouth feel is lighter and not very well carbonated with a lingeringly bitter sweet malt. It¬ís really different.
Pours a nice color. Light brownish head. Delicious malt taste in head followed by a decent hoppy flavor. Great beer
Pours a nice amber color. Not much aroma for me but the taste makes up for that. 3 floyds never dissapoints for me.

Danish pour @ a group tasting. Nice light gold pour with a slight white head. Big citrus and grass aroma. Nice solid pale ale. Would take zombie dust over it any day, but wouldn¬ít fight anybody trying to give me one.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is mainly citrus but also some red berries, resin and malt sweetness. Medium sweet with a very smooth bitterness in the background all the way. Finish is a smooth dry lingering bitterness.
Pours a golden color with white head. This tastes like a IPA to me. Has a huge hop profile on the nose and tongue. Either way, this is descent beer.

This one blows me away every time. It seems more like a fall ipa than an apa, and if it were an ipa it would be in my top five. Its like biting into a caramel orange with toasted mango filling. Was far and away the best apa in the world until FFF surpassed their own standard with zombie dust. Go get some right now!

Bouteille de 12 oz. Merci beaucoup √† Dany! Ar√¥mes tr√®s invitants de houblons am√©ricains, citriques (pamplemousse) et r√©sineux. Robe cuivr√©e et limpide, peu de mousse et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, les houblons montrent un agr√©able caract√®re aromatique (pamplemousse, r√©sine) et sont accompagn√©s de l√©g√®res notes caram√©lis√©es. Finale moyennement am√®re pour le style. Bottled:Clear amber with a large and thick head. Aroma is tropical fruit, tea and hops; smells good. Flavour is hops and tropical fruit followed by a long bitterness. Really good!

On tap at Mikkeller, a really beautiful glowing amber IPA with a nice beige head. The aroma is mostly citrus, especially lemon, with some pine or herbal notes. Full bodied with a great taste of grape, tropical fruits, soft bitter finish with mild puckering. A really good IPA that is more fruity than bitter which is what I enjoy.
Very smooth ipa, bitter, fruity tastes and smells. Spicy sweet finish.........

Bottled. Clear golden amber with a nice mediumsized off white head. Grapefruit. Toffee. Caramel. Pine. Hoppy and malty. Well balanced. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness. High drinkabillity. Casual sex in a bottle.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 Picked this up from work because I¬íd really grown to love pretty much anything out of Three Floyds, but seeing their logo on a six-pack was new for me. I¬íd always gotten their taller bottles after falling in love with Arctic Panzer Wolf.

Trying out the Alpha King turned out to be a real treat. What a great beer! 
The color is dark reddish and my pour produced a finger or two of tan colored head which was surprisingly thick. Aroma is big hops with some floral notes and what looking back was defiantly grapefruit. Taste comes right at you with big hops and a somewhat assertive bitterness that¬ís actually mellowed somewhat with the malt and caramel aftertaste. Though very hoppy and bitter, this is a remarkably smooth I.P.A. Overall it was just a fantastic beer. Well balanced, tasty, refreshing: everything an I.P.A should strive to be. We¬íve still got two 6-packs left at my shop and I think they just might be coming home with me.

Pours beautiful copper with thin off white head. Aroma is bready malt and floral and citrus hops. Taste is sweet bready malt upfront with some nice crisp floral and citrus hops on the follow through. Aftertaste is sweet malt with some bitter piny hops. Palate is medium with some stickiness. Overall this is an outstandingly balanced American Pale Ale......malty, hoppy, sweet, bitter.

Snifter pour, reddish amber color with a finger of surprisingly thick beige head that lingers. Rich aroma of hops and a hint of malt. Delicious taste. Hops up front with a great malt follow through. Significant lacing on the glass. Medium mouthfeel with a nice hoppy bite. 

Great beer
clear gold brown with off white head. Aroma is grapefruit rind and hops. Taste is medium sweet and bitter.

12oz bottle. Poured into my DFH IPA glass. No date stamp on the bottle, but I guess 3 Floyds doesn¬ít need one. Mildly hazy darker amber color. Nice big foamy off-white head, with excellent retention. Leaves excellent lace. Awesome big hoppy nose. Citrusy, tropical fruit, little pine. Very nice big orange zest aroma. Smells like a fresh, hoppy, balanced IPA. Flavor is just as awesome, but with a lot more spicy hop, and caramel malt. Amazing how assertive the hop is in this. Moderate to stronger bitter taste, light bit of sweet, some spiciness in the taste. Medium-plus body. lighter, kind of crisp carbonation, lightly sticky finish. So, regardless of style, this is an awesome, big bitter hoppy beer. Very sticky, resiny, and tasty. But I¬íd definitely lump this into the IPA category. It¬ís very big.
Good pale ale. The hops are pretty large with moderate bitterness that is a bit high for a pale ale. Aroma and taste is lemon, resin, and tropical notes with a dry bitter finish.

Poured 8/18/13. Medium amber color with a thin but resilient just off-white head. Aroma is potent floral, grass, citrus with more subtle pine notes. Straight forward; nice. Taste is highly floral, perfume-like; grass, floral, citrus, lemon zest, grapefruit rind, lightly alcoholic, slightly herbal. Nice lacing. Medium carbonation. Medium bodied. Fantastically flavorful and aromatic; truly top notch.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 12 oz bottle, undated but of very recent vintage according to the salesperson, served in a Belgian snifter. 

A; Dark red-amber,definitely dark for style, with a modest size bone-colored head that has very good retention and lacing. Lightly hazy. 

Smells unique, partly due to the unfamilair Warrior hops I suppose, with a very balanced and integrated aroma that reflects both malts and hops. 

T: also, nicely balanced. A little less fruity, more herbal and a bit less bitter than CPA (see below), but as tasty overall, if a bit less intense, and perhaps even more easy drinking. 

O: Excellent!! I had my first Alpha King immediately after an excellent Odd Side Ales CPA, and suspected it might pale (excuse me) by comparison. Well, it¬ís different, but similar in both sensory properties and quality. Glad I have more! 
(revisited 2-3x now; surprisingly superb on all occasions)
Draft sample. Dark golden. Nose sweet mango hop. Slight resin. Taste initial fruity bite, hop mid palate sweet. Bitter finish

Pours light amber with a moderate hop aroma. Slight burst of hops at the beginning but finishes very malty with strong notes of caramel.

Wow, Just Wow. perfectly balanced, perfectly drinkable. What a pale ale used to be about. A perfect marriage of malt and hop.

Pours orange to brick red with slightly cloudy body. A thick, three finger off-white head with excellent retention and nice lacing. Strong orange notes dominate the nose with a hint of pine needle and faint caramel as well. Orange hits the palate first delivering a strong citrusy taste that‚Äôs faintly tart. The next notes are sweeter - sherbet and caramel. Alpha King finishes dry and slightly bitter, with faint resin notes. Medium bodied, not quite as chewy as an IPA, but pretty close. The carbonation is lively. Overall this might be the finest example of an American Pale Ale out there. Great work 3Floyds.
