Bottled. Pour amber with off white head. Smell hops and more hops. Taste hops, citrus, zest and a good amount of grapefruit. The beer has some bitterness to it and its very refreshing. Make sure to drink this beer fresh.

Pours a deep golden color with a frothy off-white head that hangs in there for a while. Aroma is bright citrus - perhaps grapefruit - with a hint of tart berry and some floral notes. Taste is a delightful bouquet of hoppy bitterness with an undercurrent of mellow malty sweetness. Aftertaste is slightly astringent and reminiscent again of grapefruit. Nice body and lively carbonation. Excellent Pale Ale!
Deep amber pour with a small off-white head. Aroma is big on citrus and hops and a little pine. flavor is super smooth, the hops are big, but not overpowering. a great beer.

Bottle at Bodega Brewpub. Pours dark orange with an inch of white foam that rapidly disappears. Doesn¬ít leave much lacing in the glass. A bit of grapefruit on the nose. Bigger citrus notes on the tongue with a fair amount of bitterness. Pretty good for style but I don¬ít know if it¬ís number 3 in style.
Aroma is citrus nut, appearance is dark, taste is citrus caramel, overall very drinkable
Growler at home. Pours orange with a white head. Aroma is Citrusy, earthy, hoppy. Flavor is citrus, pine, hoppy, earthy. I like this one.
Great citrus and resin nose. Lots of nice citrus with awesome hops kick. Just enough malt to add balance. A true classic

deep orange pour with slightly off-white head. aroma is citrus hops and sweet caramel malts. taste is more of the same, with candied fruits coming through and a strong caramel malt backbone to balance out the intense citrus hop flavor. full bodied, with a smooth finish that features more of the sweet candied fruit notes. delicious; drinks like a high-end IPA.

Dark orange, almost red in color with a bright white head. Sweet, sticky, hoppy nose with caramel noticeable, but with hops still dominating. My kind of pale! It¬ís easy and uneventful on the mouth, but the hops really make this an enjoyable beer. It finishes clean, with the hop bitterness fading fast, leaving behind remnants of a piney, stiff hop flavor to linger gently on the palate for a half minute or so. Nice... I wish all pale ales had this much hop flavor, hop aroma, and bitterness. A great pale ale.

On tap @ The Map Room. Pours bright golden amber with thick creamy head that laces well. Aroma is a hint of pale malt and big bitter fresh hop notes. Taste is clean mild caramel malt followed by big juicy fresh hops. Notes of pine, grapefruit, and juicy citrus throughout the hops. Finishes bitter, but very drinkable. Impressive beer, particularly as a pale ale.

pours a rich copper with plentiful off white head-- citrus herbal aroma and a flavor explosion right from the start--hoppy with a perfect malt backbone and lingering medium bitter finish--this is an IPA in most places--Rock On 3 F¬ís

bottle thanks to tom10101! pours hazy golden-amber-orange with a short-lived off-white head, some lacing. earthy, nutty, dusty and dry caramel, grassy yet citrusy and lightly piney, fruity oranges, tobacco and dirt. moderate carbonation, light body - some texture, very dry, crisp and aromatic spicy-earthy-citrusy finish. very well executed but not so much my style!

One of my favorites

Bold citrus hop character without being too overpowering
Bottle at chopkofest pours copper hue. Lots of citrus up front, pine on the finish, ample bitterness keeps things moving.

This is my favorite beer. It pours with a creamy head. I appreciate the aroma of this particular variety. 

It's not cheaply made. The ingredients are of quality and they don't skimp. I've not tasted an other American pale ale that compares.

As of today 6.21.13 this is my favorite beer

Bottle thanks to Rmill216. Pours hazy copper, with think creamy tan head. Aroma of citrus hops, and caramel malt. Taste is a tad bitter, and earthy. Caramel, walnuts, and a bit of alcohol on the end. A very solid Pale Ale.

Thanks to the interweb I was able to indulge in what Munster has to offer. Best IPA outside of California or even Yeti country. I probably had misplaced expectations due to its What I got was a solid IPA and I will gladly pay it¬ís due ransom to sample the rest of the lineup. However, would it be less phonomenal if it was as easy to find as Stone or Sierra Nevada?
Bottle pour Amber single finger head. Citrus grass aroma. Hops is well blended with malt. even though this beer isn¬ít fresh, it¬ís still fantastic.Will try to get more in the future.
amber, cloudy color, thin lace. smooth hop smell. Perfect balance. palate finishes early.
Amazing beer. Smooth and hoppy. Clean and crisp. Had on tap at three floyds. Very nice.

Wow! With all the hop bombs and intense porters you find from microbreweries these days, it¬ís a joy to find a simple and essentially perfect APA. Piney, lemony, perfectly balanced. So fresh. Was surprised to find it on tap in an Irish Pub in Chicago (D4). Wish I had room for a keg of this in my suitcase. Even better, I wish I could buy this beer in Ontario.

From a bottle into a glass mug on my back deck July the 4th. Light brown with one finger white head. Sweet and fruity nose, smooth and well balanced, an excellent pale ale, would like to go for another ... Could this be the taste of freedom?

On tap at CBC 2012. Deep golden in the glass, small head. Intense hoppy aroma. Starts flowery-hoppy, hints of lemon. Grasy notes in the finish. Well balanced finish, quite drinkable. Not too dry. Nice!
Grass and pine aromas. Pours a dark amber with a thick off white head. Taste of citrusy hops balanced perfectly with sweet malts. The bitter finish leaves you craving another sip.

Bottle thanks to Tom, many, many thanks! Aroma is grapefruity resiney pine goodness. Looks is quite spectacular with a really deep copper robe topped by a thin white head that leave some lacing. Taste is quite balanced, or at least balanced to my tastes (toward hops). Mouthfeel is good with a medium level of carbonation. Flavors are piney with a sour twang, tangerine-like. Overall a really well made (A/I)PA!

Bottle (12 oz). Thanks Matt! Clear golden/amber with a persistent medium off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is intensely hoppy with citrus, pine and perfumes notes. Taste is slightly sweet with citrus, perfume, pine and light bitterness. Slightly dry palate. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. I think it¬ís more of an IPA than an APA, but either way it¬ís a good tasty and refreshing beer.

This is by far my favorite 3 floyds beer. This is a very stout beer and do not recommend to any one who their favorite beer is a lite beer. This is one of the more flavorfull beers had in a long while

Big thanks to my Pops for bringing this back from Indiana for me. Funny enough, another less celebrated American Pale Ale from Indiana, the Flat 12 Walkabout, tickled my fancy more than this brew. Pours a slightly hazy dark amber with white head and excellent lacing. Scent is passion fruit with hints of citrus and grain. It is bitter up front with a slightly sweet yet astringent finish. The body is medium light. A damn fine beer, but I am hoping Zombie Dust brings a lot more to the table. Bottle - Liquor Locker - Evansville, IN
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2013 Bottle from chase, thanks! Pours dark amber with nice head, aroma is nice grassy and pine resin, taste is rich sweet malt and bitter finish, excellent!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 Smells nice and hoppy with good citrus notes. Color is great, just what you would expect. Palate is full of citrus hops. Fine beer.

Deep amber pour; fluffy white head. Aggressive hopping shows itself, spewing forth fresh hoppy goodness into my nostrils. Mainly earthy and piney with a splash of citrus. 

Strongly hopped on the palate, yet these intense flavors layer softly atop my taste buds. Piney hop remnants playfully slap the back of my throat on the way down. This approaches the line of over-hopping without crossing it. 

Good, but I will never choose this when Zombie Dust is available.
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 12oz. Bottle at a tasting with Eric Teusink and Westmeister. Strong Citrus Light Mocha. Poured a burnt orange with a creamy  head. please. Distribute. to. ATL.
Pours golden amber with an off-white head. Smells malty and citrusy. Taste is  light, clean, with a bitter finish. Good beer but I wasnt blown away.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 The color of this beer is a dark orange color with a medium frothy head, and the aroma has loads of citrus and resin hops with some low-level butteriness lying underneath. The taste is mildly bitter, slightly sweet, and a touch sour with an aftertaste full of citrus and grassy hops, and the palate combines a slick texture, medium body, and a soft carbonation.

Bottle from three Floyd¬ís. aroma is sweet caramel, citrus, mango, and a touch of pine. Flavor is citrus, tropical fruit, caramel, pine, and mango. Amazing beer more of a Ipa than a pale ale too me. Extremely balanced and loaded with flavor. Amazing beer!!!

Draught @ Mikkeller&Friends. Pours clear red/amber with a good lacing and fully lasting frothy off-white medium head. Aroma is red berries, caramel, flowery, citrus, pine, toasted malts and grass. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is smooth, carbonation is soft. Finishes sweet with bitterness and lingering fruit.

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours slightly hazy amber with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of hops with notes of citrus. Intense, bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of pine needles, grass and citrus. Dryish aftertaste. Yummy.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2013 Every really good beer has some characteristic which is phenomenal.  Here, it¬ís the finish which is long and lovely.  Aroma is not pronounced but flavor is rich and appealing if not racy.  Sweetness from malt is mild but sustaining counterpoint to a backbone of bitterness in balance with hop resiny hop flavor.

Dark amber colour, white head. Aroma of hops, tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus and grapefruit. Hoppy bitter flavour, somewhat sweet, apricot, tropical fruits, lots of hops. Hoppy finish, bitter, some honey.
Nice and balanced!
(From 33cL bottle @ ZZT VII afterparty. Thanks for sharing, kermis!!)

Very balanced taste, aroma was lacking just a little. Overall great body, would highly recommend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2013 Pours a copper amber color with a fat, long-lasting caramel colored head. Nice balance of lemony aromatic hops and biscuit and caramel malt. Mouthfeel is slick, wet and full. Sweet malt is balanced well with a heavier resinous bittering hop. I cut my teeth on this beer many years ago.

Appearance:
Deep garnet with copper edges under a tight off-white head which fades into a thin layer marked by tiny bubbles. Swirls with lace and bubbles.

Nose:
Grab pine tree in hand ¬ñ shove face into its branches, needles, and bark ¬ñ inhale deeply and don¬ít stop. Wow! Pine forest in a glass with a river of lemon zest underneath and apple skins in the back for some crisp crunch.

Palate:
Clean bodied with medium weight. Crunchy melba and toast underneath along with red apple skins. Pine trees explode atop my tastebuds while grapefruit and mint weave in and out. Boldly balanced. Menthol and pine mingle in my breath. Bitterness of hop leaves and resins instigate a never ending thirst. A bit more lemon on the back top of my tongue followed by quaff and repeat, leaving not a single drop behind.

Final Thoughts:
Sometimes a highly rated hyped beer is just that, hype, but in the case of Alpha Kind from Three Floyds Brewing, there is no hype, just lip smacking tastetacular sessionability I could drink day in and day out¬Öif I lived a little bit closer. Until we meet again¬Ö

(An original written work by Beer Ambassador, LLC. Plagiarism is not tolerated.)

Can¬ít believe its taken me this long to try this beer, but i finally tried it .. . deep gold .. mild head, lacing is quite good .. . sappy honey hops .. . mild mouth feel .. . all around, very good but perhaps left in the dust a bit .. . . sometimes I hear musicians talk about a "wet drum sound." I like that.
Really good pale ale.  Citrusy aroma, citrusy taste.  Pretty balanced, not over the top bitter.  Really solid.
Very good. Nice taste, good finish. I have to admit that three Floyd¬ís was almost mythical prior to trying...and did not disappoint.
355ml bottle.  Pours dark cloudy amber with a living head . bitter and fresh hoppy aroma.  soft bitter taste with some sweet caramel notes and dry finish. a very balanced ipa.

Pint at Chumley¬ís in Lafayette, IN. Clear copper with a small light tan head. Rich pine and resin, deep caramel, congress very close to an IPA. Medium body, gentle effervescence. A nice blend of rich caramel and toffee malts with good pine and resin, grapefruit, nice; dry with nice bitterness and a richly malty and fruity hops finish.
Tasted this on tap at the 8th Street Ale Haus in Sheboygan, Wisconsin so I didn¬ít get great notes. Delicious! Complex, balanced, hoppy.

On tap at Apex for Gigantic Beer Week. 

A: Nearly red with a thin white head. Fairly translucent.

N: Good nose with a pure pineapple and pine nose. A hin tof mango, some earth, and plenty of malt shining through. 

T: Well balanced while leaning towards the hoppy side. Lots of biscuit, and plenty more of the pine. Showcases the hops well. 

M: Dry with a round mouthfeel. It¬ís quite light and very easy to drink. 

O: Cleans out the palate while remaining easy to put back. I would have this any time, and I¬ím really glad I was able to try it on tap. It¬ís strange how good Three Floyds is with APA and yet their DIPAs are at best, average.

On draught at Gigantic¬ís Chicagoland Beers event at Apex. Dark amber color. Hoppy citrus aroma. Malty and hoppy, with a nice balance of light citrus and smooth malt. Finishes with lingering malt. Might be the best American Pale I¬íve had.
On tap at Mikkeller & friends. Copper colour with white long-lasting head. Hoppy aroma, with fruits and some caramel. Fruity taste, not so bitter, with some malts and caramel. Light body.
One of the easiest to drink beers. Great hop choices make for great aroma and hoppy citrus taste without the bitter after taste of an IPA.

On tap. Pours a beautiful hazy dark amber with low off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, toffee, bread, fruit, light citrus. Taste is incredibly balanced, sweet caramel with a very distinct yet nuanced bitterness. Long, godly bitter malt finish. Light body with soft to average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours a murky medium amber. Nose is very clean, with tropical fruits and caramel. Taste is peach and apricot with caramel, grass and resin. Very very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared with kermis @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy amber with an off-white head

Cold bottle.  No head, murky red brown colour.  Smells of kiwi and citrus.   Nice.  Taste - spice up front, then watery and finishes with malt and tang.  Best aspect of the beer is the malty aftertaste.  Very little bitterness.  Not bad, but less flavour than expected.

Pours a dark amber with a nice white head of foam.  Smells of caramel malt with some citrus hops.  The taste starts off with bitterness, then moves to a nicely balanced malt and citrus hops.  This is not as hop forward as I remembered it being when I first had it.  I suppose this is due to palate shift.

12oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of citrusy and floral hops, a little bubble gum, and a good amount of caramel malts.  Flavor the same with a lot of citrusy hops.  Average to smooth texture.  A pretty good pale ale.

On this on tap at the three Floyd¬ís bar. It came with a nice thick slightly brown head and is an transparent amber. It has a nice caramel malty aroma and tastes like caramel malts and cirtrus hops. One of my favorites.

Had on tap at the three floyds brewpub. Pours dark amber with a nice thick head. Aroma is citrus with a little hop finish. Taste is great. Huge amount of hops balanced perfectly. Bitter. Citrus with a hint of caramel. Great great beer

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2013 Pours dark amber with low white head
Aromas of tropical fruits, caramel malts
Very pleasant hoppy taste full with resin, caramel malts and citrusy fruits. Great balance for an APA. Just the perfect bitterness that is built up by a great maltyness.

Draft. The pour is a murky orange, some head. The aroma is strong of citrus and hops. The taste is smooth as hell. Just the right blend of hops that it is almost huge with hops and mellow at the same time. No bitterness at all, and almost a sweet finish to it. Wow this is a great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear orange with a thick bubbly good lacing off white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits; mango, papaya, light pineapple, caramel, butterscotch, Swedish flatbread. Taste is medium sweet and light+ bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Soft finish with caramel, citrus and tropical fruits.
Near perfect beer. Wonderful aroma with citrus, orange and hops with a smooth hoppy taste. The best pale ale I have had to date!
Bottle. Very solid pale ale with lots of hop flavor and a medium body. Assertive without the extra bitterness of an IPA.

Excellent beer is all I can say.  The best ale I've had in a really long time.  Fantastic aroma, smooth, great balance, nice head. Loved it in so many ways.

---Grant---
Outstanding to say least. Pretty big for an APA. But great nevertheless. Poured with a 1/2 inch white head. Excellent effervescence. Piny aroma. Crisp drink clean finish. Awesome.
Bottle pour straight from Indiana.  First 3F I¬íve had and color me impressed.  Flirting the line with IPA this is a phenomenal beer with great aromas and bitterness.

12-oz bottle.
Great beer, slightly bitter, grapefruit and citrus notes come through. THe alcohol content is perfect at 6.66% (more or less fits the name). Not the best APA, but definitely a great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 On tap at the Map Room. Grapefruit aroma, nicely balanced with sweetness. Very nice.
Re-rate with a bottle sample. Still just as nice, flavourful, maybe a touch boozy, but rating remains unchanged.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a slightly cloudy dark orange with a half finger off-white head.  Aroma of citrus and grapefruit. Taste is light bitter. Citrus, grapefruit, light pine and light caramel. Full bodied with a thick creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good. Thanks to StFun for sending it my way.

On draught...dark orange, very light brown in color. Hop citrus aroma with a good malt backbone. Taste translates. Was not blown away, but a good beer never the less for this style. Enjoyable and would certainly drink again.

12oz bottle. Pours a golden orange color with 2 fingers of a white head. Aromas of sweet hops, malt, pine, and grapefruit. Tastes follows the nose with heavy caramel, followed by a resinous bitterness.
At home from a bottle.  Strong citrus smell followed by a fresh hop scent.  Citrus hops and zest taste and a little grapefruit.  One of my favorites.

"Alpha King drink this beer all day!"

Well, I would if I had easy access to it. Anyway!

Appearance: A brown/copper color with a nice, bubbly, somewhat tan head. Lacing¬ís patchy, but it has a great, clear appearance overall.

Smell: What do I say? It has a brilliant malty and hop balance. On one sniff it smells of caramel sweetness, and on the next it smells of hoppy deliciousness. Extremely inviting.

Taste/feel: Just an awesome beer. The most dominant flavor that I get is of a quality, caramel malt on the start. The finish is super clean, and offers a burst of fresh hops. Not only is this beer pretty much perfectly balanced, it has an outstanding flavor. There¬ís virtually no aftertaste, which makes me want to keep going back for another sip. Alpha King¬ís a worthy flagship beer at Three Floyds, and one of my absolute favorite beers overall. I can only hope that they ship this stuff to Michigan some day soon.
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends, cph - Fuzzy dark orange/amber colour with a medium white head. Citrus, pine and caramel malts, nice sweet and bitter balance, very enjoyable and impressive.
Bottle @¬†home... It pours clear amber with a small fluffy white head....The aroma is fresh hops, fruit, grapefruit and citrus.....The flavor is fresh hops, grapefruit and citrus.....Very nice!

Bottle, 355ml - Semi hazy amber beer with a moderate sized head. Aroma is fruity with notes of pine, citrus, grapefruit, caramel and pineapple. Flavor is fruity with notes of pine, oranges, grapefruit and some caramel. Body is surprisingly light considering the aroma. Great and very fresh APA.

Large grapefruit aroma, lesser caramel profile. Bitter citrus taste is just above moderate without going over the top, splits the difference between its style and a strong IPA type. Nice malt balance, though I¬íd be pressed to call it sweet. Hearty body that¬ís smooth yet filling.Good example of where traditional pale ales are going.

Pours a very hazy copper with white head. Aroma is Grapefruit citrus. Grapefruit, citrus, maybe even a little melon taste from the hops. Fairly bitter but not overly so, very refreshing, though its medium bodied. Lots of pine in  the aftertaste in addition to the citrus. Caramel malt, almost taste rye, but maybe that¬ís just me, its a little spicy. Very Drinkable yet loaded with some very complex flavor. Great Stuff, and very unique.

Ar: Spicy citrus, lots of grapefruit rind - some toasted caramel.
Ap: Orange, clear - medium off-white head with good retention - leaves a thin, but solid, cap of foam, with small chunks of lacing.
T: Candied orange and toasted malt up front - lots of smooth, juicy citrus, tangerine and pink grapefruit - spicy, a bit herbal - medium bitterness - very clean, with a nick light caramel malt backbone. 
P: Medium body, medium-high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: Bright, fresh pale ale - absolutely delicious - great citrus flavor - and a wonderful balance of malt, just enough to give it some great character to contrast the hops, but without becoming too prominent.

Pours a rich copper amber color with a two finger eggshell foam that sticks nicely. On the nose its a mix of rich caramel malt, pine and citrus hops... The palate is a lot maltier than I thought it would be. The hop profile is abundant but a little muddied by the heavy toasted malt notes and bitter finish.
UPDATED: APR 22, 2013 Awesome american pale ale drank in chicago from a bottle, Indiana¬ís pride, super hoppy

Hazy dark orange. Small soapy white head. Aroma is sweet, citrus, grapefruit, pine with matching flavor. Alot of flavor. Bright. Very drinkable. Balanced, smooth hop finish. Medium body. Creamy, oily, some drying. An excellent beer

Pours with a thick, off-white head. Color is orange/ amber. Aroma is citrus/ hoppy. Sweet grapfruit note with initial taste. Fruity/wheaty over all flavor. Finishes warm balanced. Head gives way to very high lacing. Pleasant and delicious.

Received in a trade. Not sure how fresh it was. Drank a bruery sour in the rye about 2 hours earlier so my palate may be ruined. Citrusy, piney nose. Golden amber pour. Relatively big hop characteristic. Good beer but nothing to write home to mom about.

In tap, pours a slightly hazy gold with thick off white head. Aroma is big citrus hops light fruits, lemon, would be interesting with some lemon verbena. Mouth feel is smooth, low carb. Lots of hop bitterness but it is very well rounded good hop flavor and malt sweetness. Overall I really like this well balanced ale great hop character balanced by malt sweetness.

Pours a brown,dark amber color with a 1 finger off white head leaving a few pillowy island floating about after a few chugs. Smells of sweet grapefruit,lemon,pine,malt.
Slight bitter hoppiness of grapefruit backed by a smooth malt backbone overlay with another dash of hop bittnerness again to finish it off.
Another great pale ale from 3 Floyds.

Pours a dark orange in color with a rocky off white head. Heavy citrus and pine notes dominate the aroma which also showcases some floral elements. While this bottle is not particularly fresh I am very familiar with this beer and how amazing it can be.

One intense pale ale. Wonderful bouquet of grapefruit. Drinks incredibly with an excellent balance of malt and hops. Somewhere between an American pale ale and a india pale ale finishes smoother than perhaps any beer I have ever had
Thin creamy head. Piny and bright aroma. Copper with a redish hue. Creamy mouthfeel with the classic 3F aftertaste.
Great american hoppy ale from a great brewery. My standard go to beer that I can drink anytime and anywhere.

This is my first FFF rating. I¬íve always wanted to try some of their beers. Bottle thanks to rxeight in a trade. I always loved the label art. Pours with about and inch of head. Pours a deep orange color. Extra malty pale ale. Goes down very smooth and clean.

3 Floyds gift to beer.  Pours a dark orange/hazy almost unfiltered looking amber.  Can hold a one finger head with lacing that remains afterwards. Delicous smooth palate with a crisp orange taste that finishes almost the same.  I prefer to start with a Zombie Dust from Floyd¬ís followed by an Alpha King.  Stacking the beverages in such a fashion builds your palate up to the full flavor and joy. A medium bodied beverage that can be enjoyed in quantity.

A brownish red hue with very little head. Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Aroma is that of an imperial ipa almost in strength. An excellent balance. Hop profile is excellent. Bitterness of the hops is countered by malt adjuncts. Mouth feel has just the right amount of carbonation.

Another bottle from RobertDale in a trade, pours deeper hazy orange with a off white head which dismisses pretty fast, getting more malts then hops in the aroma, sweeter malt taste balanced with the bitterness of the hops orange pith.

12 oz. bottle to Bristol pint glass, thanks again RudiNicole. Pours a deep amber, slight haze, this almost gets to the red end of the spectrum on the color. This also taste as good as advertised, perfectly balanced (balanced to my Americanized hop destroyed palate) its the perfect step back from an American IPA proper. Low to medium mouthfeel without being thin, great beer great flavor, just a great example of the style. Top notch! Seek, seek and destroy,
Bottle pour at Bavarian Lodge. Really nice balance of floral and bitterness . One of the best I¬íve had in a while.

Smells like a christmas tree.  Dark red/amber color.  Citrus up front, pine flavor lingers and is followed by a malt sweetness that lingers after swallowing. UPDATED: FEB 26, 2013 Pours a very nice amber color. Citrus aroma laced with hops. Quite nice. The taste is very similar. Citrus, lemon and a smooth grassy/hoppy finish. By no means overpowering. Very light and easy to drink. Very good pale ale.

Loved this beer. Got it in a trade and now am very upset I only have 4 left...
Very quaffable. Citrus nose and a wonderful bitter palate that doesnt leave my mouth feeling assaulted. If you can get it. This is a staple of your fridge.

Too me, this was the perfect drinkable (more than just one) IPA. I love Hops and this beer is the perfect balance of strong hops and flavor without overpowering the overall balance of the beer.  Just wish I could get more in NC!

Awesome appearance of cloudy brown and copper awesomeness.  unfortunately this didn¬ít knock my socks off except for the color.  very lacking aroma, not super bitter or hoppy taste.  definitely a great beer, and i will try it again to make sure, but it was relatively uneventful in flavor for a beer that is rated so highly on here.  normal IPA flavor and body in general

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2013 Had many times before, but haven¬ít reviewed it until now. Pours a amber color with a finger length off-white head that dissipates slowly. Decent amount of carbonation. Smells of wonderful, resinous fruits like grapefruit, pineapple, mango, tangerine. Little breadiness from the malt. Taste much like it smells. Starts with a bouquet of citrus and tropical fruits like grapefruit, tangerine, mango. Hefty amount of bitterness. Then get a nice malt backbone of bread and sweetness like a toffee flavor. Then get more bitter, resinous fruits, along with some spicy pine and more bready malt. Some bubblegum on the finish. Somewhat sweet and carbonated finish that cuts the bitterness, but leaves enough to let you know that it is a hop-forward beer. Great fruity finish. Medium bodied with a creamy and slick mouthfeel. This is an outstanding pale ale that never gets old.

Slightly cloudy amber with pillowy head.  Terrific sweet malt nose and citrus hops.  Flavor follows.  Terrific round mouthfeel and great sweet orange citrus flavors and that characteristic FFF finish.  Killer.  Great balance.

12 ounce tap pour at Architectural Awakenings in Chicago.  Blood red color with heavy bubble and foam action. The aroma IPA-ish with those hops bouncing out of the foam, but once you taste it, the malt-oriented flavors taper things down a notch.  Straight-up medium bodied.  I¬íve had this one out of a bottle before, and I liked it much more out of the tap.
Fantastic beer. I¬ím not sure you can go wrong with their beers. Try to go into the brew pub as well it is better in tap in Munster.

Aroma- oranges, peaches, some floral aromas, tropical fruit juice
Appearance- burnt orange, massive puffy white head, intense lacing
Taste- hop explosion upfront followed by sweet fruit juices, slight malts, more intense hops/fruits on backend
Palate- classic IPA mouthfeel and palate, very nice
Overall- Sensational IPA from 3Floyds.  Well-balanced while still being over the top.  A hob bomb for sure, this will appeal to hopheads and more novice beer drinkers.

Had this on draft at the Yardhouse in Glenview. Served in a pint glass.

A: Pours a clear amber color with some lighter straw notes around the edges. A one finger bubbly white head forms on the pour and subsides to thin film. Leaves some sticky lace behind.

S: Slighty malty with nice high hop presence. The main note is grapefruit and with a subtle floral component mixed in.

T: The taste follows the nose, but with the hops more amplified. The oaty malt provides a nice backbone for the citrus hop flavors with a slight flowery sweetness.

M: Light to medium bodied with a sticky mouthfeel to it. Nice bubbly carbonation though and the finish is slightly bitter.

O:This is definitely more hopped up than I remember from years past. It drinks more like an IPA than a pale ale, but is still a delicious and hoppy brew.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-16-2011

Bottle - thanks Drew! Pours hazy orange amber with a medium beige head that dissipates with decent lacing. Aroma is pine, a bit of citrus and caramel. Flavor is much the same, quite sweet and medium bitter in the body and on the finish. Medium body, oily in the mouth and a slightly warming finish. This is a good beer, but a little sweeter than I like my pale ales to be.
This is my favorite beer.  It is a well balanced hoppy beer that will leave you wanting more.  There is a reason why Three Floyd¬ís calls this their Flagship Beer!

S: Like someone squeezed a grapefruit in my nose - pretty incredible aroma that has you jump back after catchin¬í a wiff.  Has great malt notes and tropical fruit sweetness. 
A: Dark amber with a puffy foam head that clings to the glass well.  Great retention.
T: Not as bitter as I was expecting, but still delicious.  Incredible citrus hop defined by ripe grapefruit - lackadaisical malt character
P: Feels good
O: Fantastic beer.  If only this could line the doors of my fridge always....

Bottle. The pour was a clear copper brown with an average (1-2 finger) beige fluffy head that had great retention and possessed really good sheets of streaky lacing.

The aroma was of a sweet biscuit malt, spruce and cascade hops and a sweet doughy yeast with notes of citrus (orange), caramel and a pronounced dark fruit (plum) presence.

The taste was lightly sweet and malty with a note of caramel and a strong fruity presence in the beginning, and then became somewhat hoppy with a nice creamy bitter citrus peel ending. The flavor lasted an average duration following the swallow with a wonderful sweet hoppiness left lying on the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was a bit beyond light in body with a creamy dry texture and a medium carbonation.

Overall this was a very well balanced Pale Ale, with just the right amount of bitterness to go along with the mild fruity sweetness...

Easily the best of Three Floyd¬ís staples.  Tart citrus perfectly balanced against a solid sweet bread malt base.  Somewhat strong in alcohol for my taste and with a more aggressive hop profile than other beers of this sort, still, all is forgiven on first tasting.

On tap at Melt Bar and Grilled for $3.  Clear copper with head and lace.  grapfruity biscuity aroma.  Mild fresh fruity sweetness with some crackery malt and medium assertive citrus hop clean finish.  Excellent.

6-pack from brewery.  Pours clear copper with a thin beige head.  Aroma is citrusy, peachy, grassy hops; wonderful.  Taste is somewhat spicy and bitter from beginning to end, with sweet cherries and other fruits, and a dry bitter finish.  Medium-bodied with fairly high carbonation.  Delicious!

A clear amber colored beer, with a light beige head. The aroma of fruits, like citrus, malt with hop. The taste of bitter hop, sweet fruits and citrus. Bitter hops. The aftertaste is bitter and some sweet fruits.

Pours golden amber. 1 finger head, no carbonation. Smells slight hoppy fruity. Taste fruity and hidden alcohol. Nice apa, their zombie dust is preferred.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a Three Floyds branded imperial pint glass.

Pours a jewel-like amber with a two and a half finger pillowy off-white head with great retention. Significant lacing as the head recedes. S: The aroma consists primarily of hops with some citrus, followed by malt. This is more hop forward than is normal for a pale ale.

T: The beer tastes well balanced and full of flavor, with hops shining through.

M: Crisp and refreshing finish, with a solid carbonation level. An all around nice feel. Well done.

D: Really easy to drink. A great beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-24-2011
Great ipa, well balanced with hood hop flavor.

It poured a burnt orange copper color with a creamy off-white head. The aroma was of decent hops with a bit of florals and pines. The taste was spruce, pine and a floral hops bite which turns into a sweet sticky malt. This was an awesome APA.
Aroma is nice and hoppy.  Taste is bitter up front but extremely well balanced.  Damn good beer.
Thin, off white head. The aroma was faint, but very hoppy with hints of citrus. Very hoppy taste with a hint of citrus, and a smooth finish. Very refreshing beer, and very drinkable.

Received in a 10 pack sampler (my first Three Floyds experience).  Being their flagship beer I was pretty impressed with the flavor profile. I would call this is a Mid-West Pale Ale, with the best hops from the east and west coast.  I wish there was a little more of a malt balance to the strong hop presence, but a good pale ale nonetheless.
Bottle courtesy of Frank. Thanks Frank. Pours deep, dark orange with light head. Aroma of orange blossoms and pine. Flavor is super malty. Finishes smooth. A big pale ale made just for me.
Nice dark golden body and thin bubbly suds. Subtle hop aroma. Very very smooth on the palate. For only 68 ibu the hops are kinda intense.

Pours a hazy deep orange with a white, 2 finger head.  A whiff reveals some malt laden citrus, some soap, some sweet sugar.  First sip reveals a sweet concoction arranged with decorations of flowers, bags of malted barley and citrus juice.  I¬ím not overly impressed with this beer.  Not at all.  How did it get this high of a rating?  I attribute it to the sheep mentality praising everything that comes out of Three Floyd¬ís and fanboys.  Yes, they make some solid beers, but this is not one of them.  Scroll past.

Ported from BA
A- Deep amber, nice head retention
S- floral, citrus, hint of malt
T- Citrus hops, hint of malt, bitter finish, would prefer a bit more malty
M- Very undercarbed, probably because this is a taproom growler pour
O- Good beer, worth a try, need to try this from a bottle to really give it a fair shake.

Serving type: growler

Wow!  My first Three Floyd¬ís beer and it was awesome.  I have really started to enjoy APAs and IPAs so opted for their flagship Alpha King.  From the moment you open the bottle you know you¬íre drinking something great.  The aroma has a deep citrus character that has a whiff of grapefruit and is packed with a wide variety of hops.  It opens up nicely as it pours and you really get the hops it packs.  Appearance was very clear and nice copperish color that had a nice thick white head to start and some moderate lacing.  

The taste mirrors the aroma and is packed with a wide variety of fresh citrusy hops that is balanced nicely with a floral accent and some caramel notes.  It taste damn good.  Very moderate bitterness and no lingering aftertaste.  

This is one of my favorite beers and I can¬ít wait to try some others in their line-up.  If they are nearly as good as Alpha King, I¬ím in for a nice surprise.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 my first Three Floyds beer thank to the folks at Distiller Outlet.  Pours a clear amber with a decent white head.  Aroma is of citrus, pine, tropical fruits, sweet malts, and some nice toasted caramel malts.  Taste is nice with a lot of grapefruit, pine, tropical fruits, sweet toasted malts, caramel malts, and some toffee.  Has a medium-full body with a nice creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, semi bitter, but well malt balanced finish.  overall, a very nice APA.
Draft to pint (from notes).  Looks good; hearty for an APA.  Smells and tastes good too; a nice balance of malt and hops (although it drinks more like an IPA).  Pretty good stuff.
Bottle. Strong hoppy aroma. Opaque golden orange with white frothy head. Flavor is full, lots of hops, somewhat ¬ídusty¬í on the mid-palate. Finishes long. Excellent pale ale.

Golden orange with a two finger head. Aroma of sweet onion and malt. More of a sweet malty taste than hoppy. Medium mouthfeel. Very good, but I like Zombie Dust more than this one. I think most others do as well. Kind of reminds me of a more muted Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is typically the king of apa's though three Floyd's has outdone themselves with anoth offering. This one was everything that could be hoped for. Had on tap at Sergios in Louisville

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Oheo! This has been one of those I¬íve heard great stories about. It is a cloudy glowing peach-orange beer with a small sidesticking just off-white head. The aroma is fantastic hoppy and fruity with tons of pine cones and it¬ís also quite peachy sweet! My god this is how a APA, or just a beer in general should smell! Melting smooth and integrated flavors; it¬ís grassy and bitter, yet sweet and more  peachy. At the first sip you get a near pungent hoppy flavor, but wait one second and it just melts away - gliding down the troath. Really tasty and it feels so integrated and balanced! Seriously considering a refill on this one. Not often I do that in a beer festival, but this? 12.05.2012
12 oz bottle. Pours golden brown with a nice head. Fruity hoppiness throughout. Bitter, but not overly bitter. Nice citrus flavor that provides a sweetness to the beer.

Golden color, good head, nice hop aroma with grassy notes. Taste is less compelling than the aroma. Hop forward, not overly bitter, but pretty dry malt presence. Finish is lightly bitter. Easy to drink, nice beer, but not very interesting to me.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Clear, amber liquid with medium to big off-white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, mango, grass, flowers, perfume and biscuity malt. Taste is light sweet and medium to high bitter with notes of grassy/flowery hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Good APA, fruity and well balanced. Got a feeling that this bottle wasn¬ít as fresh as is ideal.

Pours a clear amber with a respectable off-white head and good lacing.  Aromas of hops, citrus and a hint of caramel.  Great flavor that starts like an IPA and ends with some malt.  Perfectly balanced with a touch of grapefruit.
Draft.  Nice frothy head.  Very smooth on the palate and no after taste.  Tastes of subtle caramel and hops.  Definitely like this but isn't my favorite IPA.

Refrigerated bottle from queenholly poured into a shaker.  Pours tranlucent amber with small off-white head that dissapates fairly quickly.  Some lacing, thick body, medium/light carbonation, sticky texture, and nice citrus/caramel malt aroma.  Taste is grapefruit, caramel, and bitter finish.  Has to be the best pale ale I have had.

12 oz bottle to std pint glass @ 50 deg - beautiful amber color with thin, aromatic off-white head. Tasted lightly toasted malts right off, piny hops balance the body perfectly.  As it warms the flavors mellow and so do I. Wonderful citrusy finish. Very enjoyable. Gives the Bells 2 Hearted some stiff competition, parts of it rising above. The art on the label is awesome. The Alpha King has some tattoos from the mid nineties and green bean hair. His cronies in the four corners look on approvingly.
I love this beer when I want big taste. I love hops, and alpha king doesn¬ít disappoint. I get heavy floral in the nose andin the swallow. Great bitterness. Thx fff.
Tap at CBC, pours clear orange with medium head. Aroma is citrus, pineapple, tropical fruits. Taste like aroma with pine. Nice bitterness, well balanced!

Golden brown pour with huge offwhite head. Citrus hoppy aroma. Sweet flavor a little honey and appropriate medium hoppy flavor. Sweet aftertaste with fruity tones. Strangely enough I taste watermelon.

Tap @ CBC. Deep clear amber orange color with a tiny white head. The nose is light peachy mango fruits and straw. Nice herbal garden. The taste is light mango, strawberry malts. Small seagrass and light tropical pineapple. The body¬ís light and soft. Subtle carbonation. Overall, a very nice and refreshing.

Aroma: resin, floral, citrus.
Appearance: golden, amber, hazy, rocky head, tan foam.
Taste: light sweetness, very bitter, It¬ís earthy, citrusy, and resiny all at once. Pineapple, lemon zest, orange and pine.
Palate: sticky, medium body, lively, astringent, bitter.
Overall: One of my favorites!

Flaska p√• Mikkeller. Orange √∂l med smutsvitt skum. Doftar av en trevlig blandning av humlesorter. Citrus, tropiska frukter och lite tallbarr. Samma best√•nfdsdelar i smaken p√• denna v√§lbalanserade √∂l.

Another 3 Floyd's review another 4.0+ this beer has a smokey note after you finish that leave u wanting more!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
tap at cbc - pours clearly orange, aroma of grapefruit, caramel. Medium body, sweet & bitter nicely in balance. Taste of coffee and some smokiness. Orange peel as well.
(Tap 12/05-2012) Low white head, clear orange color, light raw hop aroma, some bitterness, fit body, mouthfull of hops.

12th May 2012On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Light haze on this amber beer. Little white head. Crisp semi dry palate. Minerally crisp. Marmalade orange and citrus hops -fresh, light and crisp. Crisp minerally finish. Refreshing crispy beer.
Pale amber with a small white head. Malty with fruity notes. malt, hops and flowers. Medium body with a well balanced bitterness.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Another whale that¬ís passed me by up for grabs; Alpha King. Expectations are high. Pours a clear deep orange body with a large creamy off-white head, looking gorgeous. Aroma is peaches, apricot, hints of green leaves, pine and grass. Lovely balance. Taste is peachy sweet fruity tones, hints of grass, apricot and pale malts. Bitter finish, moderate carbonation and smooth body. A very nice, very drinkable and highly balanced APA for sure, and it might even get close to deserving its top spot.

Pours a hazy amber color with 1 finger breadth head that leaves a small lacing. Bitter grapefruit hop aroma with caramel malts that are subtle and in the background. Prominent bitterness up front and throuhgout the long finish. Medium body with moderate carbonation and clean on the palate. This is a fantastic beer.

12 oz bottle poured into a ccb pint glass. Pours reddish brown with a thin head, not a bad lookin beer at all. Aroma of crazy hops with some malts. Is this an ipa? Taste follows the nose but with a little more balance Of hops and malts. Finishes with tangy hops on the tongue. The is a really good beer, it¬ís one of those pales like dales pale ale that borders on an ipa.

Sample from tap, CBC 2012. As a fan of APAs I was looking forward to sample this one. Cloudy orange-brown colour with an off-white head. Lovely aroma of American hops, notes of citrus and tropical fruits, hints of pines. Bitter taste. Medium body with an oily feel. Finishes long lasting dry with notes of pines and grapefruit. Beautifully balanced and well crafted beer - one of the best APAs. Yummy!
En tirador @CBC.Color ambar cobre, buena espuma y encages.Aromas a pino fresco, lupulo, resina, notas a piel d naranja.Sabor contundente, meloso, solo quieres mas y mas.Fantastica!

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear dark golden with a big frothy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet with caramel, lemon zest, winegums, freshly cut grass, orange zest, biscuits and hints of dark sweet bread. Taste is tiny sweet and bitter with oily pine, freshly cut grass, orange peal, caramel, lemon zest and bread. Mouthfeel is round, oily bitter and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with pine, grass and orange peal. Another great hoppy beer from Three Floyds.
12 ounce bottle. A great balance between the hops and malts. Pine and citrus hops, bready malts. A great pale ale.

Deep golden, nice slightly tan head.
Nose is citrusy and floral. Load of hops in this one.. i find some malty caramel notes also, but tjey are dominatez by the hops.
Taste is very  complex for this style of beer. Start off with cirtusy notes and light fruits, gives way to some malty caramel but is fast replaced by bittering hops. Bitter finish without beeing owerpowering in any way. Very good
Ligjt to medium body and close to perfect carb.
Draft at CBC.  Clear amber pour with a tan head.  Fresh hoppy citrus aroma with some caramel.  Flavour is initially sweet and caramel leading into grapefruit.  Very nice for the style.

355 ml bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.
Pours an amber colour with a thick white head. Aroma of stinging floral hops, caramel and gooseberry bush. Flavour of biscuity malts, floral hops, citrus and caramel. Very light slightly sour fruitiness as well. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a bitter, fruity and floral finish. A bit stuffy, but I bet this would be better from a fresh bottle.

355 ml bottle @ Mikkeller Bar.
Pours clear dark amber color with small head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, caramel, grass, orange peel, floral notes and pine needles. Flavour of mandarin, orange, caramel nettle, mild goose berries, hints of biscuits and malts. Balanced and crisp.
4514

355ml bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen

Pours dark orange with a smooth foamy white head. Aroma of caramel malts, hops, fruits, berries and biscuity notes. Taste is slightly malty and fruity with some biscuity notes, dark fruits and hops. Finish is slightly sticky and bitter with some fruity notes. Tasty, well balanced.

(Sample from tap at CBC) Pours a clear amber with medium off-white head. Good lace. Aroma is hoppy herbal with leafy, earthy notes. Oily texture, full body, medium carbonation with a bitter finish. Flavour follows the nose. A ver well balanced and easily drinkable pale ale.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 How have I not reviewed this? This beer helped me discover craft beer and began my love of three floyds. 12 oz bottle into a duvel tulip. Pours a clear copper with a 2 inch off white head that shrinks slowly. Very nice lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, toffee, grass, and mild citrus. Flavor is bright citric hops. Grapefruit, caramel, mild toffee, and a mild creaminess. Mouthfeel is medium and sticky. Flavor lingers and alcohol is invisible. This is THE go to beer at any respectable pub I go to. Amazing.

Originally reviewed: 7/2/09. Pours a very dark amber with a thin half-inch off-white head on top. Some spotty lacing present. Big scents of caramel, floral hops, and orange zest smack the nose. 

The mouth is creamy and smooth, but with just the right amount of carbonation to tickle the mouth. Well done. Flavor is slightly bitter at first sip, but this gives way to a big malty caramel sweetness that finishes with a grapefruit punch. This is much sweeter than I though it would be, but I like it. I like it alot! Dang fine brew. I want more of this...

12oz bottle poured into craft pint glass.  No bottled on date.
Aroma: resin, floral, citrus, grapefruit, leaves, caramel, earthy
Appearance.  reddish copper color with 1 finger of white head that faded quickly.  hardly laces glass.  not cloudy.
Taste:  mild sweet, medium sour, medium bitter
Palate:  medium body, thin texture.  lively carbonation.  finish is mild sour and medium bitter.  bitter remains longer than the sour but isnt overpowering
Overall:  One of the best pale ales I¬íve had which usually isn¬ít my favorite style.  Was expecting it to be much more bitter.  Lots of flavor and enjoyable.  Had a friend pick this bottle up for me and bring it back from Indiana.  I would get more in the future next time I¬ím through Indiana.  This is my first Three Floyds beer and looking forward to trying more eventually.

Bottle poured, copper complexion, minimal head, hoppy smell with cutrusy notes, flavor is smooth citrus hops, bitter light refreshing, effervescent on the palate, super awesome beer... Only had two of their beers but I am loving this brewery

This is what I personally like to call my gateway beer. I had tinkered with other non-big three beers, but never found one that I absolutely loved. Alpha King was it. This beer opened me up to so much more and for that I¬ím thankful. 

Aroma floral without being too overpowering and high drink-ability.

Aromatics are very weak on this brew but when you get a whiff it is straight citrus hops. It pours rusty orange with sticky lacing. Taste is exactly what you want from a pale ale. Solid caramel, bitterness, hops that are very balanced. Mouthful is light and flavorful. Overall, its a great easy drinking flavorful brew.

355ml bottle, copper color, with a frothy bubbly beige head, leaving some laces, light yeasty, floral fruity grapefruit, piney, grassy, cedary hop nose, with some mild toasty, caramel malt, toffee accents in the aroma follows through a medium-bodied palate with a mild biscuity, toasted, pale, caramel malt, flowery leafy, grassy, piney, cedary hop character, with some lime rind, mint leafiness flavours, with a faint zesty lemon pie undertone, leading towards a toasty maltiness, lingering piney, cedary, citrus lemon, lime rind, hop bitterness finish.

Bottle. Caramel malt and 3F¬ís signature grapefruit hops aroma. Slightly hazy copper with a small beige head. Sweet caramel malt, grapefruit peel, pine, and spicy hops flavor. Medium body and carbonation.  Good malt/hop balance.

Pours an orange rusty colour with a foamy white head.  Smell is intoxicating with a ton of tropical fruit.  Tons of fruity hops - tangerine, peach, mango, some pine aftertaste.  Hops seem to come in a wave that leave a bitter, spicy hop kick afterwards.  Easy to see why this is #1
Pours a dark amber color with a lwhite head. Rich aroma with citrus, and grapefruit. Taste is caramel sweetness along with citrus sugary grapefruit. Palate is medium. Very easy drinking beer.

Bottle: Poured a burnt orange copper color with a thin beige creamy head. Aroma is nice hops a bit floral and piney. Taste comes at you with spruce, pine, and floral hops bite, subsides into sweet sticky malt. Stays lively on the palate, but not overwhelming as an IPA would.
Draft. Pours a reddish amber with little head. Good hoppy flavor almost reminiscent of an IPA. Clean finish.

Pours a copper-red with a tall, steady tan head. lacing in stratum.
Scent is hops, orange peel.
Taste is nicely hopped, but not over-bittered.
Plenty of citrus....grapefruit....a hint of sweetness.
Excellent balance. 
A superior beer.

My most highly sought after beer for a number of years.  Thanks to Cgarvieuk for bringing this one down from Scotland.  Cheers Craig.  Hazy reddish russet colour, thin beige head.  Toffee and hop aroma.  Yes big intense resiny grapefruit hop in the mouth.  Wow that¬ís pretty big and awesome. Is it as good as I was hoping?  It¬ís different.  It¬ís big hoppy and toffeeish so very much in the American mould of an IPA I would say rather than an APA.  Certainly tastes fresh on the hops.  Yes very drinkable at same time.  No real heat.  Toffee is really quite pleasant.  Good beer, but when you set your impression so high, it¬ís hard to live up to it.  Thanks Craig.  Now which beer becomes my most wanted now?

From a 12oz, from a 6 pack purchased at the brewpub.  No date on bottle.  Pours a copper orange hue.  Plenty of sticky white head.  Great aroma of flowers and honey.  Mouthfeel is moderate to heavy for an APA but still manageable and not too carbonated.  Taste is quite hoppy.  This really is a mild IPA but it¬ís not bitter really at all which is why I¬ím not deducting points for being out of style (ahem, Dale¬ís Pale Ale, ahem!).  Chalk, flowers, mild, mild pine, pineapple, mango and lemon are present.  This really is a fantastic pale ale.  I couldn¬ít drink too many of them because they are so hoppy my palate would be trashed after two.  Very, very good.

I may not be a brewer but I know an IPA when I taste one and I¬íd categorize Three Floyds Alpha King as a beer of that style, even though it purports to be a "pale ale." This is definitely a hop head¬ís delight: strong bitterness, huge hop aroma, and a fairly well-balanced palate to make it enjoyable in many aspects.

I received a 12oz bottle in a trade (thanks, Joseph!). I poured it into a tulip glass.

Appearance: Dark orange to brick red color; noticeably cloudy body. Forms an average size, ivory, frothy head which retains and laces quite well.

Smell: As soon as I popped the top I could smell the citrus. Strong orange notes are prevalent here, plus some pine needle and other woodsy/earthy scents. A hint of caramel too.

Taste: From the appearance and aroma I knew Three Floyds Alpha King was not going to be your usual pale ale and the first swig confirmed my suspicion. Strong bitterness as soon as the beer hits the tongue. Orange is the dominant flavor - delivering a strong citrusy taste that¬ís borderline tart. Then it gives way to more sweet flavors of orange sherbet ice cream and caramel or butterscotch syrup. The finish goes in the opposite direction with pine flavors, plus a general rustic/earthy taste. The hops linger on the tongue for a while and are quite drying, but there¬ís no cloying aftertaste from the sweetness.

The flavors present here are quite delectable and robust to be sure. However, this is a little overboard for a pale ale. I¬íd estimate the bitterness as 60-70 IBUs, which detracts from the cleaner, more refreshing and juicy flavors I prefer in a pale ale. Still, it¬ís a beer that never homogenizes or peters out as the last swig is just as tasty as the first. 

Drinkability: At 6.5% ABV, Three Floyds Alpha King is a bit bigger than your average pale ale. The mouthfeel is certainly thicker, although it still maintains the crisp carbonation without the chewiness of an IPA. It goes down very smooth, but the hops linger and dry out the mouth. Despite the energy of this brew, it¬ís easy to drink quickly, and throwing back several of these in a row will catch up to you quickly. An excellent beer to pair with a strong meal, or something to have to wake your taste buds up.

Pours a rusty orange amber color, with a small tight head. Nose is all hops and citrus and pleasant. Taste is full of pine and citrus, especially grapefruit. Finish is dry, bitter and long. The beer is put plainly and simply FULL OF
TASTE, does anything else really matter. Great APA from one of Americas great microbreweries, really have to go out my way in Florida to get this, thank you Randy from Archer liquors. Quaff Score ( drinkability with hearty enjoyment )  9 / 10 . The hops never stop on this one.

Pours a dark amber orange with a creamy, beige head and aroma of grapefruit and hops. Taste is sweet, with tons of hop flavor as well as grapefruit, grass, and some malt with a very bitter finish. Great brew, a lot of hoppy flavor throughout.
Bottle pours a hazy copper with a thin long lasting off white top. Scent hops and caramel. Taste is the same with a dry bitter finish. Very good

Draft at brewery. A hopped of version of its little brother (pride an joy) may be over the top if you're not in the mood. Strong hop character, wonderful flavor. Worth seeking out.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle into a three floyds pint glass.

A - Dark amber body with a three finger off-white head. Moderate lacing and retention.

S - Nice balance between citrus and piney hops. Caramel and toffee malts. Very earthy and fresh with a bit of dankness. Really floral and hop heavy for a pale ale.

T - Grapefruit and pine with an earthy and dank finish. Lightly bitter and clean. Pretty complex and unique for a pale ale. Really delicious and highly drinkable. Mouth feel is medium with nice carbonation and a creamy texture. 

O - This is fantastic. Very well balanced between the citrus and piney hops and the toasted caramel malts. The grassy earthiness and a dash of danky hops really sets this apart from other pale ales. Really enjoyed this one!

Bottles on many occasions. Pours a bright, glowing orange with a small, tightly-bubbled off-white head. Nice lacing throughout. Aroma of pine, honey, grapefruit, and some subtle caramel notes. Medium bodied with a smooth, soft, almost creamy palate. Finishes with a crisp, tight, dryness. This beer is more like an IPA then an American pale ale. Really amazing stuff. I wish I could drink a six pack of this

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 Rerate on 3/25/14 - 12oz bottle (bottled on 02/20/2014) into a tulip.  Nose is citrus and resin.  Maltier than I remember and certainly not as hoppy.  I used to hate hoppy stuff (clearly).  Definitely clashing with the spearmint gum I¬ím chewing (JK), but I do get an almost minty presence.  Still a. 3.6 but for different reasons.  Hard to find seasonal beers don¬ít get extra points from me.

Draft - pours caramel with creamy off white head and thin lacing. Nose is pine. Flavor is also pine and adds citrus. Taste is fairly balanced considering the massive hop aroma. Dry finish and sticky to oily mouthfeel.  About what I expected out of a three Floyds apa. I won¬ít be coming for more though.  I¬íd recommend it to hopheads. 7/5/8/3/13 or 3.6 on 3/20/2012
all around a good beer if drinking mass quantities. Especially good with burgers from the grill.

Poured from bottle.  Red, orange hazy appearance with thick, frothy, tan head.  Nice lacing throughout.  Aroma is heavy on spruce, citrus and some floral.  Taste has a light sweetness, medium bitterness.  Palate is medium body, slick feel, lively, bitter to the end.  Fun, easy, APA.

Hazy orange color with a moderate tan head.The aroma is citrus, pine and grapefruit tang, but a malty sweetness is also present. Hoppiness is present throughout the taste with some malty richness filling in the finish. Well balanced.

Dark copper/amber with a good sized beige head and it has some lacing. The aroma has a lot of hops and some malt. I get juicy grapefruit from the hops and a slight caramel maltiness in the background. It becomes slightly sweet and malty and then the hops finish up with a well balanced bitterness.

very citrus and hop forward aroma. Deep caramel color with a light thin head.  The taste is hoppy and citrus.  You get the bitterness of the hops at the finish. Overall a very solid beer great for when you feel like enjoying one of 3F¬ís many great brews.

Bottle @ Dans place, Denver. Pours orange golden with a white head. Aroma is big malty, caramel, nuts, fresh fruity hops. Taste is malty, caramel, nuts, sweet fruit, light citrusly hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. Think this is a older bottle, the hoppyness is way more subdued that what i expected from other ratings, still fairly tasty. 070312

Pours a darker amber colour with a frothy white head, mostly clear. Aroma is of caramel malts, floral hops and slight fruit scents, very nice aroma. Taste is a light sweetness that gives way quickly to an intense and enjoyable bitterness. Light-medium body, lively carbonation, and a soft / thin mouth feel. Overall an excellent pale ale, very nice all round.

12 ounce bottle at M. Moggers pub in Terre Haute, Indiana while on a business trip there last month.  Pours a dark amber hue with one finger of off-white foam.  Aroma is not so strong, but I get some hoppy tones of citrusy, spicy, and soapy hops.  Flavor consists of lots of spicy and earth hops along with some fresh bitter citrus, all with a very nice flavor balance courtesy of the strong malt backbone.  The flavor comes across as very fresh (even though this is bottled).  Oily hoppy texture with some lingering bitterness.  Rather full bodied for the style (not sure how this is categorized as an APA and not an IPA, but it¬ís no big deal).  Very good beer and glad that I finally got to try it.  (1723, 670)
Bottle from my beer broker timfoolery. Nice copper color. Floral and bitter. Smallish head but crisp. Very nice compliment to strip steak in the cast iron pan and whipped, cheddar, chive potatoes.

On tap- Served a rich copper color with a good head and lots of lacing. Aroma of citrus with some caramel and fresh grain. Taste of citrus and caramel with some fresh grain. A nice bitterness and a clean finish. Medium body, smooth and somewhat creamy. Very nice balanced. Excellent beer, a very solid pale ale. Definitely good for more than one. Well worth a try.
Alpha King is a complete and well balanced American Pale Ale.  All elements come together to make this an outstanding all around beer.

Aquired in a trade with hombrepalo, thanks!

Pours a rich clear copper with three fingers of off-white head and good retention. Smell is tropical fruits, mango and a slight floral hop. Taste is bittersweet, floral hops and some fruitiness, earthy finish. Very drinkable. Very good beer.

On tap.
Deep amber brew with lots of sticky white head and lacing.  Smells great - bready and caramel malt, tropical fruit, and pine.  Flavor is crazy balanced - fruity and hoppy as hell.  One of the best Pale Ales I¬íve ever had.
Yes, this is extremely hoppy! In a 6oz glass, it's drinkable, but as for a pint--it'd be too much. Good to clear your palate between pints of better stuff.

12 oz bottle into a shaker. Poured a very dark, slightly hazy, orange with a nice one finger head. Lacing seems to be holding up well. Smells of citrus, lemon, and a hint of caramel. Taste is great, very well balanced, and a wonderful hop presence.  Honestly, by the looks of this beer I thought it was going to be a lot maltier, but just a hint of caramel backbone was present. Great pale ale, that I would definitely drink again.
12 oz bottle to shaker.  Although I am not a great fan of hoppy beer, this one is good, primarily because of the balance and very nice palate.  Three Floyds does things right.

Dark auburn, cloudy and with a few chunks swirling around. Rich, creamy, tiny bubble head and leaving quality lacing. nose is richly, malty and resiny hop filled. Full bodied nectar. Citrus hops explode on the palate. Deeply flavorful.
Agrumes, sapin avec une grosse savate v√©g√©tale poivr√© en ar√¥me. En bouche, m√™me chose avec un d√©licate amertume. Un autre tour de force de 3F en terme manipulation de houblons.

From notes.  First reviewed 5/5/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Alpha King pours a slightly hazy, robust copper color, with a soft, pillowy, off-white head. Good retention, and some resilient lace stick. 

Sweet malt, citrus hops. Some floral hops provide support. Always a nice, strong hop profile in FFF offerings.

Sweet caramel biscuity malt, which gets sweeter as it warms. The sweetness clings to my taste buds as a citrus hoppiness comes into play. 

The malt provides a surprising amount of creamy and chewy feel. Medium carbonation. All this wrapped up in a medium body.

For me, this is the ultimate drinkable pale ale. Maybe it is more IPA than APA, but I could care less. I almost always keep this in my fridge. The balanced hop flavor really does it for me.

This is what I expect from Three Floyds now. With a golden clean body and light carbonation - it looks more tame than it actually is. The hop aroma is intense and spicy; lots of grapefruit and zest. The taste was hops, lingering hops, mineral deposits, and a hop finish. Yay.

Finally got to try this one thanks to Chipalsa. Nose is loads of grapefruit and grassy, wet hops. Well water. Pour was bronze. Alpha King had a heavy citrus taste with bits of burnt caramel and a mineral-like quality to it. This is a great brew for sure.
Bottle pours orange hazy.  Big citrus piny aroma..very bright aroma.  Amazing taste...well balanced..
Pours a red orange with a nice cream head. Leaves great lacing. Aroma is grapefruit and floral hops. Big hops flavor, grapefruit, floral, and some sweetness. Really nice bitterness. Great beer.

Bottle.  I have heard many good things about this one.  Pours a dark red/amber color.  It has a pleasant citrus aroma.  The taste has some hops, citrus, a bit of pine, and perhaps a hint of fruit.  This combination ends with a very noticeable crisp hops aftertaste.  Although this does not live up to my probably over the top expectations, this is overall a very enjoyable and solid Three Floyds effort.
Three clouds pale ale is legit... very drinkable hop forward.  Nice citrus notes. Amazing!

Sampled with a few friends.  Pours a beautiful golden, light amber.  Aroma is a healthy hop-forward.  Flavor is a beautiful crisp hop with a light malt and light citrus and grapefruit notes.  The mouth feel is really nice, not too thin at all.  Definitely an enjoyable, supreme American Pale, but I have to say that I enjoyed Zombie Dust more.

Bottle.  Pours deep but clear amber.  Two finger head and good lacing.  Aroma is really big and bold grapefruit and tropical fruits.  Taste is the same bold grapefruitiness with just a bit of an offset of the caramel malts.  Just had a zombit dust priot to this and while both are "wow" PAs, this one may be better.  Maybe.  I don¬ít know. Shit.
This is probably my standard hoppy drink.  Nice citrus hops and just enough  malt to keep me coming back for more.
The is my favorite beer of all time.  We can¬ít get enough of it in St. Louis.  We have to get it ourselves in Chicago -- when we can find it -- and bring it back home!

It pours a deep, surprisingly dark, hazy amber color with a dense, fluffy, cream-colored head. The aroma is bright, bold, and fragrant. Fruity, citrusy hops dominate, with notes of grapefruit and pineapple catching the most attention. The big hop character is present in the flavor as well, but the citrus is less pronounced, giving way to more of an earthy and spicy hop presence. Unfortunately, although the light, fine carbonation is pleasant enough for the style, the texture doesn¬ít stand up to the resinous, coating hop profile.  Overall, this is certainly  one of the boldest, most flavorful pale ales I have tried, but its boldness borders on abrasive.
Nice creamy head laces down the glass. Dark golden color very hoppy citrus aroma. First taste features an abundance of hops with a clean finish. No bad aftertaste. Mild bitterness lingers well.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber with off white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is floral hop and citrus. Medium mouthfeel with sweet hop and nice lingering bitter finish. Easy to drink an impressive American pale ale from Three Floyds.
Bottle at home.Hazy orange color with a nice creamy beige head. Aroma and flavour is dominated by grapefruit hops but is excellently balanced by caramel malts. Some grass. Hops feel very fresh.

12 oz bottle from Wisconsin. Cloudy orange pour, some head, no lacing.  No sediment.  Big, bold citrus aroma - cascade, centennial.  Aroma would definitely suggest an IPA.  Medium body, grapefruit, floral hop flavor, citrus, pine.  Surprisingly not bitter, except for a lingering aftertaste.  A gentle hop bite, well balanced by just enough malt.   Very easy to drink.  High ratings are justified.  Just a *touch* too light-bodied, otherwise excellent.

Pretty good looking, brown to amber and clear with a one finger head and sparse lace.  Hoppy smell with plenty of caramel malts and fruitiness.  Taste is really hoppy and very delicious. Great malt background and light fruits, plus plenty of pine and a little citrus.  Mouthfeel is great, easy to drink yet crisp and hoppy with a nice bite.  Great beer, I¬íd love to drink it all the time if I could!

Bottle purchased at the Three Floyds brewery. Pours a clear dark red/ copper colour, about a finger or so of white head and residual sugary lace spots and curtains. Aroma is a nice combination of citrus and pine hop. Not sweet (not super sweet), both pine and citrus bitter, but doesn¬ít kill you. Really nice finish.

Bottle at home, cheers MesandSim! Americans - while my marriage to one was an epic fail, I¬íve quickly forgiven them due to their awesome beer. I enjoyed this but it wasn¬ít ¬íawesome¬í as such. Poured an amber colour with a thin white head. Very sweet, almost too much, malty, lovely lick of those US hops, some fruit in the finish. Very tasty and I enjoyed it.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 If you love hops then this is the beer for you.  Strong hop smell, strong hop taste.  Heavy on the citrius side, but nicely balanced with the hops.

Bottom line this might just be my favorite IPA and favorite readily available beer.

Definitely lives up to the hype for me. Really well balanced and complex hoppy beer. Some tropical fruit, citrus, and the slightest bit of piney flavor. Just the right malt backbone for my taste. This was an old bottle too, so I imagine it is that much better fresh.

Pours brilliant copper with a two-finger creamy, fluffy off-white-into-beige head. Nose is lots of hops, clean citrus, reminiscent of two-hearted to me (the centennial, I¬ím assuming). Taste is a touch of sweet underneath quite a bit of bitter, but its not a huge bitter punch in the face. Palate is light bodied with a lingering prickly bitterness. There¬ís some earthiness and tea leaves in the flavor. Its a pretty easy drinker, and I think that¬ís why so many people are drawn to this. I like it once in a while, and it has more to it than most standard APAs. But it¬ís not one of my go-to brews.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2012 Bottle. Pours copper. Floral, citrus, and malt aromas. Tastes of pine and citrus (orange), hoppy with mild bitter finish. Medium body, great balance, and smooth.

Date: December 27, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Tap House Grill Description: Translucent copper with some head.  Citrus hoppy aroma and taste, but taste was also very well balanced with a malty sweetness.  Easy drinking, wow another great brew from FFF, I need to have this again.
Had in on tap. Highly drinkable. Nice citrus aroma. Fantastastic malt backbone with citrus bitter finish. One of the top APA¬ís!

12oz bottle pour. hits the glass a translucent copper with a nice white head. citrus hops jump from the glass along with some grapefruit in there. taste is citrusy with a good malty backbone. bitter finish. yuuuuuum, a very tasty pale!
Citrus floral and hoppy aroma and taste.   Darker /amber color with small white head, sticky to glass.  Medium body, oily.  Very good
Draft. Thin white head. Clear, light amber color. Sweet tangerine aroma. Bitter, grapefruit flavor with a malty finish.
Pour is a clear golden color with a frothy white head. Nose is of light citric fruits, as well as some sweet malty tones as well. Taste is sweet with a bitter citric end.
Hands down, one of the top IPAs on the market.  Delicious. Only distributed in four states, so be sure to get one when in Indiana, Wisconsin, Illinois, and Michigan.

(12oz bottle).  Pours a clear copper color with a nice off-white head that leaves some sticky lacing behind.  Active carbonation.  Aroma has grapefruit, mango, caramel and resinous hops.  Taste is sweet, bready malts with citrusy bitterness.  Medium bodied with a slick texture.  Bitter, dry finish.  Nice stuff.  It¬ís been about 7 years since I¬íve had this and its as good as I remember.
nice dark amber, red brown beer. very pretty. normal pale  with some munich malt? tastes marzeny before the hops chime in. great balance. finest expression of the american pale ale ive ever had

Received in trade from phisigben, thanks for the opportunity. 
Pours a deep clear copper color with a big fluffy white head that slowly dissipates to a wisp of foam on top. Smells of citrus, lots and lots of grapefruit fresh from the produce isle. a bit of toffee, bread and a hint of caramel malt are buried deep underneath. Taste is citrus and resinous with bits of bread and malt barely breaking onto the scene. Long lingering hop bite in the finish is there but never harsh. Medium to light body with a moderate level of carbonation with a smooth resinous mouthfeel. This is a very nice beer, but to call this a pale ale is a bit of a stretch. I would drink these a lot more often if they were more available in my area.

Pours a nice orange color with a nice 1 1/2 finger head. The Aroma is big citrus. It smells like a west coast IPA. Little pine with a touch of a malty character. The taste is amazing!! It is IIPA flavor with a very smooth backbone. The citrus and pine hit like a nice west coast IPA. Truly amazing!
Pours a clear orange with a white head. Nose is tons pine, grape fruit and pineapple hop character. Flavor follows the nose exactly. Huge flavorful pale ale with a strong bitter finish.
Pours a clear light amber with luscious white head. Atoms is very floral, piney  and citrus filled. Taste offers some lovely balance. Superb.

I love pouring this one into a pint glass and getting a good whiff before I take my first sip.  It has a nice, dark amber color, a bit of haze, and a frothy head.  The taste is a near perfect blend of bitter hops and light citrus notes.  The finish is bitter and can hang around on the tongue for a while, but this is may favorite Pale Ale by far, and close to my favorite beer that I can readily purchase on the market.

This is one of the best beers I¬íve had in a long time and probably the "best" pale ale i¬íve had. I had a buddy ship it to me after reading about it. Very smooth and great flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle from Steve¬ís Madison

Ar: Loads of fresh, tropical citrusy hops.  Mild caramel notes.
Ap: Pours a clear light copper with a frothy 1" off-white head.  Great lace.
T:  Obviously hop-forward, moderate sweetness.  Moderate caramel flavor, the finish is moderately to strongly bitter with a mild resin flavor.
P:  Medium body, slightly sticky mouthfeel.  Moderate carbonation.

O:  I¬íd been craving a really good fresh hop forward beer for some time now, and this is a great one.

clear copper amber clear with a big tan head, nice retention, excellent lacing... lightly toasty, light caramel/toffee under layers of citrus and piney hops, more evergreen than fruit, though the pungency of the aroma fades kinda quickly... quite lively, big pine big citrus flavor with mildly sweet malts underneath, not nearly as dry in the finish as id like, but certainly drinks well... medium bodied, easy easy easy drinking.. damn i wish this would come back to PA... this is what every american pale ale should strive to be...

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Slightly hazy orangish-amber with off-white head and light lacing.

Aroma: Centennial and Cascade goodness ¬ñ grapefruit, orange and a sharp spiciness over some light toasted malt.

Taste: Grapefruit comes through even more strongly in the taste, and is borderline tart. Orange and toasted malt round out the flavor profile, with a lingering spicy and bitter finish. Somewhat of a Lagunitas-type profile. And yes, Lagunitas is almost a style unto itself.

Palate: Fairly full-bodied for a Pale Ale, with moderate carbonation and a very dry finish. Pretty oily and sticky.

Overall: Big, sticky Pale Ale that is firing on all cylinders. Maybe could use a titch more balance, but this is a great example of a beer pushing against the boundaries of its style.
I prefer Gumball Head over Alpha King, but when it comes down to it, I enjoy it!

Pours amber with thick off-white head.  Nice hoppy aroma with notes of grapefruit and pine.  Moderate hoppiness with peach and citrus flavors.  Finishes with straw notes.  Very refreshing American IPA.

Bottle from Jeff.  Thanks!  Pour is a clear copper with a billowing off white head that leaves a good finger the entire time with great lacing.  Aroma is a nice slug of citrus hops, some caramel malt.  Taste is very similar, with lots of citrus, orange peel, a touch of pine.  Bitter dry finish.  Very hoppy pale ale, but the bitterness is kept in check enough to keep it to style.  Another great one from FFF.

Bottle. One of the hoppiest pale ales i¬íve ever had. Pours a darker amber/copper color with small white head. Aromas are more malt focused, with only minor amounts of hops. Great balance on the palate between hop and maltiness. The flavors are rich, but not overpowering. With the hop profile I wouldn¬ít have guessed a pale ale, but thats FFF¬ís style. I wish I lived closer to this stuff.

Good beer overall. I enjoyed this very much,however; it was tough to drink this after having one of their Zombie Dust beers. The flavors are much more subdued, yet still bold. For a pale ale it is very flavorful and full bodied. Yet surprisingly drinkable. The color is a strong point with this beer.

Poured on draft into an imperial pint glass. Appearance is a translucent amber with a sticky beige head of foam. Aroma is grapefruits and oranges. Taste is predominantly grapefruit, but there¬ís still a balancing malt presence.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2013 Wow.  This beer is tasty and smooth.  Pours a reddish gold color.  Solid aroma for a Pale Ale.  Taste is a well-balanced with just the right hop-level.  Keep it flowing.
a very solid APA that almost leans toward IPA with a big hop profile. Pours and orangish brown with a nice white head that laces nicely. A very solid beer worth trying or trading for.

Copper with good off-white head. Somewhat meager nose with juicy mandarin orange, malt, and some astringency.  Medium body, good carbonation.  Strong malt backbone matches sweet grapefruit/citrus/pine presence. This one might not be the most fresh. Kinda meh.
