Clear amber brown, thin head.  Bubblegum aroma with orange peel hops.  So great with homemade taffy sweetness, floral hop fullness, still that bubblegum in the background.  Toes the line and never gets into full IPA territory, great APA.  Whole leaf hop character lasts a very long time.
Pours red amber with a thin off-white head. Nice citrusy hop aroma. Great hop flavor with no biting bitterness. very smooth. A bit of citrus and pine. Excellent mouthfeel. Great beer.

Pours a dark honey amber with a small off-white head. Fantastic deep, nutty, caramel malt aroma for a pale ale. Also smells of sweet American hops. Flavor is great. Extremely smooth and balanced between the honey nectar of the malts and the flowery bitter hops on the end. A few nutty flavors too. Incredible pale ale, a step over Stone¬ís and Dale¬ís.

Is a very light orange color with a very fruity first smell out of the bottle and fresh off the tap. The hops take over on the first introduction to the palate but do not rule over the rest of the flavors that swirl through this delicious masterpiece.

Bottle.  Pours a golden orange color and nice cloudy white head. Smells is a mild combination of hoppy pine, orange peel, and a sweet malty back drop.  Taste is great combo of honey sweetness and a clean hoppy bite finish.
Bright orange in color with a small white head. Aroma is of pine, citrus, hops, and grass. Taste is the same.
Dark orange pour with a white head. Strong aroma of hops, citrus, and some banana. Taste is sweet with strong hop bitterness and flavor.

Pours grapefruit colored with a bubbly white head. Rather sweet nose of zesty citrus, some faint malt and honey, light leaf qualities and spice. Flavor is a little more plain, bitter hop pine and grapefruit thrown in with a lot of sugar. Palate is a little flat. Very sessionable stuff, if a little straightforward.

Bottle from Archer Liquors. Copper color with a large beige head that collapsed with a bit of lace. Huge citrus/cat pee aroma. Can¬ít even smell malt. Medium body with creamy carbonation. Flavor is mildly citric hop over some light malt. But that doesn¬ít mean it¬ís not hoppy. There¬ís a lot of florality. I think this is one of those fresh hop beers, and I think this bottle must be rather fresh. Really hops the mouth. Great mouthfeel.

Had this on tap at Three Floyds in Munster, IN. Best pale ale I¬íve had - "Alpha King" drink this any day of the week.  Great golden-amber color.  Great aroma of incredible citrusy C-hops and sweet pale malt.  Same on the taste - hops have piney and grapefruity character and are just "pha king" great.  Medium body and lively palate.  I think "Alpha King" give this a "pha king" awesome rating.

Given all the hype on this beer I went in with an open mind and I was very impressed.  This is almost a perfect IPA in my opinion.  The beer poured amber with a lively carbonation and a two-finger head.  There was a beautiful hop aroma of citrus, grapefruit.  The beer tasted of hops without an overwhelming bitterness associated with it.  Just an awesome melding of hop and malt flavors as the beer warms, an awesome balance to this beer.  For an IPA lover...this is it.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2009 12oz bottle from archer liquors poured into a pint glass. *updated with a fresh bottle from DLD ¬í09* pours a very pleasing yet slightly cloudy copper/ruby color with a thin white head and good lacing. aroma is best described as pure, extremely fresh hops with subtle notes of orange, lemon rind, grapefruit, and sweet apricots and peaches with a background of caramel and nutty sweetness. flavor was simply delicious. lovely hoppy bitterness and citrus up front with flavors of orange peel, lime, and grapefruit, with subtle peach and cherry notes. perfectly balanced with a malt bitterness and nutty flavors of walnut and pecan and a long, dry, floral hop finish. palate was very smooth with great carbonation. overall, the best APA i¬íve tasted and a finely crafted, well balanced beer that is incredible when fresh.

Bottled.  Pours a clear bronze colour with a thin white head that dissolves quickly.  Big aroma of pine and spruce hops.  Wow much more malt than expected in the flavour and great balance with the bitter hop finish. This is a phenomenal APA and I would gladly purchase again.

Nice dark copper color.  No head in the snifter.

Very hoppy aroma.  Floral and pleasant.  A rich sweetness as well.  Somewhat piney.

Flavor is outstanding.  Nice and fully balanced.  Bitterness is richly blended with a mellow caramel like sweetness.  Delightful hops.  Well done.

Bottle: Pours deep copper with a thick lasting tan head. Nicely aromatic- piny hops with lots of grapefruit, soft caramel sweetness on the back and some lychee. Chewy and creamy feel. Has a great rounded, clean caramel malt sweetness which is balanced by a solid grapefruit citrus sharpness and a long, drying piny bitterness in the finish. This is an awesome APA, with near no flaws.
bottle.  Pours a nice clear copper body with a soft off white head. Nose is full of sweet caramel malts and toasted nuts, with deeper notes of citrus peel and grapefruit coming in later.

Enjoyed often by bottle and tap, but never got around to rating it. One of the benchmarks of the style enjoyed on tap at the DogFloydApalooza at the Bottom Lounge, Chicago. By the pint ,with a clear,amber/orange hue and decent white head and good lacing. Aroma is dry and more citrus (orange and grapefruit) than piney but both are potent. A hint of floral  essence completes the nose. These follow into the flavor with some nice, malty sweetness that balances well with the everpresent hop bitterness. Again potent, but refreshing!

Aroma started off rather weak but picked up a little bit.  Nice orange appearance, obviously filtered.  Great bitter flavor.  Lots of grapefruit that has a nice long finish.  All in all, one of the top 3 IPA¬ís I¬íve ever had.

A ruddy copper, hazy, with good carbonation. Smells intensely of hops from the Northwestern US -- very citrusy and piney. Tastes like an IPA but without the bitterness (it¬ís still quite bitter, however). Like their Gumballhead, this beer is heavily hopped for flavor and aroma. Quite possibly the best Pale Ale I¬íve ever had, it perfeclty captures the essence of the style. There¬ís enough malt to back up the hops and the intensity almost cloys at your mouth as it lingers on. Tastes like oranges, grapefruit, and resiny candy. Some caramel nuttiness is also present. If only I could have another!

Oh yes! It is back in Iowa! Oh Alpha King, how I have missed you, please don¬ít ever leave my state again.
This just smells like a bag of fresh hops, some citrus, some floral notes. But mostly like when I open a bag of Cenntennial hops when I am homebrewing. This looks nice as well a very clear but attractive amber color with a big rocky head that sticks around and leaves plenty of lace. The flavor is even more complex than I remember it being! Plenty of citrus, but not just grapefruit there is some orange in there as well. There is a remarkable fruitiness abou tthis and although it is one of the hoppiest non-india pale ales I have ever had, the hoppiness balances with a beautiful maltiness.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 TAP: at Three Floyds in Munster, IN - summer 2008. I¬ím not much of a pale ale guy, but this beer is fantastic. Gold/red color, nice hoppy aroma, but the hops are balanced on taste and don¬ít rip your head off. Best pale ale I¬íve ever had, and its not even close.
12 oz bottle. Hop aroma is fantastic! One of the best pale ales i have tasted to date.

Bottle.  Pours a nice clear copper body with a soft off white head.  Nose is full of sweet caramel malts and toasted nuts, with deeper notes of citrus peel and grapefruit coming in later.  Really a velvety feel on the palate with the strong malty body letting the sweetness gently settle on the tongue.  The flavor rush is very floral and light with lots of orange and lime peel along with a toasted nutty background flavor.  Maybe candied pecans.  Delightful.

Excellent beer. Glad I was able to stumble across some in Iowa (I think it was an accident it showed up in the local store).  Rich hoppy aroma, thick chewy body, nice malt backbone with a creamy piney hoppiness.  All around wonderful.
reddish brown with nice white ehad.  tremendous malt aspect of crystal malt, great hop bitterness with some centennial and amazing flavor of cascade.  close to perfect IPA

On tap at Chumley‚Äôs

Poured orange red amber, with white head, and very clear - nice.  The aroma is all HOPS.  The flavor is dominated by hop bitterness with some malt backbone.  The palate is normal - not thin or thick or particularly interesting.  Overall this is a very fine beer, but I feel that it is a bit unbalanced toward the hops and could use more hop flavor rather than btiterness as well as some more balancing malts.

This is on draft at 2 locations here in town. This is often a warm up beer and pours a red orange with a nice white head. Lots of hops and almost a sweet clover honey finish. This is a hop heads beer for sure so be prepared for a blast of hops. Once you get past the initial hop bite this beer does smooth out and become more drinkable but give it a few wash overs on the palate..Worthy of a try.

12 oz, thanks for the trade Butters. Misty and dark copper. One-finger head endures and leaves some crunchy lace. Aroma of dirty orange, caramel and light cocoa. Taste is nice blend of orange, pecan shell, and caramel with a finish of dried wood and citrus peel. Near-medium body is tingly and finishes hop-dry of course.

12 oz. bottle.  Thanks to DuffmanSW for this one.  Dark orange/copper color, slight cloudiness.  Off-white head that dissipates quickly but lacing is decent.  Aroma of big floral hops, but more of bready and nutty malt.  Tastes citrusy, mostly hops, with some caramel malt flavors to balance it out.  Light to medium bodied and crisp.  Too bad its so hard to get around here, its good stuff.

12oz bottle. Pours an amber color with a white head. Lacing lasts throughout the entire beer. Heavy carbonation. Aroma is of hops, pine, citrus, and caramel malt. Taste is of bitter hops, pine, and grain with a caramel malt backbone. Light mouthfeel, and easily drinkable. Definitely a session brew.

Copper in color with a thin white head that left lots of lacing.Smells like hopps and what seems like grapefruit.Taste is heavy on the hopps. Sweet and and citrusy with a nice bitter aftertaste.Carbonation is good and the aftertaste is pleasant.

Pours dark amber with a 2 finger creamy off white head decent retention, great lacing for the style. Aroma has a blast of hops up front, citrus, pine, grass, even a little herbal. Look beyong the mops menagerie and there is a wealth of caramel, toffee, and bread malts. Flavor has plenty of citrus hops, a little pine, plenty of grapefruit, and a nice grassy highlight. Theres a little melon thrown in there too. Malt notes are rich but strike a nice balance with heft and crispness that lets the beer be refreshing and fairly strong. Decent amounts of toffee, caramel, bread, and a hint of grain.FInish is slightly bitter, slightly tangy and very crisp,
Consistent flavor profile, quality bright hopping,  crisp, medium mild effervescence, good color and foam, drinkable, very sweet.

12oz bottle.  Pours amber with a quickly diminishing 1 finger off white head.  Aromas of pine, citrus and grapefruit bomb.  Flavors are crisp, floral, a bit of pine and citrus.  Very good malt backbone, resulting in a nicely balanced pale ale with a punch of hops in the finish.

Superhopped pale ale that pours dark orange with a creamy thick head.  Aroma of grassy hops and citrus.  Flavor is a balance of bitter and floral hops with enough malt to keep it pleasant.  still has a lot of punch on the hop end, though.  A little light when compared to the appearance, but very refreshing as a result.  Great effort.
Pours amber with a decent off white head.  Aroma is huge and of fresh citrusy hops.  Flavor is huge and full of grapefruit like hops and a nice maltiness in the background with a big bitter finish.
A nicely balanced pale ale, with lots of citrus overtones and a bitter hoppy finish.  Very drinkable.

Orangey-amber pour with frothy orange-tan head.  Aroma of sweet caramel, floral and citrus hops- delicious.  Flavor is ridiculously balanced, with big citrus and floral notes melding perfectly with earthy grassy hops and candy-sweet caramel.  Palate is smooth and full with the slightest fizziness.  Not a ton of bitterness, but the well-rounded nature of this beer more than makes up for it.

(10/14/08) Draught at the brewpub in Munster. Clear amber color. Aroma of citrus hops with flowers and some malt in the background. Sweetish flavor, slightly caramelly with light biscuit hints. Continues hoppy and bitter with some grapefruit. Rounded mouthfeel. Good stuff.

On tap at rich O¬ís.  Crystal clear amber pour.  Beautiful floral hops that¬ís like nothing I have ever really experienced.  There is virtually no hop bitterness, just all hop flavor.  very impressive.

Hadn‚Äôt had this beer in awhile, and boy did I miss it!! Had a bottle recently, compliments of Mark. Poured a beautiful orangish amber. Big hop aromas from the start, then it mellowed as it got a chance to breath. Big time citrus hops is the first thing to come to mind. It‚Äôs like you‚Äôve been thrown into a pit of hops and grapefruit. The finish lasts, but you wish it would last longer. Never a bad beer from three floyds.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2009 My mom Brought this to me from Indiana at my request.  I did think it was good, with a complex hop-flavor profile and a fantastic hop aroma. Grapefruit and pine were the dominant aromas.  I didn¬ít think there was a great balance, the malt was not very perceptible.  In my oppinion, a pale ale should have a little more balance.  It had a nice light amber color to it also.
Rerate- 7/7/09-  I just tried Alpha king again.  Maybe I caught it at the right time, but it tasted so much fresher and more balanced.

Poured an amber brown with two fingers of head that did not have very good retention. The aroma is of citrus and hops. The taste begins with sweet malts and then transitions into a bitter grapefruit hop flavor. This is a very well balanced beer.

Amazing beer......Finally got around to opening this the other night! Thanks Robert!  I would say this is an IPA if I didnt know any better. Hops citrus and grassy flavor and aroma. Beers like this make me love craft brewing that much more.
Draught at GABF 2008. Clear orange - white head. Peppery, citrus, grape, fruity, nice hoppy, kn√¶kbr√∏d, swedish flatbread, spicy, light malty, light sweetness. Lovely.

Crushed with Honkeybra at the brewery.  I felt like shit but tried to man up and went for it.  Floral hops on the nose.  Even more in the flavor.  A very intense brew, almost IPA-worthy.  Sorry Sierra Nevada, this takes the cake as my #1 pale ale.

Bottle.  Poured a clear amber color with a minimal tan head.  Had a very strong aroma of floral and citrus hops, a really nice smell.  The beer had a medium body, slightly creamy texture, average carbonation, and a  bitter finish.  The flavor was the same as the smell and overall the beer had a medium bitterness.  I had heard a lot about this beer, and it definately did not disappoint.  I really like the blend of hops that give this beer its great aroma and taste.  I will definately be drinking this beer again and would highly recommend it.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Archer Liquors in Chicago, IL for $1.95 Long wait to taste this excellent beer!

I had been looking forward to this for a long time, and I was not disappointed. Nose is pine and citrus - pineapple I thought for a while - but then realized that Mango was much more precise - absolute perfection. The flavour is a lot of the same fruitiness as the nose, backed by rich and sweet malts and a good hoppy bitterness. One of the best beers I have ever had. I have not found any three Floyd¬ís beers available in Europe, tried it in the Grumpy Bulldog, Naperville IL.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2011 12oz bottle  Poured a dense ruby-orange with an off-white head. Smells of pine and citrus,i.e.grapefruit, lemon.Delicious malty palate with hints of pine and lemon zest. Finishes slightly bitter with wonderful hops. Truly unique...and delicious.

Bottled: I had been holding on to this one for a long time, and it was worth the wait. Pours a amber color with a tan lacing. Smells sweet with a good balance of hops and malts. Tastes simply delicious with a blast full of earthy hops that leaves you wanting more!

This definitely pushes the IPA-PA boundary. Aroma is somewhat subdued in terms of hops. The malt is rather sweet. Flavor is sweet, which is I guess how this passes as a pale ale. Then at the beginning of the finish comes tons of grapefruit and a little lemon. Then comes some floral hops, but then in the tail end of the finish the grapefruit regains dominance.

An exceptional pale ale. Aroma is of hops straight off the vine. Goes down easy with strong orange hoppiness. Would recommend to any pale ale lover. A bit hazy, but has good head retention at higher temps.

Pours a rich copper color from the bottle with a trim white head.  Loaded with hops, but proportionate to the style, which make this beer highly drinkable.  Light with sugary malts and faint citrus.  Well done.
Draught. Low fluffy and quickly disappearing white head. Slightly hazy yellow body. Malty hops honey aroma and flavor. Fairly hopped but mild. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2010 bottle thanks to Tharreld.  I love this beer!  Alpha King is a serious APA - hop bomb for sure... This is the darkest APA I¬íve seen so far... pours a deep amber / orange with a 1/4" white head - which does retain itself well.  you can smell the hops come out of the bottle... big citrus hop notes across the nose with a touch of caramel malts.  big full hoppy body with more citrus, caramel malts, sweet fruit and lingering sugars.  very well balanced finish with a perfect blend of hops and malts.... Alpha King is the perfect APA - a true hop lovers Pale Ale that delivers a very nice bitter feeling without going too far into IPA territory...

rating #400 for me.  top notch APA... doesn¬ít get any better than this.... tons of hops in there for a Pale Ale.  Drinks like an IPA.  pours a deep copper with a thin white head.... which lingers throughout.  well balanced malt and hop aroma.  some citrus hops come through a bit.  huge full hoppy body - with a nice bit of spice up front - really nice and soft on the sides - and a thick lingering bitter finish.  this is a very well crafted Pale Ale which is not for the casual drinker.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of a trade with yem25.  Pours a cloudy rusty gold with a thin-moderate off-white head that disappeared after the first sip and left no lace.  Pleasant aroma of pine and malt.  The flavor is malt up front followed by some restrained pine.  Some astringency builds in the back of the throat well after the swallow and lingers for about ten seconds.  Maybe this bottle has a little too much age on it, but I was a little disappointed with this one.  I will re-visit this beer sometime down the road.

Bottle shared with Nnudd. The colour is amber orange with a longlasting white head. Lots of exotic fruit in aroma like mango and peach. Citric notes as well. Body is creamy and makes the flavour notes explode in your mouth. The flavour is citric and hoppy with peachy notes upon a solid malt base. Great brew that deserves all the credit it already had. Thanks a bunch for trading the SQNfan.

Enjoying this after a 10 hour drive home by myself, and I couldn‚Äôt have picked a better beer to drink.  Pours with a dark amber body with a creamy off white head.  Aroma is grapefruit and floral hops with a caramel malt hint.  Flavor is quite well balanced with a nice citrus hop presence mixing well with the malts in the beer.  Finishes somewhat dry with a nice well-rounded body.  Delicious beer.

Bottle.  Poured a clear orange/gold color with a one finger white head.  Aroma of citrus and pine.  Flavor was well balanced with malt and a citrusy finish.  Very good beer, but very similar in a lot of ways to most IPAs.

Pours orange with half a finger of stark white, slowly dissipating head.  The aroma is a kick in the face of hops.  The taste is more balanced and subdued then you‚Äôd think, given the odor.  Starts off mild and then builds to a rich citrus hop bitter aftertaste.  Really top notch IPA.
This is definately one of the best APA‚Äôs out there.  Intesely rich and flavorful, but not out of balance.  Floral, citrusy, rich malt but not sweet.   Are you sure this isnt IPA?

Falls in the glass an amber orange, slightly hazy.  Head is gone shortly.  Smells is citrus hops, nice smell.  Taste is citrusy hops, pine, leaving a nice taste.  Lacing is visible but not crazy.  Nice brew, lots of flavor.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of ucusty. Thanks! Hazy browish-red pour with a one finger head, decent retention and lacing. Aroma is a brown-sugary citrus hop explosion with some almost thyme-like herbal notes. Big hop taste, pine, citrus, with nutty malt backbone. Full bodied and definitely drinks more like an IPA than an APA.

Big citrusy aroma, especially grapefruit and pine.  Some caramel malt in there.  Darkish amber in the glass, really clear.  A perfectly balanced flavor, very impressive.  Bright hops, heavy on the citrus, medium malt presence. Extremely drinkable for sure, just a perfect APA.

Finally getting to try the legend, courtesy Eithcubes. Very nice nice clear amber pour with a thin off white head. Nice crisp fresh hop aroma, lots of citrus and pine. Taste is a wonderful balance malt and tasty bitter hops. Has a great medium body that finishes with a very nice grapefruit finish. An amazing pale ale that deserves all of the hype.

Draft at Three Floyds. Poured clear amber in color with a two finger beige sticky head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of sweet floral and citrus hops, with a nice caramel malt base.  Tastes of sweet citrus and piney hops, with a nice caramel malt backbone. Great body, great hop character. Its always been a pleasure coming across this one.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 Aroma: Strong hops, more piney than citric, balanced by worty malts, vanilla.  Appearance: Deep clear amber, finger of off-white head, nice lace. Flavor: Strong coniferous hops, but with a perfumy floral bitter component.  Malts are strongly worty, caramel and vanilla. Palate: Smooth carbonation, occasionally caramelly thick.

Pint glass on tap at Chumley‚Äôs in West Lafayette, IN.  My first beer of the night and it has been quite a while since I have rated a beer so I really don‚Äôt know how many I have missed out on from rating.  Whatever.  Anyways, very citrus strong, more fruity than hoppy, but still very good and left a nice lacing on the glass.

I expected this to go jumping down the bunny trail with all the hopps. But damn, it¬ís really pleasant. Very critric, and refreshing but without the bitterness one would expect with a highly hopped beer. There¬ís enough malt to give it a really full body with a bit of a carmelly flavor. A fine beer

Great citrus aroma. Nice dark honey brown color on the pour. Wow! Hops without all the bitterness associated with this style. Excellent balanced flavor. Just a great beer overall - I will definitely be purchasing more of this brew. Plus what cool-looking art on the label!

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2008 Bottle from Kabutomushi. 
Big hop aroma, with grass and citrus. Perfectly balanced flavor, lots of malty caramel, lots of hops, with cherries and dark fruits. Very well made.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2009 Draft. I¬ím glad I re-sampled this one after a bad bottle a while back. Very brilliant orange color with strong hops and pungent sweets. Very good!

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2008 I haven‚Äôt rated this yet!?!?!?! Lucky I just recently got a hold of another bottle. Amber colored beer with a fairly large slightly off-white head. The aroma is super citrusy with grapefruit being the numba one stunna. This is the quintessential american pale ale. Hops are prevalent and very citrusy but the pine tree back bone holds it together. An example of how a brewer using just the right amount of malt can transform something bitter into something that tastes like adult candy. AWESOME.

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass.  Pour produced an red-amber body topped by an off-white head of foam.  Aroma is fantastic: strong floral notes with hops making a strong presence, along with some citrus.  This ale is bitter, in keeping with the style, favoring the hops in it¬ís palate.  The finish is dry with only moderate hops aftertaste.  I don¬ít know if this is the best pale ale I have had, though it certainly isn¬ít bad by a long shot.  I would have to try this again against other pale ales and see how this stacks up...

12 oz bottle. Pours an almost clear amber orangr copper color with a thin white head that leaves little lacing. Aroma is a spicy citrusy hoppy nose with notes of grass and sweet bread in the background. Flavor is similar with the citrus and spiceyness, yet the earth tones are much more than grass with a long lingering dry bitterfinish. This pale goes above and beyond. I‚Äôd almost call it an IPA, either way a damn fine beer.

Appearance is a clear amber-dark orange hue, head is a thick off-white layer of sudsy foam that dissipates to a thin ring, spotty lacing on the glass.

Smell is mild-to-moderate hops, mostly light citrus, pine resin, and floral/grass, nice backbone of bread/biscuit malts, touches of fruit zest and spices.

Taste is floral and earthy hops held in check with pale bread malts, great balance, some bitter citrus and roast malts creep in, finish dominated by bitter hops, very delicious.

Mouthfeel is medium-bodied, watery yet slick texture, mild carbonation.

I really like the balance between hops and malts, this is a very hop-forward pale ale in the session range with very little alcohol presence.

12oz. trade from StFun. pours hazy copper with a nice tan head. aroma is citrus hop and caramel malts. mouthful is a great balance of hop and malt with a clean finish that lingers just a bit. very enjoyable.
Copper to amber in color with a decent beige color head.  Smell is citrus hops, a little caramel, and pine.  Taste is a balance between the hops and malts.  Pretty good.

From 12oz bottle. Nice amber color with pale head. Very nice pale ale, without the excessive citrus flavors that some have. Enough citrus to retain crispness, but not enough to overpower other flavors.

Deep copper pour with a 1 finger white head.  Loads of sweet carmelized barley with peppery, spicy, piny hops.  Has a few notes of mango and toast also.  Creamy medium body with a slightly aqueous finish.

Not a bad IPA.  Somewhat hoppy and bitter.  Dogfish head 90 minute is my favorite IPA and this one doesn‚Äôt quite live up to that for my palate, but I would buy again.  Drank Steelhead Double IPA after this one and preferred the Steelhead to this one.....

Trade with bdigi66.  12 oz bottle pours copper with a nice fluffy off white head.  Grassy, herbal, and floral hop aroma.  Grapefruit hop bitterness, but not harsh.  Lighter malt body with some honey notes in there.  Nice pale ale.  Almost in the IPA category.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2008 Draft at brewpub...finally my description.  Aroma is a light hoppy note of pine.  Appearance is flawless, amber copper with a thick white head.  Flavor is of pine hops and a little citrus.  Great mouthfeel and a nice bitter end.  This is a great beer for sure and would drink over and over, only wished there was a little more complexity.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2008 pours a clear amber with a medium sized tan head.
Smells citrusy malt, with plenty of hops in there to boot.
Flavor is floral hops and unsweet, bready malt. The citrus disappears before you taste it. There‚Äôs a hint of green apple and raisin as well.
mouthfeel is really smooth.
Ooh, the hops hit you in the back of the mouth. This is more complex with every sip.
Great pale ale!

Pours a slightly cloudy amber clor with a medium sized mostly white head.  Aroma is malty and very wonderfully full of delicious hops.  Both citrus and floral in aroma the flavor carries over to the flavor.  This one is hard to tell APA or IPA?  How about a pale ipa?  Yeah thats the ticket.  Nice juicy hops on the tongue with some nice biscuity malts.  Yum.  Really good.

Sampled at Birreria Paradiso‚Äôs IPA dinner here in DC.  The manager Greg said he made a personal contact with the brewmaster, and was able to secure a few kegs of this wonderful beer - can‚Äôt find it anywhere in this area.  Beautiful dark amber hue with sufficient lacing.  Certainly smelled and tasted like an IPA, but I can understand the pale ale classification.  You can tell there‚Äôs a ton of cascade and centennial on the back end of the boil, providing huge amounts of hop flavor, not commonly found in a APA.  This and 60 minute are really nice sessionable beers with similar flavor profiles.
Damn near an IPA in taste and aroma.  Lots of citrus, not too malty.  Pours amber with a thin whitish head.  Very good APA.
bottle, nice hoppy nose with foamy head that dissipates, flavor is very smooth pine, citrus and some spice, finish is excellent

On tap at the brewpub in Munster. This came in an imperial pint glass rich amber color with a minimal white head (pub pour) and light lacing. Nose of citrus and fruit hops, and a tiny bit of pine.  A very smooth and cream mouthfeel. Flavor is of citrus and pine. Great bitter finish.  I was amazed at how good this beer tasted.  I don‚Äôt know if it is balance or what, but this is fantastic stuff.
Draft at the FFF Brewpub. I love this beer out of the bottle, but on draft it is so much better!!! Well balanced, nice malty sweetness and fruity hop spice. LOVE IT!!!!

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 Amber in color with a small, off white head with decent lacing.  The aroma is fruity with overtones of yeast and hops.  The flavor is of bitter grapefruit.  Creamy in texture.  Very bitter but a good beer overall.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2012 Bottle from Lone Hill Liquors. Pours with a small, off-white head. Hazy amber body. Aroma of grapefruit hops, lots of other light fruits, a bit of yeast and a bit of caramel. Very nice sweet, grapefruit taste and some nuts. Creamy mouthfeel with light carbonation. If this beer was easily available I would have it all the time as a standard paring to anything that came off my grill. 
Very lightly hazed golden hue, with a large and lasting eggshell colored head. Retention and lace are both very good.
Hop dominated aroma, grassy dry hop character, pine, classic citrus, tropical fruit. Low esters (but noticeable). Very low malt character, delicious aroma. 
Flavors are hop centric and quite bitter for an APA (alcohol is also quite high for what one would expect from an APA). Citrus, pine, grassy, tropical fruit, resin. Malt barely peeks through. Clean yeast wise, low caramel malt impression. Resiny hop character lingers. Medium bodied with medium to slightly high carbonation. Lingering bitterness and light warmth. Grassy character remaining on the tongue.

Pour is an orange with a large white head.  Aroma is deffinatly hoppy with some caramel and rye.  Flavor is and outstanding hop with some earhtyness and a stong pine.  For a 6% beer this thing is loaded with flavor that some imperial IPA‚Äôs could only hope for.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2009 12oz bottle. Pours dark golden amber with a moderate creamy head. Fantastic pine hop flavor with mild hints of citrus and fruit. A malt backing balances everything out nicely. Smooth finish with pleasant bitterness. Extremely delicious and goes great with food. I could drink this everyday.

Bottle. Moderate malt notes of roasted and caramel, heavy hops of pine and grapefruit peel, moderate yeast of leather and earth, with butter, pepper and dried fruit in the background. Head is average sized, creamy, slightly off white, with good lacing, and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy copper. Flavor starts lightly acidic, and finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, oily, and has a carbonation between soft and lively. The smell was great. If the flavor were a little more pronounced and had a touch of sweetness, this would be close to perfect.
Great Pale Ale.  Standard FFF quality.  Hoppy for a pale ale, has a great bitter taste that‚Äôs not overpowering.
A great IPA.  Pours a faint copper with hues of grain and grass.  Flavors explode with hops and a slight splash of citrus.
poured on draft at the hopleaf in Chicago.  lemon and grass hops, slight nuttiness with bread notes.  not much caramel, slightly dry finish.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2011 An awesome pale ale (but, more like an IPA).  Thanks Bigmmartin for getting me hooked.  The pour is a rich copper with a thin white head.  The aroma is very hoppy with grapefruite hints.  This beer goes down smooth with a sweet taste that finishes a little bitter.  This is a very good, well balanced beer.  Anyone, a beer connoisseur or a casual beer drinker, can enjoy.

Big thanks to msante79 for bonusing me this one. My first Three Floyds beer. I had an Alesmith X last night which I thought was a excellent Pale Ale, but this one really blew me away. Nice amber color with almost no head. Citrus and other hop flavors strongly present. Well balanced with malt flavors as well. A perfect Palle Ale.

Hops, hops and yet more hops. It pours a beautiful crimson brown that almost appears to be glowing. Aroma is typical Three Floyds...part hops, part fruit salad. The lingering flavor is simply mindblowing considering it is just a regular old IPA/APA. Quite possibly my all time favorite sessionable beer (yes it is sessionable, don‚Äôt be a p*ssy). Great Job!

Great beer for a hop lover. The only problem is it‚Äôs perhaps a little monolithic. I get a very strong grapefruit aroma and flavor. Heck, this could almost be grapefruit juice. For style it‚Äôs more IPA than American Pale. Personally, I think Dreadnaught is more complex, more hop, but also a better balance. But yeah, this is a damn damn fine beer.

On tap at Map Room in Chicago. Dark Copper color.  Small head.  Nice lacing.  Grapefruit aroma.  Very woodsy flavor.  Mouthfeel just ok.  Good beer,  that was very drinkable.  I was a little disappointed because this beer is really hyped.  Still, one of the better Pale Ales I‚Äôve had.

Started off great ¬ñ pours a nice medium brown with orange hue.  Soft thin head which dissipates fairly quickly.  Heavy citrus aroma (grapefruit?) along with strong hops.  Taste is consistent with aroma ¬ñ intial citrus/hops combo and strong bitter aftertaste.  Nothing stands out from the palate ¬ñ mouthfeel is not too thin but not exquisite either.  Good pale ale but not my favorite.

Bottle. Pours hazy copper with a moderate off-white head. Fairly standard west-coast-style IPA: lots of grapefruit and pine hops in both the aroma and flavor, with a fairly good malt backbone. Very well done, though.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2009 Nice hazy copper pour with a nice head.  I am not a big fan fo the pale ales but this adds a nice touch with the FFF Citrus twist.  Very easy to drink.  Got better for me as it got warmer.

Bottle from a trade with StFun. I can see why this is the highest rated pale ale on the site. Full-favored brew with hops and a malty backbone. I even thought I was drinking an IPA for a second. Piney and a hint of citrus on the plate.

Bottle from DTM‚Äôs trade of some of our Russian River sours.  Knowing that you‚Äôre about to embark upon a wonderful journey usually makes the bar that much higher.  Despite that, the Alpha King made me a believer of what a Pale Ale could be.  This brew was maltier, smoother, and not as obstinately bitter as most Pales are.  There were hints of grapefruit, but it was mostly piney.  There was also a bit of caramel.  Cheers to 3F for making "the best" Pale Ale!

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2010 On tap.  Copper pour with a big white head that quickly faded into sticky lacing.  Hops dominated the aroma - mostly citrus.  Taste is mega hoppy (grapefruit with some pine) with a lingering bitter finish.  Lingering, as in near-eternal.  Mouthfeel is resinous and thick with good carbonation.  An excellent beer, but a little extreme to be a true session brew. (My opinion of the last statement has changed over the last year.  I could drink it all day, every day.)
Just a great beer.  Huge citrus and grapefruit aromas and tastes.  good balance between bitter and sweet hops.  Way to easy to drink.

Bottle.  One of my introductory beers into the world of craft beer.  After my first experience, I was definitely hooked on 3F.  I basically think of it as an IPA, too intense for a normal Pale Ale.  But then again, there‚Äôs nothing normal about 3F.  

Dark copper amber in color with a thin white head. Has an excellent floral and citrusy hop aroma that serves as a great prelude to the complex hoppy flavor. Has a great bitter finish, crisp finish. One of my staple session beers.
Copper with a thin white head.  Aroma of pine, citrus and floral hops and mild sweet malt.  Taste is more of the same.  Smooth bodied and balanced with a heavy bitter finish.

12 oz bottle from Binny‚Äôs.
Aroma: Very light hoppiness and a light malt.
Appearance: Redish haze, small head, slight carbonation.
Flavor: Light, but very hoppy. Strong hoppines aftertaste.
Palate: Light, smooth, lots of lingering taste.
Overall: Great tasting pale ale...if you still want to call this a pale ale. Its as close to an IPA as you can get without being an IPA. Very drinkable with a great aftertaste.

Tasted side by side with Mikkellers All others Pale: Close call!
Grape, apricot, sweet, fruity, good bitterness, well balanced

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2008 I deleted my first rating of this beer due to the fact i was not on  my beer journey as of yet, I didn¬ít understand beer as I do now poured a great looking orange with brownish hue so much different than most apa¬ís.Aromas of hops and citrus I don¬ít know which hops are what but their is a trade mark hop of all three floyds beers and i just love that hop. one day i hope to know how to tell the difference.flavors of of hops and citrus with a dry and slightly bitter finish. overall this is a great american beer from one outstanding brewers in the whole wide world keep them coming nick

I really gotta get an uber-fresh bottle of this.  I had one that was probably 5-6 months old and the hops had really started to turn to the point of cheese which was obviously not a good thing.  Still there was enough goodness left in the bottle to make it drinkable and enjoyable.  An aroma of light citrus notes, subtle cheese, and sweet malts.  Same profile as the nose, with a better emphasis on the hops.  Nice balance between hops and malt.  Hopefully a fresher bottle will be found before too long.  I can see this beer being tasty.
I love this beer!  Light, refreshing, tasty, perfectly balanced!  Really hard to go back to Oldstyles or PBRs after drinking this!
Copper amber with creamy, beige head.  Grapefruit and  caramel aroma notes...very fresh.  Grapefruit, caramel, and balancing hop / malt flavours.  Dry, fresh, Bitter finish.

Can¬ít believe I have not rated this one yet.  Pours an almost clear amber with a half finger off white head.  Aroma is fantastic with apricots, sweet caramel, pineapple maybe...nice hop aromas.  Flavor is at first a delicious fruity sweet malt and then the hops  follow with just the right amount of satisfying bitterness for the tongue. Medium body with lasting hops finish.  This beer is the definition of malt/hop balance for a non-DIPA.   By far the best true IPA/APA on the market today...yes it¬ís better than two-hearted.
This is the best pale ale there is. It¬ís almost an IPA, but there are subtle differences. Great appearance, a ton of hops in the flavor, medium bodied. Just a perfect beer.

Bottle courtesy tpd975. Pours a clear copper with a large long lasting off-white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of citrus and floral hops with a hint of sweet malt. Taste is the same as aroma with a perfect balance between malt and hops. Medium mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness and a crisp finish. Very good.

Poured from a bottle a nice amber color. An aroma of sweet malts and citrus fruits. I was almost nervous to try this to see if it lived up to the hype. And it did. A nice bitter citrusy hops with biscuity/caramel malt.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 12 oz bottle thanks to EithCubes. Pours a clear amber with a small white head that quickly goes down, leaving some bubbles and wisps of foam. The aroma was really nice; tons of hop goodness along with a prominent malt expression. The taste was similarly balanced, with a strong edge toward the hops, very juicy and citrus filled. There is a very tasty malt presence that makes this beer so damn good. Easygoing, hell I could have 20. This is the best APA ever for sure.

Thanks to Goliath for this one 
Bottle poured into my pint glass produced a finger worth of head, then settled to a quick lace. The body on this brew was nice clear amber.

Aromas of sweet malt light citrus lemony hops fill my nose.

Flavors of hops, very bitter for pale, not much malt I think it is more of an IPA than a Pale Ale. Medium mouthfeel ale with great carbonation. 

Very drinkable it would be very easy to drink a few of these on a nice summer day.

Six pack from the brewery, pours a clear orange amber with a thin head.  Aroma is super hoppy of citrus.  Flavor is a punch full of hops the end is bitter but not dry.  This is a top APA for me, thanks TikiE for making the long trip back to NC.
Amber color with a tiny with head.  Hoppy and flavorful. Thanks agian TiKiE for letting me have one.  Great beer and i can¬ít wait to get to Indiana to try some other Three Floyds Brews.

Easily my favorite beer in the world as far APAs go.  The aroma is extremely citrusy, especially grapefruit.  The flavor, in my opinion is unmatched by any other APA because it is just so well balanced, a complex malt flavor while still maintaining a the wonderful flavor of Cascade hops.  the only beer I can really ever give a 5 to, besides B.O.R.I.S. the Crusher from hoppin frog.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 Picked up a few cases in Indiana a while back.  I‚Äôve had this on tap and many times from a bottle.  Pours a copper amber with a small but durable head.  Aroma of pine and citrus hops.  I think a lot of people would classify this as an IPA after drinking.  The hops stand out.  Crisp clean bitterness with perfect carbonation make this very smooth.  For me this beer has become a favorite for any occasion.

This poured a beautiful orange amber with a half-inch white head after a vigourous pour. 

Very strong, fruity aroma, with a balanced malt smell in the background. Some grapefruit, lemon and fresh cut grass round it out. 

The beer started with a bit of a sweet malt flavor, followed immediately by a burst of hoppy-bitterness that finished with a crisp clean follow-through. Very nice tasting brew. Very balanced. 

Mouthfeel was on the heavier side, with a slightly bitter but clean finish. Just a slight bit of oiliness from the hops remains to give a nice dry aftertaste that only lingers for a moment. 

Overall a very nice APA

Bottle courtesy of BOLTZ7555, thanks Jason!!  Aroma is huge sweet hopps with notes of honey, flowers, citrus fruits.  Huge off-white rocky frothy head that mostly lasted and left good lace.  Dark amber orange hue.  Flavor is sweet and filled with citrus and flower tones then ends bitter.  Palate is medium bodied with soft carbonation and water smooth.  Just a fantastic brew from beginning to end.  Sweet, bitter, smooth and refreshing.
A solid APA with nearly a perfect combination of hoppiness and malt character at the same time. Made mowing the lawn seem less of a chore.

This is the way an APA should be! It is a prime example of a perfect APA. Poured a dark amber colour with a full fluffy white head. Aroma was incredibly enticing- pine, grapefruit, soft spice and hops. Taste is pleasent, firm and acidic- more citrus fruit. tastey all around.

bottle.  Very hoppy aroma for an apa, with orange and lemon.  Cloudy, burnt orange color, with very small head that dissapears quickly.  Tastes very hoppy to start, finishes smooth and lingers with a nice citrus flavor.  love the aftertaste.  This might be the perfect beer to drink when grillin out in the summer.

Enjoyed on tap at the Clark Street Ale House in Chicago. This is a fine American pale ale. I don¬ít drink a lot of these. It¬ís smoother and has more body than Oskar Blues¬í Dale¬ís Pale Ale. But also less hoppy than that one.

Pours a murky yet somewhat bright oranfe colour...head was short lasting, citrus aroma. Taste had fine hop presence with nice, rounded malt sweetness...not a hop bomb at all. Would make a great session beer, or summertime beer with bbq.

Pours a cloudy golden amber with a thin head with poor retention and some minimal lacing. Aroma is butterscotch and resinous hops - yum! Tastes more alcoholic than it really is, very fresh and resinous with a nice lingering bitter finish. Body is a bit thin, which gives it the feeling that it¬ís less carbonated than it really is. A good, strong (but not necessarily balanced) IPA, surprisingly hoppy if considered to be an APA. Oily, nice finish, bold and enjoyable.

12 oz bottle (purchased for only 99 cents a bottle), poured into a lager glass. Appearance is a dark amber color. Little to no head from the pour. Aroma is a typical pale ale smell, full of hops. Taste is much like a typical pale ale, with a bit more hop bite than your average PA. Palate is very smooth, a slight alcohol taste to it, but still smooth, definitely not overpowering. Good beer, nothing special, but a solid 3F staple.

12oz Bottle. Pig barn and Amarillo nose. What¬ís all that earth doing in there? A nip of alcohol and a cloak of balsam fir. Peculiar. Pours a clear ruddy amber, with a soapy lace in off-white. Flavor develops a rather complex grain profile. There¬ís toothy oats, chewy bread crust, and some sweet nuttiness. Hops fight back with a fist of resin-filled cones and a bough of pine. Light acerbic quality. Heavily grasses. Hop flavor is rather complex as well. A bit of that FFF soapiness climbs through the hops and malt to scent my nostrils in the alcohol flow. I can¬ít decide if that¬ís okay. Medium-bodied. Not as light as I expected, but not too rich or dense. Smack is phenomenal, with a long citrus peel parch. Well-hopped, well-malted, and well-brewed, with a rather interesting recipe. Thanks Sean!

It smells like delicious flowers. It pours a strong golden wonderfulness. It¬ís hoppy flavor is amazing. It leaves a great flowering taste on my mouth. I am highly impressed with Alpha King¬ís pale greatness!
Sweet malty body, nice deep amber color. The hops aren¬ít as pronounced as some other pale ales. A strong example of a pale ale that doesn¬ít need an overwhelming hop presence.

I picked this up today and while it doesn¬ít have a date on it, the bottle of Gumballhead beside was dated 2003, so it¬ís a good chance this is also from that year.  The hop aroma has mellowed considerably and a sweet malty backbone is showing itself now.  Good head with large bubbles.  The hop flavor is exceptionaly well balanced.  A truly wonderful APA.

Bottle poured deep amber, quickly dissapating head, and excellent lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, hoppy, some bread, citrus, spice, and some sweet malt. The taste is an amazing balance of the aroma, hops, and smooth aftertaste that leaves your mouth tingling. A definite favorite with the right amount of sweet malt, hops, floural aroma, and piny aftertaste.

Bottle and Tap at FFF.  Sweet, strong hop aroma.  Pours a clear orange with a small white head.  Flavor is strong of Centennial hops.  Smooth and easy to drink but almost closer to an IPA because of the hop characters.

Bottle opened by owner of Oldsmar Tap House (Florida). Pours a golden amber color with a thin white head that gracefully laces the glass. Aroma is deep citrus, hops, bread and flowers. Flavor is much of the same, with notes of grapefruit and citrus, spice and hints of malt with a bitter finish.

Amber pour with a soapy white head.  Hoppy aroma. Flavor is up front hops with a nice malt balance,  some citrus.  Finishes mildly bitter,  very drinkable.  I miss you alpha king,  come back to iowa city some day please.

Thanks again to Haslinger for bringing along this brew.  Pour was medium golden with white head.  Aroma was real hoppy accompanied by some malt.  Flavor has a nice floral and citrus character.  Very smooth brew with a nice balanced hop character.  This was delicious.  I would buy again.

Deep red brown pour with a thing white head.  Clear with lots of carbonation and nice lacing.  Really intense aroma of floral hops and lots of fruit - grapefruit and citrus.  Great flavor.  A touch of sweetness and lots of hops and citrus.  A touch of malt and alcohol and a piny dry hop aftertaste.  Very very good!

Pours a clear deep copper with a small bubbly head that dissipates quickly leaving minimal lacing. A few bubbles sit out on the top for the duration of the session.  A big floral, citrus hoppy aroma dominated by grapefruit and pine. Nice sweet malty aroma in the background to balance this out.  Just as in the smell, the taste is dominated by the huge floral and citrus hops - orange, grapefruit, pine, etc. Despite the big hop profile, the balance in the taste is provide by the subtle sweet malts that take over after the initial hop blast.  Medium bodied, creamy with a perfect moderate carbonation that just tickled the tongue. Not too sticky but definitely syrupy sweet with the perfect hop bitterness contrast.  This would be a staple in my fridge if I had access to it. It is an extremely drinkable APA and I could drink a few of these in a sitting. Highly recommended!

Tapped at Dark Lord Day 2008. Began the day with the flagship and was very impressed. Full orange body with white head. Smelled of strong hops and citrus flavors and went down smooth and clean. Not too hoppy but the presence is definitely there. Started my day off with high expectations!

On tap DLD08. Pours a rich orange with a white head. Aroma is citrus, piney, and floral. Taste is very nice, unforgiving hop flavor mixed with some hop flavor. This is a really excellent beer that I would recommend to all.

On tap at Dark Lord Day 08.  Pours a orange/amber color with a off white head.  Has a strong aroma of hops and citrus.  Has a medium mouthfeel.  Tastes like grapefruit, strong grapefruit, and stronger grapefruit.  This beer has some banana flavors in the background with a bold citrus hop finish.  Wow.

Bottle, This is the first Three Floyds that I have tried. It totally lived up to reputation. Pours a nice dark amber color. Aroma is a deep floral bouquet. Taste is dominated by a great abundance of hops. The hops blend together amazingly well and leave your mouth anxious for the next sip. Excellent beer would buy again.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text:
A- Pours a deep, sunset orange with a small head.

S- Smell is absolutely perfect. Sweet, floral tones with a huge aromatic pineyness.

T- Taste is milder than expected from the ipaesque nose but good none the less. Starts off with a huge hit of piney hop flavor but mellows quickly into sweet maltiness and very little if any hop bitterness.

M- Creamy with a good amount of carbonation. Theres something different about the three floyds mouthfeel that I can¬ít put my finger on. At first with Dreadnaught I thought it was lack of carbonation but now im thinking it may be to creamy for a pale ale or ipa.

D- This would be an absolutely excellent session beer. One of my favorite pale ales to date. Has all of the hop flavor but none of the bitterness which makes it pretty drinkable.

Are we sure this isn¬ít an IPA? OMFG this stuff is gold. On tap at FFF. Poured a frothy copper with a strong dank floral and piney aroma. Flavor takes the very intense hop profile and just runs with it. Quite possibly one of the greatest beers ever made.

Bottle. Pours a nice copper. Fantastic floral hop aroma which to me was strong like an IPA, but the flavor is much more balanced and complex. Really like this beer. Wish I could find it in California...
Pours copper with a rocky white head.  Smells of caramel, pine resin, some dough.  Tastes resiny with some touches of bitterness and lots of malty touches.  Very chewy mouthfeel.  Enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 Bottle, courtesy Tony at Oldsmar Tap House. Pours a cloudy brown hue, with minimal watery head, and nice creamy lacing. Very floral hops pound the nose right away. Citrus and pine, too. Nothing like a big hoppy APA. Hops are powerful in the flavor, too, with citrus. A malty background balances the beer perfectly. Very easy to drink, sticky mouthfeel. Could put back a few of these with ease.
this is what an american pale should be.  nice and hoppy, fresh, well balanced.  easy drinking...very, very good.

Draught at the Map Room, Chicago. This golden ale has an aroma of grapefruit and tropical fruits with a complex flavour and a deeply bitter finish. I found it excellent and, to my mind, it¬ís better than Three Floyds Dreadnought.
Poured a fairly clear amber color with a white head. Aroma is mainly of piney hops. Flavor is citrusy hops up front with a nice malt finish and a lingering taste of bitterness. Awesoem Pale ale!
Pours light orange/amber with white head. Aromas of citrus and sweet malt. Flavor is pine, citrus, and malt. This brew is very drinkable and had me thinking IPA.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text: Pretty delicious. I have had this numerous times. Lots of citrus that fades to caramel.

12 ounce bottle. Wow... where should I start on this one? Poured a beautiful dark orange color with almost no head. The aroma was an awesome mix of citrus, hops, and a little bit of pine. The taste was very refreshing and left the taste lingering in the back of your mouth... consisted of a lot of grapefruit-like citrus hints with a nice touch of hops in the background. Finished leaving me wanting more... I have heard the hype of this beer and am now definitely a believer! An awesome brew!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2008 Have had this many times. More of a IPA than a APA. Aroma is hops, citrus and a little malt. Flavor is floral hops, grapefruit and sweet malt. Good beer and the Best APA. 3.9
Re-rate 7/21/08: Have been drinking this a lot lately and if you like hops you will love this beer as it is hoppier than 90% of the IPA‚Äôs out there. Huge graipfruit and floral hop flavors. A true classic that everybody should have the oppertunity to try. 4.2

great beer! pours dark orange with little head that leaves great lacng. wonderous hoppy, piney smell.  the taste is first hoppy  with malty backbone, dry finish that makes you crave more.  great mouthfeel, but look out these will creep up on you fast with 6.0 apv.  could be my favorite beer

This was pretty decent, I was expecting more out of Three Floyds with this one however. Cloudy and warm with a insightful bittering concept. Aroma was weak with a hazy head. Rivers of tingyness also come from within. Overall, it was a good brew, but the characteristics could of been further enhanced.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2009 huge hop aroma, standard FFF notes: pine and grapefruit, all on the cusp of being outright resiny. appearance is a dark amber, not very ¬ípale¬í for an APA. flavor is utterly balanced -- huge hops with a strong malt base. malt comes across strong with light toffee notes but without any grain of sweetness.  a landmark of american craft brewing and one of the most well balanced brews around.
awesome beer! thanks to randy at archer liquors. smells a little sweet, tastes a little sweet at first then taken over by hops. wonderfully balanced. i feel like it could almost be an IPA

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2008 Bottle thanks to Mgumby (Mike). Pours hazy red hibiscus color with luscious white foam. Bright tropical fruit and hop nose. Smooth and perfectly balanced brew that I could incorporate into my regular diet.

12 oz. bottle - thanks hank!!  pours light copper with no head except around the edges; more hops on the nose than the flavors, which are mixed with caramel; drinks with slight bitterness and thin body despite its overall strength you can taste

Bottle as an extra courtesy of CMR1517.  Thanks man!  Pours a nice clear amber color.  Quickly dissipating head with great lacing.  Nose is pine and citrus hops and malt.  Palate is more hops than malt.  As an IPA fan, I really like this one, as it¬ís more of an IPA than an APA in my opinion.  Freakin¬í yum - a great brew and an easy drinker!

Pours a deep amber orange with a two finger creamy tan head. The aroma is waxy citrusy hops, grapefruit, sweet malt, caramel. Nice hoppy flavor, very waxy grapefruit peel, citrus, nice malt background. The palate is waxy and dry. Very complex and big APA.

The color was hazy dark amber.  The head was creamy, frothy, off-white, and laced.  The aroma was excellent.  It smelled like and ipa or imp. ipa.  It was hoppy, pine, alcohol, and light citris.  The flavor was very hoppy, pine, and light citris.  The palate was well carbonated.  The finish was hoppy.

Thin head that dissipated rapidly. Nice hop aroma but not assertive enough for my taste. Not sufficiently carbonated-it was flat. A disagreeable taste that is usually associated with oxidation was a major detraction.  However, this tasting was done at the Three Floyds brewery. Dissappointing given the rave reviews. Definitely not a top choice.

A lot of people have said that the head quickly dissapated but when I poured this brew the head was massive and hung out until the foam dried out on the top of the glass.  Very impressive pour with murky brown appearance and nice carbonation throughout.  Very strong citrus hard to believe this is classified as an american pale with the citrus hoppy notes.  Man it goes down smooth, nice mouthfeel for a pale, citrus and hops throughout but not too much.  I didn¬ít expect the 6% to be noticible and it wasn¬ít.  Just a well balanced beer finishing with a refreshing bitterness.
Another quality beer from 3 floyds how do they do it?

12oz bottle thanks to StFun, extra through trade: pours deep amber brown with slight haze, quick dissipating white head, aroma good notes of caramel and hops, flavor less caramel then the aroma was hinting hops give slight bite but not over the top like an IPA, has some added apple taste that is pretty well mixed with the hops. very solid brew.
Golden amber color in pour with a fingerr thick off white head.  Nice hoppy aroma.  Caramel malt comes through in the flavor but citrusy hops still dominate.

one of the best pale ales i¬íve ever had, even better now that i can get it on tap. rusted amber with a big ole santa¬ís beard on top.  hops abound but balance well. notes of caramel and pomelo. love the brwery, love the beer.

This is my first Three Floyds¬í beer -- been looking forward to this day for quite some time now. Big thanks to StFun for hooking me up! Good sized, quickly dissipating head. Beautiful ruddy gold, amber color. Strong, hoppy aroma (Big on the Cascades). Taste is wonderfully balanced -- hoppy but the malt smooths it out nicely. Really great aftertaste. Reminds me a lot of Bells¬í Two Hearted. All in all a really awesome beer.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2008 Terrific  Probably one  the best Pale Ale I¬íve had to date.  Great flavor...hoppy, touch of orange/citrus.  Cloudy orange/amber color.  Really good Pale...looking forward to trying more Three Floyds beers

12oz bottle courtesy of Acknud.  Poured a beautiful rusty amber with a big, rocky off white head.  Lacing on the glass was abundant.  Big citrus hop aroma with a nice malty and somewhat bitter finish.
Three Floyds Alpha King is a very good Pale Ale. I enjoyed the strong and smooth flavor as this beer tastes great going down.

Thank you Daniel TheCheeseMan! Red-golden with a huge, nice and creamy head. The aroma is wonderfully hoppy with loads of spruce, fruit, citrus and caramel. The flavour has citrus, pomelo, oranges, spicy mango, papaya, caramel and a nice, slightly dry, bitterness in the finish. This is a really, really nice beer!

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2008 Out of a bottle, poured a nice amber color. Smelled sweet and hoppy. Taste a nice bitterness. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Good pale ale. *****UPDATE****** Stfun just hooked me up with a "fresh" bottle. Big head on this one, followed by a good lacing. Aroma of sweet malts and hops. Redish-brown in color. Taste is really sweet up front, but a nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Good texture and easy to drink, I can see why people would like/love this but I guess APA are not my cup of tea. Thanks josh for sending this one again!
Just the right amount of bitterness for me. Great color and aroma...you really can¬ít go wrong with this one

pours a beautiful deep blood orange with a thick frothy head that lasts.  aroma is sweet grapefruit with a flavor that has hints of apple and a nose breath of alcohol.  Palate felt slightly watered down which I wasn¬ít expecting.  Over all, a little disappointed since i¬íd been assured it would be great by people I trust - I¬ím guessing this might have been a bad bottle - i¬ím in CA and it¬ís hard to find.

First three Floyds and i must say WOW!!! great beer nice copper color, decent foam. Nose is sweet citrus hop, good carbonation, good malt and hop comination, grapefruit orange and caremel malt, WOW what a great beer.
A very clean hoppy fragrance with a great 1/2 inch head. beautiful amber color with slight clinging lacing and a rich, bright flavor.

aroma was very cleanly citrus hops.  very fresh hop aroma that smelled like they were just pulled from my freezer at home.  beer poured amber with 2 fingers of head, that remained as a film throughout the duration of drinking it.  Flavor like the aroma is full of citrus hops, grapefruit most prominently.  The only problem was that I found it to be a little to sharp and course for my taste, but wasn¬ít over the top.  plate was medium bodied with the perfect amount of carbonation for a pale ale.  very good pale ale

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 Pours orange, with a thick head. Smells of hops just cascade all over the place. This beer doesn¬ít mess around. Strong STRONG flavor, citrus and bursting with hops. Nice clean and bitter aftertaste. Officially is just 6% alcohol, but it kicks a lot harder than that! I¬ím really liking this one now.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2008 Amber pour with a medium white sudsy head, some larger bubbles.  Extreme aromatic floral hops smell and lots of citrus, grapefruit.   Bittersweet flavor of grapefruit, some malt and lots of bitter hops.  Light airy body thats easy drinking.

bottle from rollinhard, thanks!...pours a hazy woody brown color with a wispy light tan head . it sticks around for a bit a leaves a small ring of lacing in the glass.
aroma is coppery malt, lemon and grapefruit skins, caramel and hay. there is a spiciness in the flavor (cinnamon?) from the hops to go along with pine, fresh apple fruitiness and citrus. it finishes dry and clean. ready for the next sip! a light hop grassiness lingers in the aftertaste. full bodied. creamy mouth feel. very easy to session and pairs great with food!

12oz bottle.  Pours a clear, dark amber with thin white head which dissipated quickly.  This had an aroma of grapefruit and floral hops with sweet malt in there too.  The taste was grapefruit hops and sweet caramel malt.  This is not your west coast-type of APA/IPA that is clear amber with tons of hops.  This one had a malt balance to it that was very present although the hops did kick in more at the end.  Mouthfeel was medium with a good bitter aftertaste.
bottle thanks to Bullzeye.  murky dark amber pour with raisins, caramel and apricots on the nose.  very easy on the palate with a small amount of hops detectable.  very smooth nonetheless

Draft at Pub in Ida Noyes.  Clear copper with thick, creamy off-white head.  Aroma is pine and grapefruit, but fruity and not too sharp.  Flavor is wonderful, grapefruity, floral, and balanced with caramelly malts in the middle.  Very long, interesting flavor profile.  Mouth feel is incredible, creamy and rich with the perfect amount of carbonation.  There is no unpleasant aftertaste.  This beer is rich and interesting, but also makes a great session brew.  One of my all time favorites, and the benchmark for all other APAs.

Copper to amber in color the beer poured a 1/2" tight head that dissipated slowly.  The nose was filled with piney hops followed by a bit of grapefruit, spice and caramel.  These flavors cointinue into the mouth which was concentrated and had good weight though remained light on its feet.  The midpalate had richness and sweetness to it which gradually turned dry toward the finish.  This is a really well made beer that I could drink all of the time.

Possibly because of its "cult" status, I think I expected more from this beer than what I experienced.  Opening it kind of reminded me of Christmas without the Red Rider BB Gun...just not as satisfying as I would have liked.  All of the flavors that I expected were there (citrus, pine, and floral notes) but the balance was missing.  Overall, good beer but not great.

Easily, and I mean EASILY, one of the best session beers ever.  If I could get this, I could literally drink it all day.  

Beautiful copper color with a very small head and some decent carbonation.

Smells faintly hoppy with a nice solid maltiness to it.

The hops are actually pretty subtle in this...at first.  It¬ís on the finish when they really shine through.  They really seem to take off on the finish and linger around for a long, long time... very well done.

If I could get this beer here,  all the other session beers that I have would instantly be traded for more of this.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2008 12oz bottle. Pours a orangish yellow color with a thinnish white head that leaves just a little lace on the glass. Smells citrusy with a hint of malt in the background. I get kind of a dark hop citrus smell up front. Big taste to this brew. Hoppy and malty and citrusy all at once. Thin and bitter crisp with a good carbonation. Very, very drinkable and good. I would drink alot of this if it was around, plus it is 6% so its worth your while.

Pours a burned orange with a nice sized off white head that laces. Smells of citrus rind, floral, hops and a malt. Lots of yummy bitter hops with an awesome malt balance. Nice bite and dryness but doesnt linger on the tongue. This reminds me of Nugget Nectar. Feels smooth, crisp and delicious in the mouth. Drinkability goes on and on. A session beer classic. Cheers 3 F¬ís.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2008 Bottle.  Copper bronze color.  No head.  Light carbonation.  Hazy.  Citrusy sweet candied fruit hints.  Inviting yet not too straightforward.  Medium body.  Clear, pure flavoring that splits like a fork in the road in the mouth:  berry, alcohol, faintly sugary combo to the roof of the mouth with a buttery bitterness on the tongue.  Solid offering though the bitterness is a little too salty for my tastes

Bottle. via trade with drewbeerme.  Amber/ caramel colored pour with an ivory head that leaves heavy lacing.  Citrusy hop aroma with a good deal of caramel notes.  Straight forward and bitter with a slight caramel and crystal malt backbone.  Lemon and grapefruit notes with a bit of grass and some straw.  Very fruity.  This is definitely a hop lovers Pale Ale.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2008 Bottle. Gorgeous clear, amber-brown color. Nice light white head that lasts a while. Hoppy aroma, with light citrus. Taste is refreshing and bright, of hops and currents. Great pale ale.

Pours a dark copper color with a nice off-white head leaving lacing all the way down the glass. Starts off citrusy in the nose, but then hits you with a floral bouquet that seems never ending and always changing. I also noticed grapefruit as others have mentioned, there is also a slight maltiness in the nose, but hardly noticeable. On to the taste, the grapefruit taste came in strong, slight caramel for a second, but finishes with a lemon zest, a hint of pine is present throughout entire taste. Medium bodied and average carbonation level, pretty slick. Just a flat out good beer here, one of my favorites to keep around. Use caution with this one, once having one of these, you will not be able to taste much else in a beer until the following day.

12 oz from Acknud shared with Juart.  Pours amber with very small lacing head.  Citrus, pine, floral hops in the nose.  Teary at how complex the hops were.  Same hop flavors in the taste.  I have never tasted something that so perfectly balanced all that hops and malts.  If I¬ím going to weep, it is because I can¬ít buy this in my state.

12oz bottle, courtesy of Stine. Pours a dark mahogany blended with amber, and is topped by a small off white head. Almost light brown in appearance, and little to no retention. Does leave a layer of foam and an edging of bubbles though. A very pathetic attempt at lacing is made. Nose of bitter citric hops, caramel and toffee malts, grass clippings and pine resin. Doesn¬ít break any boundaries in regards to the flavor profile, but still very tasty. Hops, oranges, lemons and pine nuts all vie for attention, with the hops winning in the end. A nice sweet malt backing is present in each sip, helping to even everything out. Tastes to me more like an IPA than an APA, but I don¬ít know enough about that kind of stuff to say for sure. Oily, slick mouthfeel. Slides right off the tongue into the back of the throat. Finishes with a bright green hop kick, backed by citrus fruit and then ultimately sweet malts.

12 oz. bottle via trade with Acknud.  Split with Naka.  Pours hazy orange/amber color with creamy white head, quickly disapating.  Big old resinous hop aroma, notes of pine and floral, with some citrus.  This could be one of the best beers ever.  Good malt start, backbone if you will, then a huge dose of citrus and floral hops.  I could literally drink this all day.  It competes with all east coast "hop bombs, plus the skunk-tastic west coast IPAs.  This is literally the pinnacle combination of east and west IPAs. My God is this good.  I"m done talking.  Delicioso.
Great smell even better taste.  Very refreshing hoppy finish.  My new fav pale ale!

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2007 Wow. Awesome brew - the first pale ale I¬íve really enjoyed. Nice off-white head, reddish gold color in the glass. Aroma is mostly citrus with a fair amount of caramel malt. Hops are prominent in the aroma, but are more subtle than I expected. Taste is more of the same. Very refreshing, with a clean hoppy-citrus finish. Palate is perfect for this style. Fantastic beer overall.

Great pale ale!  Very strong hop aroma with citrus, spices, and pine.  Aroma also has some sweetness as well.  Appearance is deep copper with off-white head that fades.  Flavor is of lightly toasted malts, followed by heavy hops.  Finish is of mild hoppy bitterness.  Mouthfeel is creamy & smooth wih decent carbonation, different than alot of APAs and IPAs.
Super hop bomb on the nose and taste. A bit sweeter than your average pale ale. This one might have been a bit old. I¬íd like to have a fresh one.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: I guess I forgot to rate this one as I drank it.  Too bad because I probably will not have a chance to get another any time soon. I remember that it was hoppy and enjoyable. I will rerate this one day and give specifics.
this beer was so good that i bought a shirt. im really happy that in my life, i got to drink a beer this good

Pours an almost clear amber with a small tanned head. Bitter with a sweet backbone. Nice kick-you-in-the-teeth hopsprofile. Pine and citrus aromas. Also caramel and cream. Medium to high carbonation. Full creamy mouthfeel. Bitter finish with some piney aromas. Good stuff... Thanks to drewbeerme!

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2011 2011-02-01, bottle at √òrsted, Copenhagen, 7-5-7-4-14=37Beautiful dark amber color; small head. It¬ís a solid IPA, almost double, with a lot of Crystal malt and toffee flavor; bitter, resiny, coreect balance, unfortunately both the aroma and flavor don¬ít show a fresh hopping (the bar received the bottles just a few days ago).2010-05-05, draught at Mikkeller Bar, opening night, 7-4-7-5-15=38Hazy red-amber color. Light aroma of Manuka honey, sweetish, malt. Good perfumy toffee flavor; strong hopping, good resins and hop oils. Good and straight, but missing some dynamicity.2007-09-29, draught at Hop Leaf, Chicago, 7-4-8-5-16=40Beautiful amber color; thin creamy head. Quite good body strength, very good malt and toffee flavor, sweet. The aroma is citrusy and resiny. Excellent aromatic hopping and with the necessary sweet body. Excellent.

12 oz bottle-Trade w/Acknud-Pours a copper color w/a moderate tan, foamy head & great lacing which lasts thru the beer. Strong hop flavor up front, traces of citrus & grapefruit. Long bitter finish. I may not be the best judge of this beer as APA¬ís are not usually my favorite style, but I wasn¬ít all that impressed by this one.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2008 I have nothing insightful to add.  Far better tasters than I have tried this and said all the appropriate things.  I got even a tiny bit more than what I expected out of the best-rated Pale in the world - a really delightful pomegranate-type fruitiness comes out in this.  Just unreal for the style.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2007 Poured on draft at The Galway Tribes (Frankfort, IL). Poured a nice darker copper color. Head was nice and managed to stick around for my adventure. Extremely citrus hoppy aroma. I found myself continuing to smell it throughout the whole experience. Taste is marvelous. Very citrusy, hoppy, and with some very pleasant sweet malts. A wonderful beer that will wage a war on your palate that everyone wins.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 Sweet jesus this smells amazing!!! Amazing aroma of oranges, grapefruit, pretty much any citrus you can think of is in there, but it¬ís a sweet citrus aroma, unlike an IPA that is more of a bitter aroma. This reminds me of those sweedish berries candies. My god i couldn¬ít get my nose out of the glass. Flavour is sweet, its ALL citrus, with that amazing sweetness to finsih, very slight bitterness. WOW. i¬ím in love! MAN CANDY!
[ Thanks to fonefan ] Dark cobber of color with a orange head. An aroma of grass, grapefruit and weak notes of malt. A flavor of grass, grapefruit and malty notes.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of Acknud. Pours a hazy amber color with 1/2" white head. Godd continous lacing on glass. You can really smell the hops in the nose as well as citrus floral notes. Flavor was heavy with hops. some citrus, fruit flavor as well, grapefruit? perhaps. Typical hop bitter aftertaste. Another winner from 3 Floyds.

bottle from WeeHeavy SD. You know, I¬íve had this beer many time times......It¬ís a good beer, but I don¬ít how people rave over it. I mean, it¬ís good and all but I wouldn¬ít buy a case...Which I can because they sell it here in PA. Anyway, too much bullshit, let¬ís get down to the nitty gritty. Hazy orange/apricot in color with nice sized white head. Good hoppy aroma. The flavor was mild with hops, light malt, tea,and light sweetness. Nice bitter finish.

bottle.  pours a clear red amber with a medium head that rather quickly fades to a film, but leaves a good lacing.  smell is huge citrus floral hop, with quite a bit of sweet-smelling malt, maybe even some rye bread.  cotton candy and spicy, orange and even a bit of grapes, and a great tangy malt backing it all up.  taste is like that, with a bit of grapefruit.  the hops and malt balance is amazing.  moderately bitter palate, with a touch of sweetness for balance.  medium bodied and rather lightly carbonated (my only complaint).  this is the most amazing american pale ale i¬íve ever had.  i really wish i could get it more regularly.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 Pours a hazy amber colour with small fizzy white head that disapates quickly. Nose of caramel malts, grapefruit hops, and pine. Initial taste grapefruit hops overlayed but a mild syrupy caramel malts. Slight sticky mouthfeel. Finishing with a coating of bitter hops and sweet malts. Palate duration is excellent. Medium Body. Definitely Very Drinkable.
Draft from Three Floyds Brewpub.  Amazing citrusy hop aroma and flavor with a good bitterness.  Quite possibly my favorite beer.
One of my favorite beers.  Alpha King is the best American Pale Ale I have had.  Heavy hoppy aroma and flavor.  Always in my beer fridge.

Bottle. [ Courtesy of drewbeerme ] Unclear medium orange color with a average to large, creamy, excellent lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is heavy hoppy, pine, grapefruit, orange. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (271007)

Bottle obtained from HogTownHarry. Slightly hazy, rich copper colour with a small white head. Nice body, full without being too heavy or syrupy. Both aroma and flavour are chock full of big hops, with lots of citrus and pine, but enough malt to keep things in check. A classic - glad to finally try it!

This beer is hands down one of the best beers ive ever had.  Great color, aroma, and overall, taste.  This is a tough beer for me to get in my area, so whenever im in the chicago/NW Indiana area, i load up

OK this might be my favorite beer, it is hands down the most well balanced APA out there with the amount of hop flavor that it carries.  Smooth and hoppy on tap, perfect alongside food.  I think the main reason it tops Goose Island IPA is that this always comes in a pint, rather than the occasional tulip which I have never been a fan of.  No syrupy taste whatsoever, which is awesome.

Thanks to theisti for this great bottle. Great pale ale color with perfect little white head. Nose is big and hoppy...citrus as well. Much more like a good IPA than a Pale. Taste is fantastic and has a great mouthfeel. Pine, hops, ripe citrus and a good malt balance. Finishes clean and flavorful....this is great. Thanks T.

On tap. Hops, Hops, Hops!!! This is not a beer to start out a newbie. A deep breath reveals  pine, hops, herbs, citrus. A walk through deep pine forests, one inhales and a bitter menthol type aroma but instead of cool and mellow like a pine forest... one is transported to a remote island, grapefruit is growing from the pine trees. You take a taste, sweet, sour, piney, herbal. This brew will cure what ales ya! Thick, balanced, there is a bit of an acidic bite that can get a little out of control if you continue to drink this, but otherwise the perfect beer to sip, over and over and over again! I would highly recommend.

Thanks Gregis!!!  This has a nice medium brown/copper color.  The aroma is fantastic, full of hops.  I could smell this all day.  This has more grapefruit taste than I thougt it would but not over the top.  Very drinkable.  Next time I am in an area where they have this I will pick plenty up.

Nice looking pour with bubbly head.   Very citrusy (in particular grapefruit) aroma screams HOPS at you without even taking a sip.  Flavor is very strong hops from beginning to finish.
