Oh, Mama.  Had it once from the bottle.  This time had it at the brewery poured by Nick Floyd.  This is great stuff.  Cloudy copper with small beige head.  Hops/grapefruit to the nose.  Medium body.  Flavor was crisp and clean and refreshing.  Real kick ass for an American Pale Ale.

A truly unique APA.  The aroma is sweet and citrusy.  The flavor is smooth but hoppy bergamot and grapefruit notes.  If Earl Grey tea were a beer, this is exactly what it would taste like.  I look forward to tasting it (and other TF brews) again in the future.

sweet flowery bubblegum aroma.  nice head.  well carbonated.  not bad at all, though possibily a bit too sweet.  cascade hops are what i picked up on the most.  i¬íll have to try it again in a proper setting.
Full of tasty citrus hops, mainly grapefruit. Nice amber color. Has a nice transition from sweet to hoppy. Give this a shot, its a great beer.

The best Pale Ale I¬íve had the pleasure of trying. Dark amber, copper color. Aroma is spectacular. Fills the room with citrus hoppiness. Taste is initially awesome citrus sweet followed by a more than modest hop bitterness that lingers a bit. Finish allows for some alcohol notes to meander in my nostrils. My first experience with Three Floyds, and what a remarkable first impression. Reminds me of one of my favorite brewers, Victory, and their Hop Devil IPA.

This is a great example of a pale ale.  This is how a pale ale should taste, brewers take note, and use this as your example.  A beautiful hop aroma, with a nice complemeting malt backbone.  Lots of fruit, some great buttery tasting malty flavor to compliment the finish.  Superior!

I can¬ít imagine how the aroma of a pale ale could be better - is this even beer?  The taste is fruity and complete, with hops leading, but not leaving the palate killed via dry burn.  This is as drinkable and enjoyable as I¬íve experienced in an otherwise modest style.

Great beer. Very reminiscent of the drednaught IPA, which is unfortunate because it doesnt have the complexity, just the smell. This beer has a great fruity taste and a thick frothy head(mmmm). Great hops.

12oz bottle traded by atpayne, word adam, this shit is da bomb.  really nice looking beer, robust caramely color with a really reasonable proportioned head..  white creamy fluffy, whipped buttery head.  mmmmmm...  smells so danks sticky and hops, oh hops.    a lighter dreadnaught...really fruity and almost to very well being an actual ipa
You know, this is the easiest of the Three Floyds beers to find, yet it took me forever to try it.  What the hell was I thinking, this is great!  2 for 2 on good beers tonight.
Bottle.  Pours a beautiful dark golden with a very large head.  Went perfectly with the meatball sandwich I was eating at the time.  Will be coming back for more.

Clean bright hop nose, pale copper color, big foamy head. Creamy honey-ish malt body up front turns quickly to a sharp, spicy hop finish that sticks around for a while. Not convinced on the balance. Enjoyable though.
Amber colored, little frothy head, liveley carbonation. Medium hoppy nose, kind of bubblegummy. Nice malty taste - the hoppiness comes in the end but weak. Medium but short aftertaste.

A really nice malty, rich grapefruit aroma with an deep amber body and off-white head which diminished quickly.  Great flavors of citrus, malt, and hop bitterness.  Wonderful mouthfeel -- dry, bitter and lasting.  I¬ím very impressed.

I scored a fairly fresh batch a few months ago and should have written notes back then. 
I tasted the same batch recently, and it (like many Ipas) has lost its hoppy "edge".  
Still a wonderful brew, but the hops have dulled with a 3 month aging.  
This was superb fresh, but average after a few months on the shelf.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2004 When I was first introduced to this beer, I was warned that it wasn¬ít for everyone, and at the very least took some getting used to, after all "it¬ís not normal." I¬íd already had an affection for the hops, and, well, it was love at first sniff and sip. 
Years later, after the bloom of fresh infatuation has mellowed, how does the beer compare, especially after this tongue has met so many others, with abundant charms? That is what we seek to discover...
Perfect crimson-tinged nectarine hue, hazy, and blessed with a beautiful bed of froth up on top, leaving delicate lace, enticing the eye. Aroma makes matters worse for the thirst, big fruit, fresh hops, peachy, melon, orange, and, yes, mango, and more, a bountiful bouquet that keeps the nose happy and hoppy. Man, but I need a taste, though!
An explosion in the mouth, the hops are a bursting throughout, but so well buttressed by malt, that any bitterness is mellow and well smoothed out, after an initial bite, at least. Like chomping into a ripe tangerine, juice splashing on the corners of the mouth and dripping down the chin. Though hoppiness flows freely, and bitterness peeks through time and again, the mouthfeel is actually soft and luxuriant, body is medium, and the overall effect is a constant joyride for the palate. A lively and rewarding ale, and a real American classic, a jewel in the craft-brew crown. Count yourself lucky if you can grab these with ease.
Ah, I once had it on-tap around here...those were some fine days...
Sour grainy taste with an aftertaste that never stops.  Normal ale appearance with better than average head.

My first three floyds beer.  I smelled it as soon as I popped the cap.  Hops much?  Pours with a good sized, white, rocky (nigh continental) head.  Color is beautifully copper/orange, and absolutely crystal clear.  Beautiful.  I¬ím going to sit here and smell this for a while.  Ooh ya.  OK, let¬ís taste it.  Pleasently sweet on the tip of the tongue, with an affirmative hop bitterness that flows down the tongue.  Hop taste is wonderful.  Finishes clean and dry with a pleasently bitter hop aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is lighter than I expected.   What a wonderful beer.  I wish I could get more of this, but I guess I¬íll have to make do with the three I have.
a pretty good beer.  but not the best aftertaste.  best sipped over the course of an hour.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2004 Clear deep reddish amber with a medium frothy off white head.  Huge hoppy aroma of resin, grapefruit, orange peel, pine, caramel and apricot.  Medium watery body with a moderate amount of carbonation.  Flavor of caramel, pine, orange peel, and grapefruit, with hints of toasted bread and alcohol.  A little disappointing, given the high score here.  A very good beer regardless.

Thank you to atpayne for this one, which I am honoring by making it #500.  Pours dark straw/amber with a super head and lacing.  Great dark aroma of hops, fruit, citrus, and scotch.  Tastes very hoppy, with some citrus, honey, scotch, cognac, and malt at the finish.  Extremely complex, but not super heavy.  Finishes very smooth, crisp, clean, hoppy, and complex, with subtle scotch, cognac, honey, citrus, and white grapes.  Like some of my other high ratings, this one doesn't knock me out in any particular category, (aroma and appearance are awesome, though) it is the sum of the parts that make this one a kick ass brew.  As a side note, the alcohol may be the best hidden of any beer I've ever had.  I could literally drink these all night (at least until I passed out).  Extraordinary beer.  Thanks again to atpayne.

Very hoppy, similar to an IPA (which I've quickly tired of) due to bitterness. Complex aroma, great amber color.  Just the right amount of carbonation.  Very satisfying overall, but a little too bitter.

A great beer from a great brewery.  I nice amber color, with a head that displays some staying power.  A slightly sweet hoppy aroma with an explosive flavor of malt with an extra helping of hops.  One of my favorites
I found the taste a bit of a letdown.  Something reminiscent of a fruit and ginger ale punch.  Color, aroma, and appearance (if served at a proper temperature) are all very good.

Very strong aroma of hops and flavor of hops.  Although, I detect a faint similarity between this aroma and that of old martini olives.  There is a serious bitterness to this beer.  An excellent American Pale Ale
Hoppy-citrus aroma comes from this copper colored brew.  Great taste...sweet malt nose with a huge kick of hops for a smooth finish. Very nice Pale Ale.

super-fresh hoppy aroma, with a hint of sweet malt. man, i like the smell of those american hops (definitely one of those ones that starts with "c").  ultra-smooth taste, great complex taste of malt and hops that finishes clean and hoppy.  an awesome beer!
Damn nice beer out of the bottle.  Full of hop aroma, full head that lasted indefinately.  Nice body in the mouth, malt with a huge hopping at the end.  Would have another and then another.

Thanks to joeybgood for this treat!
Grapefruit juice is one of my favorite flavours - so too is grapefruit hopped beer. This one smells like a Florida fresh grove beside a stand of pine trees. The rich copper colour and slightly off white frothy head are beyond my expectations for an American Pale - beautiful. Grapefruit and hops engage in a fresh sweet and bitter  battle in your mouth - but only briefly as it is a very dry mouthfeel. Bitter puckering finish - very nice.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2005 Great brew!  Pours a beautiful clear dark amber with an off-white head. Has a vibrant, fresh, floral piney Pacific NW hop aroma. Taste is sweet with notes of caramel, toasted malt, hops, grapefruit, citrus and pine. This is like mainlining Centennial hops; and that¬ís not a problem with me. Plesantly sweet, plenty hoppy but non-harsh bitterness. Leaves a nice dry, bitter aftertaste. Medium body, smooth texture and subtle carbonation. Great lacing and head retention. Highly recommended!
Very nice aroma. Sweet and like honeydew melon almost. Green and fresh. Mild sweetness with very dry finish. Powdery. Nice! Thanks matta for sharing!

UPDATED: APR 15, 2005 Huge hop presence in the nose, with much to offer in the malt department. Taste is quite sweet with huge hops to make it nice and bitter. I actually prefer this from the bottle slightly more, as it is less sweet. At any rate, an amazing session ale.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2004 Pours the color of a blood orange with a pale thin head. Wonderful aroma of citrus and hops not overpowering, but nice and strong. Decent mouthfeel but a little dry, very bitter hops taste, quite nice actually, I think one of the better pale ales I have had! Very good!!
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2004 #200!  hops! god this is bitter, and i like it!  burgandy color pour, hops aroma. strong taste of citrus.  small head that never leaves the beer.  this is a magnificant beer.
Excellent pale ale. The hops is very apparent in the aroma, and follows the flavor through till the end, yet does not leave an aching aftertaste in the mouth. Very refreshing.
HOPS. Oh my god hoppy. They aren't kidding about the alpha acids in this. Has a terrific aroma, very strongly hoppy all the way through.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2004 Pours a deep reddish-brown with an exquisite, citrusy hop aroma. Full-bodied and flavorful, this heavily hopped brew finshes with a nice bitter finish. A terrific beer!
A nice dark copper color with a frothy head.heavy tatses of malts and real sweet.I want to try other beers from this brewer.

Poured from the 12oz bottle with psychadelic green and pink cap which indicates it was brewed and bottled at the actual Three Floyd's Brewery in Munster, IN. 

Smells beautiful of hop fruity juiciness. 

Big hops up front with citrus flavors, very floral, and is also backed up with some nice balancing malt. Very sweet, fruity, but the finish is dry and bitter and clean. 

One awesome American Pale Ale, the flavors are great the smell is intoxicating on its own, and the body is full and heavy enough without being too heavy.

I highly recommend this one, I've had it bottled as well as on tap. If you're ever out one night and see this on tap, yeah, order it up

Pours a hazy orange with a big, long-lasting head.  Aroma a combination of fresh smelling domestic hops and sweet malt.  Flavor is initially sweet, followed by an almost soapy burst of hops, which linger. Kinda rough, actually.   Overall, a bold beer, but either somewhat over-rated, or I have a tired bottle.  No way this is a better APA than Red Seal.
Attractive hazy copper coloring. Wonderful malt start with a solid hops kick to follow. Finishes dry but not overly bitter. As good an APA as I've had.
Wonderful floral boquet and rich amber color.  hoppy bitter falvor, and nice finish.

This pours an amber colored beer that has a good head which quickly recedes. Clean aroma of hops with just a whiff of malt behind it. The flavor has an IPA like hoppiness with just a touch of hop astringency. The finish is slightly bitter. Overall this needs just a little more maltiness to smooth out some of the little coarse edges. A bid thanks to Slikwily for sending this trade!

Hazy brown ale with a thin head. Resinous hops and citrus  flatters the nose. The taste is even more intense, with hops which coats the mouth, and with creamy texture, this beer is an excellent Pale ale. Goes well with a gruyere.
Pours a light copper with a think offwhite head. Aroma is citrusy and full of hops. Pine, citrus fruits, and a hint of maltiness. This was a great pale ale. probably the best I've had.

Bottle pours a hazy amber with minor dishwater head. &nbsp Good carbonation, average lacing. &nbsp Large aroma of hops, flora, and sweet candy. &nbsp Initial taste is a bit biting, but it quickly mellows and becomes quite smooth. &nbsp Bitterness that appears at the back of the mouth vanishes quickly... very interesting. &nbsp A bit malty on the finish, with some minor hop notes. &nbsp Flavor throughout is very subdued tho. &nbsp It definately pale and has a dry finish. &nbsp Points for that, but flavor could have been a bit more assertive. &nbsp Thanks goes out to Pabobcat for the trade!
UPDATED: MAY 24, 2004 Pours a copper color with medium white head. Very floral and citrus aroma. Flavor is floral with heavy citrus hop flavor and bitterness. Malt flavor is a little underpronounced.

A slightly cloudy brown and orange beer comes out of the bottle.  I won't discount for the cloudyness because it is from the yeast added for bottle conditioning.  The color is quite striking.  It has a wonderfully sweet floral hop aroma.  There is a great citrus hop flavor that goes nicely with a cool sweetness that envelops the mouth.  There is a nearly perfectly ballanced bitterness.  A hint of the floral hop present in the aroma is distinguishable.  This is a great beer.  I'm so happy that there is good brewer in Indiana.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2005 Deep amber color with big white head. Floral hop aromas. Great blend of malts and hops. Nice West Coast grapefruit flavor. A nice beer at 6.5%

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2004 I am re-rating this and getting rid of my old one. My palate has changed a lot in the last six months. I tried Dreadnaught and loved it. I cannot get my hands on that, but this is a regular beer avaialable where I live. Color is a relatively clear, dark orange with some head and some lacing. Lots of citrus and pine in the aroma. The flavor is orange rind with some bread and a little cinnamon. Great bitter and sweet aftertaste. Wonderful all around.

Forms a large off-white head with a dark amber appearence.  Has a chewy and piney hop flavor with a clean and sweet finish.  This beer could easily called Dreadnaught Light.  Just an absolutelty wonderful beer!

Clear dark amber body with a head light cream colored head and nice lacing.  Strong hop aroma(both pine and citrus hoppiness), with a faint maltiness in the background.  Initially a citrus hop taste accompanied by a minimal malt counterbalance. Has a strong yet still pleasing bitter finish that becomes slightly sweet as the beer warms.  Quite easily the best APA I have ever had.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2004 Pours an amber color, quite clear except for a few large floaties.  Forms a thin beige head that does not stick around too long.  An immediate aroma of American hops wafts from my glass.  Notes of lychee, grapefruit & other citrus fruits are in the nose, it smells slightly sweet & nectar like, there is a hint of caramel malt here as well.  Ooh, quite bitter; this beer finishes with a drying intense bitterness.  Overall this beer is only slightly sweet, it has a light body & is focused entirely on the hop component.  The hops are over the top, but perhaps it is missing some hop flavor.  There is lots of bitterness, but it feels like it is missing some balancing hop nectar flavor.  Underlying the hop attack there seems to be some nuttiness, as well as some caramel notes.  This beer is all about the hop attack, not much malt here, so if you don't like hops stay away.  Luckily I do like hops so this beer is just fine.  Perhaps a bit too unbalanced for an everyday drinking beer, but every once in a while is nice.

Large creamy head atop a clear amber body. 
Great hop aroma. Grapefruit-like, but this does not meet your average "grapefruit" description. It is very fresh. Starts a little light. Middle is a sweet hoppiness and a bit of strawberry sweetened grapefruit. Finish is more bitter and dry but still good. Nothing unpleasant in this at all.

I was truly impressed by this beer. I commented to DavidP that if I had drank every beer I had available to me, I would be happy drinking this everyday after that.
Copper coloured with a good head and lacing. Aroma is grapefruit. Flavor is sweet and fruity with nice bitterness and a smooth bitter finish.
Outstanding APA. Very hearty on the hops. Strong taste. One of the best. nice sweet taste as it slides down your throat.

12 oz [bottled in Munster]: darkly bronzed body.  Pours with a generous, sticky, icing like head.  Gooey lacing around the edges.  Aromatic grapefruits, oranges, and dry piney hops make a solid aroma.  Tightly carbonated palate delivers the citrus and bitter hops flavours throughout the mouth. . . though these flavours are great, a bit a of malt balance here could only make a great beer better.  As you can only expect from the brothers floyd a wonderful tasty treat.
Brown, almost red with a white head.  Nice hoppy smell. this beer is loaded with hop flavor without being overbearing.  Great!

Draught, at the The Blind Tiger, NY.</br> When Spiesy & AustinPowers drank. Amber with a lacy head. Has a very feral hop aroma. Strong bitter flavour and good long after taste. I didn¬ít write enough about this famous beer. It¬ís hard to stop to write something when your talking your head off and downing the beer at pace. Anyway all the beers were enjoyable.

intensely hoppy, especially the aroma. 
Not really pale - more of a red / brown colour, plenty of malts there too. fruity citrus aftetaste. dangerously drinkable.

Nice amber color, creamy white head that clings well. Nice strong cascade hop aroma? Good hop bitterness and hop flavors. Has a chinook and cascade bitterness and flavor. Medium body with some crystal malt flavor, but not much. A very well done American Pale Ale, which I will have again.
APA?  This seemed far too bold;  I would classify it as an IPA.  Huge citrusy, piney flavor and aroma, dry, bitter and enjoyable finish.  Did I mention how great it looked in the glass?  Top notch.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2008 ReRate:  I have to admit that sometimes Three Floyds is all over the map on consistency.  I recently picked up a sixer that didn¬ít have any dust on the bottles, looked new.  As soon as I cracked the cap I could smeel those wonderful Three Floyds hops.  Amazing malt flavor with layers of hops complexity.  This sixer was pure heaven.  I swear God himself made this batch.  I had to rerate because it was the best I have ever tasted.  If they could consistently provide this on my store shelves I might drink nothing else.  Note:  I bought every sixer at the store.  When they restocked the beer was off again...hop aroma low, malt seemed thin.  Almost like they ran a 2nd runnings AK at the brewery.  C¬íMon Nick!  Keep it consistent.

Thanks to jcalabre for this. APAs really don't get any better than this. Beautiful copper color with a small head that hangs around and laces nicely. Very nice malt character, smooth, excellent balance with a great finish. What more can you ask for?

Bottle pours a beautiful dark amber color with a nice head a good lace.  It looks real good.  The aroma is hoppy and sweet.  The flavor is hoppy with good malt.  The palate is good and thick.  Yep, I could have more of this.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2004 One of the the best APAs I've ever had.  The Stone 7th Anniversary might be a little better.  Hop aroma is beautiful.  Has more to it than just being piney.  It has some mango and orange to it as well.  Nice little head left in the glass sitting on top of the clear, copper-amber juice.  Flavor consists mostly of hops, but has a nice malty backbone.  Reminds a little of the Stone 7th anniversary.  I would have to compare the two to say which I truely like best.  I do like it better than the Sierra Nevada Harvest.
Good sized head with some decent lacing.  Nice copper color.  I like the finish, I can't really describe it too well, other than to say I can feel it for quite awhile in the back of my tongue.
(Bottle)  Pours a copper color with a little bit of haziness and a medium-sized white head.  This is a wonderful hoppy tasting ale with an incredible finish.
Loses marks with the light finish.  Exotic fruity strong hop flavour.  Delicious.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2005 Brunt orange color, swirling haze and a few flakes, light carbonation, and a thin white head. Nice citrus and floral hop aroma. This is a very hoppy pale ale with nice citrus grapefruit flavor that is exceptionally well-balanced by some smooth malt. This is a delicious beer and tied with New River Pale Ale for my favorite in this style.

i'm a bit mystified as to where the line is between APA and american IPA but who cares. this is more of the same, stacks of sweet caramelly stuff perfumed with stacks of resinny, tropicalfruitmix hops, + some nice sherbetty fluffiness in finish. soft texture, full bodied, but a bit too sticky and fruity to be a good session beer, not enough interesting flavour to be a good sippin beer.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2005 Pretty nice stuff, quite sweet at first, then quite bitter towards the end. Rich palate, full of flavour, a soft smooth texture. Sweet malts, a nicely bitter aromtaic hops. Main flavours of lychee, pine, grapefruit (sweet). Satisfying bitterness. A slightly stronger version of an APA, Tasty stuff. Re-rate: i liked it a bit better this time and upped my score from 3.4!

Three CHEERS for Three Floyds!  The bottle unleashed a dark amber brew with a smallish head that left a slight lacing.  The aroma was hoppy and full of citrus.  IPA's/APA's are my favorite style and this ranks as one of my favorite.  I drank 3 bottles for the 3 Floyds and could have kept going!

Poured this one like a sunofabiatch. I hate it when I pour in a big ass hurry.  Big and I mean big foam.  The smell of the liquid was intense, of course it could be because it was flowing down my hand.  First taste had the hop hit and then settled down to be a decent brew.

My favorite beer, hands down. Not sure if its an IPA or APA, but I could drink this every day and be happy. Wonderful hop aroma and flavor, and enough bitterness, but not too much.  As much as I love Dreadnaught, I actually like this beer better.
Nice amber color with a decent white head. Super hoppy in both flavor and aroma.

Now this is the way an IPA should taste!  This pours a warm amber color which draws you silently into it's womb before it unleashes the hounds of hell.  The strongs hops are perfectly balanced with the butterscotch malt.  Hints of citrus flavors flog your ass and make you plead for more.
cascade and honey aroma. tastes of chamomile tea and lychees. smooth and classy, a good session beer but not mind-blowing

pours a darker shade of amber with a thin layer of head and no lacing. Strong aroma of hops, mostly citrus. Nice and smooth flavor of hops and malt. Very palatable, finishing with small alcohol tones. Nice pale.

Pours a lightly hazy auburn color with light head and average lacing. Aroma is hugely hoppy with a combination of fresh citrus & musky hops, very refined. Flavor is not very bitter as the aroma would elude you believe, it is actual very mild and easy to drink. Finishes with a light hop bite and a touch of alcohol. The malt balances this one perfectly. One of the best APAs I've ever had, this is how they should be done.

Bottle 

Clear, glowing reddish-amber with a light tan head that holds at a thick cap.  Wonderful aroma of pine resin and grapefruit soaked hops.  Very little malt discernable on the nose¬Öa touch of sweet caramel and bread.  The flavor is a lopsided balance skewed towards the hoppy side, with lots of spicy, complex hop flavor and sturdy bitterness.  Grapefruit, pine resin, the hops are almost sweet in character.  The only flaw in this brew is that the caramelly and bready malt backbone is a bit thin, and it shows in the body, which is on the lighter side of medium.  Ends with a firm bitterness, as well as a hint of alcoholic dryness.  More malt, and it would be Dreadnaught Jr.  Overall, an incredible brew and a constant in my beer fridge, despite it¬ís little flaw.

(tap@ Clark St. Ale House)  Nice amber/copper body, a dense, sticky white head, real hoppy.  pale malts emerge as well though.  predominantly floral and citrucy hop load.  cleans up very nicely, not resinous and bitter, butlight caramel malt notes, crackery and tasty along with the citrucy, crisp hop bitters.  a building fruity/floral hop character is the final development.  A GREAT apa
Munster, IN version. Copper color, offwhite head. Aroma very much of hops, citrussy, piney, and floral. Dryly malty flavor, more hops, solid pleasing bitterness. Very good indeed.

The word on the street is true.  Avoid the New Ulm, MN product and stick to the Munster, IN stuff (look on the label or for the "tie-dye" caps).  The difference between the two is substantial.  The New Ulm version looks good but is devoid of character and left me wondering why everyone had such a hard-on for this stuff.  The Munster version showed me why.  It's fantastic.  Hops and malt are extremely well balanced.  The hops show through with an expertise that stuns me.  Bright, complex and delicious.  The high alcohol content is the only thing preventing me from swilling this stuff en masse.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2005 It pours a hazy amber body and despite being poured straight, it doesn¬ít make such a big head. What is there is there to stay though and never leaves until the last sip. The smell is deep hops, fragrant and tea-like, especially citrus cascade, a great sniff for sure. Backing crystals are very expressive and procure lots of balancing sweetness. In mouth, you receive the same treatment, tasty malt balanced with loads of hops bring you to a piney bitter aftertaste, but not  before passing through a flower field where grapefruits fall from the sky. In my opinion, this would have won a lot from a thicker body, it was thin to medium and a little lacking to support such intensity (or I had too full-bodied beers recently). On the other hand, while it was one of the most tasty, it was also one of the most drinkable APAs I¬íve had. Thanks Egajdzis!

Deep amber color.  Definitely strong hop 
nose.  Can taste cascade hops, but it is not
overly powerful--i.e. I think I still have a sense
of taste and smell.  Flavor is initially malty, 
and then--pow!--the hops come in and deliver 
one of the strongest finishes I have tasted.  
Aftertaste of pine, grass, etc...   Excellent!
Complex characters, solid flavors, and great aroma.

Aroma of sweet malt like sap, and piney hops. Palate if full bodied for a pale ale which is very satifying. Flavor mostly of citrus and piney hops with a very well balanced malt backing. The balance is what I probably like most about this beer, it has a strong hop profile with out either being very dry or sticky sweet. Mild grapefruit aftertaste

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2005 Re-rate 5-24-05, bottle thanks to Eyedrinkale.  Okay, this is a good beer, but it¬ís not what I remembered from my first rating when I gave it a 4 overall.  Aroma is milder than I expected, and the flavor - though enjoyable seemed a bit watery.  Much of my oearlier rating remains true, but after all the other great APA¬ís and IPA¬ís I¬íve had in the past year and a half, Alpha King hsa slipped a couple of notches.  Bottle - part of a trade with marinaro500, thanks Joe!  Poured beautiful amber color, clear with a small off-white head that diminished rapidly.  Aroma is rich caramel malts with lots of citrus hops.  Flavor profile seems more like an IPA to me, solid malt backbone - sweet and tasty - with lots of hop bitterness and a lingering dry finish that leaves a slight pucker.  Mouthfeel is nice - medium body with creamy carbonation.  Another fine brew from FFF¬ís!

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2003 Huge thanks go out to Indra for hooking a brother up with this fine APA, Thanks Brow!  Rating# 225:  WoW, what a beauty in the glass, a rich mahogany colored body with a fat cushion of cream-colored head, extreme lacing, its wonderful thing. 
The aroma and flavor-flav are simply killer, big grapefruit, brown sugar, huge suggestions of pine sap, caramel, oh yes, Me Like!
 The Alpha King has a fairly creamy mouth feel, a slightly oily palate, but a not so surprisingly dry finish for such an intense APA.
 Overall this is an exceptional APA, one that coats your glass with a thick curtain of lacing. Alpha king comes recommended by this rater!
Nice copper color with very nice lacing. Aroma is of hops, very much grapefruity smell. Great malt to hop balance with nice hop bitterness. Also, some floral notes. Good stuff.

I had been waiting to try this beer for a long time.  I found it on tap at McGregors in Rochester.  The smell was excellent, hops and fruits.  The taste was full and extremely balanced.  There was absolutely no aftertaste.  It went down extremely smooth and left me waiting for my next drink.  Overall excellent APA.

12oz bottle fresh from the brewery. Beautiful copper colored ale with a thick frothy head. Big piney citrusy hoppy aroma which smells like a good amount of Cascade but I could be wrong. None the less, fantasticly hopped. Smooth body with a bitter slightly dry finish. Terrific flavor with nice blend of malts and hops. A bitter pale but fantastic and nearly an IPA in my opinion. Delicate lacing. Wish I had more of this. Thanks Bunkypop!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: (bottled).  Dark copper, brilliantly clear.  Huge, catty grapefruit and other citrus aroma.  Medium-full bodied beer leads with big malt and a piney, pungent bitter finish.  Smooth, lingering persistent bitterness is giant, but somehow doesn't overwhelm the malt.  This is damn good beer.
I like the beer and I like the brewery. Used to not like pales but this beer changed that. Strong aroma, and flavor which are much the same. One of the best aftertastes for a pale.
Copper color, small head. Strong citrusy hopped aroma, taste is much the same. Similar to Victory and DFH IPAs but not quite as full as those, and maybe a bit more citrusy.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2008 This used to be a 4+ beer.  They have changed the recipe I have no doubt.  Not what it once was, the hop profile is diminished and lacking.  It was so fruity and juicy before...  Not anymore.  Not even similar to it¬ís former glory.  Still pretty decent...  But I hope the original recipes returns soon.
Copper colored with a medium size head and good lacing.  Hoppy floral aroma.  Distinct lemon/citrus taste with a crisp, dry finish.
An excellent, refreshing and hoppy pale ale.  Nice orangey color, good head, excellent hop aroma and good flavor.

Clear orange color with a nice thick beige head. The aroma was wonderfully sweet and citrusy. The flavor was very sweet, malty, slightly hoppy (not as much as the aroma would make you expect), and some caramel, and great pine tones. Great thick feel...smooth on the tongue. Great APA.
alpha king rocks! this stuff is smooth,with nice head,capmlex carmel and strong hops,smooth as a silk coat!
Clear amber coloured beer with a small head. Strong ginger, herby, floral taste. A bit too much flavour added for my taste, but ok nevertheless.
Another tasty three floyds offering that will make hopheads smile.  I find the hops sharper and more citrusy than in DN, but there is a lighter body and less malt here.
Frothy off-white head. Clear orange copper color. Malty aroma with hint of hops. Very mellow. Bitter beginning, malty middle, and a quick good dry finish. Medium bodied and dry. Bitterness lingers.
Alpha King is one of the best balanced pale ales you'll ever taste. Clean hoppy and refreshing.

12 oz. longneck brown bottle. No freshness date seen. Poured out a dark orange color, with a green tinted tan head. The head didn't last long, and it did leave some lacing down the sides of the glass.
Aromas...where to start? Right off the bat, it is apparent this beer is full of fresh hops. Floral, piney, resinous smelling hops are very noticeable here gang. Slight dry biscuit aroma quickly fades. The hops are what makes this beer great, though. Sticky mouthfeel, slight coating of the old tongue. Finishes bitter & very hoppy.
A pretty good IPA, but not quite as good as their Dreadnaught.

Pours a nice deep amber with a medium, lasting head. Aroma spicy, floral and the signature 3f grapefruit scent. I was wondering what the difference between their IPA and the APA would be; they are somewhat different beers. This one seems to have a little more roasted flavor, and not as intensely hopped. It is not as sweet as Dreadnaught, and of course not as strong ABV. Perhaps also a little more drinkable (and less dangerous) in large quantities. All-in-all a very fine beer.
Reddish purple with a thin to moderate head. Citrus, sharp and tangy nose. The taste is sour and kind of concentrated. Not bad

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2005 duvel tulip glass: still my favorite pale ale. dry pine and sweet smooth caramel along with juicy drops of grapefruit - great play! great body, crisp, and it¬ís just delicious. easy to drink. sweet on the lips then a bit dry and bittersweet  after the gulps. yum! grab the bottles with the tye-dye caps & logo on it. this brew is wonderful. personally, i like a half shot of fine whiskey tossed in the glass then i pour from the bottle for a big head. wonderful! (updated) UPDATE 2/5/05: english pint / ahhh... always good! downrated overall, though. it¬ís got that same dry yet bittersweet aftertaste. basically, juicy grapefruity piney with a good malt backup to push it all down gracefully. quite excellent, as always!

amber clolour, white head.  huge aroma of perfume and herbs with citrusy hints.  very big and hoppy flavour, but not over the top, which leaves room for some apple and melon fruitiness and caramel sweet malt.  bitter finish lingers.  the best I've tried from 3F so far.

Royal bourbon clear colour with a yellow white head. Medium fruiy and seriously intense herbal and sweeter rosewater aroma.  Flavour is reminiscent of dryish liquid turkish delight. Extra long beautifully balanced finish. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2003 Just finished my very first Alpha King. These are my impressions. The Alpha King Bombards your neural net with an overwhelming layer of texture and flavor. Grapefruit/sour aroma to me. Nonetheless very powerful elixir. After second sip Neural activity pinging like crazy. Very intense experience. Wonder what this might be like on tap. Head was non-existant when poured out. No bitter afterbite whatsoever. How would I rate this against them all. I would have to try the rest of the High ranking brews before I make my permanent list. Definitely Amber from first sip to last. Very good very unexpected and not exactly what I thought. Very interesting experience indeed.

After 370 beers rated, this is my first perfect beer! Sampled at the Great Taste of the Midwest. Aroma: very hoppy, wonderful, rich. Very nice, reddish, orangish amber. Off-white head. Not much visible carbonation. Very nice hoppy flavor. Excellent lace. As an American Pale, doesn't get any better than this.
Clear amber in colour.  Aroma of hops and citrus/grapefruit.  Flavour is nicely hopped, grapefruit and oranges.  Finishes with medium bitterness and a long aftertaste.
(Bottle) Deep amber body and cascade nose. Strong hops with a somewhat light palate. Beautiful.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2012 Medium copper.  Very sweet floral aroma.  Sweet almond, smoke, and hop flavor underneath a big profile of maple and apple.  stewy and caramel heavy, wet and green and limp and muddled.  in 2005 it was the best thing ever.  in 2012 it¬ís a mess of a pale ale and lacks brightness and focus.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2006 2002 Bottle. Awesome murky reddish-orange color, with tons of frothy burnt white head.  Smells citrusy, and a touch of alcohol aroma arises, as well.
Begins very strong with lots of cascade hops. Full bouquet of hops continues through body and it finishes bitter.  Not too much detectable yeast, and while the body is clean and tastey, there didnt seem to be much distinguishing this from any other top tier APA until. . .!! It warmed up!!! This beer¬ís flavor and palate have just improved tenfold after warming, every sip I took had a wonderful flavor in the finish that lingered. I can best describe it as an alcohol/butterscotch malt flavor that has a bit of a slow burn to it. It really complemented the huge hoppy flavor and left me very happy with this beer and wanting to try more.  Previous score:  8/4/9/5/182006 bottle.  Still a very lovely fruity, hoppy, lush nose, with sweet malts backing it and not overdone in bitterness.  Toned down dreadnaught, I guess.  But the hard crystal malt behind it and filtered, washed out mouthfeel just don¬ít cut it.  Plenty of average brewers are doing much better things in the mouthfeel category.  I suppose not the biggest of complaints, but bottle conditioning is bottle conditioning and this less-than-tight carbonation is lacking.  Hard crystal malts do not help either.  Score is for this bottle.

On tap at the Wild Onion Brewpub:  Gorgeous deep amber color, head is smallish but lacey.  Aroma promises plenty of pine.  Taste is big on hops at first--and continues all the way through.  Not as malty as I expected but pretty well balanced nonetheless. Overall very nice but I didn't think it was quite as fine as Kona Brewery's Fire Rock Ale on tap.

On tap at Brewery: Outstanding appearance and excellent lacing. Big hop aroma of pine, grapefruit, flowers, and tart apple. In addition detected nutty grain, and a hint of vanilla. Very hoppy up front but settles down to have nice balance. Too cool! The pine cone taste does linger well after you are done drinking (unless you "clean your palate" with a Behemoth like I did!) Very dry and lively mouthfeel, somewhat metallic feel. This is one nice hoppy pale ale, recommended. Another winner by Three Floyds. (Note: I have had this numerous times in the past, just got around to getting it on tap again)

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2004 Draft, at the Brewery. Ah, the firstborn child of Nick & Co's "Not Normal" brewing philosophy. It's almost damning with faint praise not to call it an IPA (in which case, it'd rate second to 3F's own Dreadnaught. At our homebrew club meeting at the brewery, it felt as though we were swimming on the US's entire hop production for the year. Tangy citrus hop flavor will give you a buzz long before the alcohol can work its magic. An inspiration to every amateur or pro brewer to "go BIG, or go home!"
Bottled: Not surprising that the bottled version is a little tamer than we had fresh at the brewery, even if I did get the bottles straight from the brewery. Still a great hop nose you can't help but get assaulted by. As they say, try to find it on draught, or take the brewery tour!

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2007 January 2007. Bottle courtesy of HogTownHarry. Hazy dark orange amber, small creamy beige head fades a bit but is revived with a swirl. Big hoppy aroma, lots of orange citrus and a bit of resin dominates the nose. Similar flavour with lots of resiny hop presence, moderate citrus (I remember there being more). Pleasant bitterness lingers in the finish. Average palate (3+?) Loses a step because it does not quite live up to my expectations but is nonetheless very good. 8/3+/7-8/3/16+ - 4.0

Nov 200? - A bit maltier than the HopDevil I had the night before, maybe a tiny bit less hoppy? Nice bit of citrus notes. Notes pre-dating Ratebeer. 9/3/8/3/17 - 4.0
Beautiful medium amber. Big hops AND malt right up front. Both take a long fade to a very dry pleasant aftertaste. As near to perfection as can be obtained for this style.
Rich orange-amber w/ lovely toffee head. Robust grapefruit aroma. Sticky, sweet feel. Intense, lively, fresh hop bitterness. Excellent, rich, toffee-ish malt background. Dry finish. Fantastic beer.
Fresh green hop aroma. Aromatic, and organic. Good depth, well constructed. Front medium roasted malt with hopier end. Medium body, very refreshing. Recommended.

Draft:  I like almost any beer that smells like brewday and the raw hops of this one are very nice!  A nice head atop a ruby colored brew.  This one is almost a bit harsh if it is the first beer of your session, but it quickly sweetens and mellows.  Very nice!

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2003 Draft. Punchy sprucey/citrusy aroma. Slightly cloudy, pale gold; smallish white head. Strong hop presence works well with jackhammering citrus tongue. I usually shy away from pale ales, but this is damn good.

Bottle: Big nose for a pale ale. Citrus & pine. Nice clean brownish orange color. Good mix of bitter grapefruit and a  little of a toasty carmel malt. Strong bitter finish that coats the tounge. A great pale ale. Better than alot of other brewers IPA's.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Quite the tasty one here.  Aroma is full on hops, grapefruit and pine in your face.  Appearance is nice, with a faint head lingering around the edges of the glass.  Smooth palate.  The flavor is again dominated by hops, but starts a bit earthy with some malt in the middle.  Ends with the hop explosion of grapefruit, and fades into a pleasant bitterness that lasts and lasts.  Exceptionally well done.

Grayish/white head, some nice laceing. Clear, copper color. Piney, citrusy hop nose, love it! Medium body. Slightly resiny, oily palate.Plenty of hop flavors up front. Finishes fairly dry with a decent hop bite and the malt coming through at the end. Pretty big for an APA, i,d say. Yum.

best APA I have ever tasted.  hint of sweetness, apple, not overly dry
I find the balance very true to style.
This beer is somewhat unbalanced by the hops.  It has good oroma and a nice full mouthfeel, but the hops overwhelm a bit in the finish.  A little too much citrus there too.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2003 Had this at Capital Ale House in Richmond, VA on 6-7-03. Draft version. Nice amber body with a wonderful citrusy and hoppy nose. Pleasant mouthfeel and soothing on the tongue with citrus fruit and floral hoppiness standing out but also adding a hint of sweetness. Dry but smooth finish made this a nice buy this evening.

Tasted at the brewery .  A fabulous concoction.  Citrus hits  you immediatesly with a nice brown/amber beer and fine brussels lace to accompany a great beer.  This beer is a staple among my diet with a fine balance of hops and malt. Fantastic!!!
Huge hoppy nose, with some citrus, amber, medium custard head. Hoppy, grapefruit flavour, a riot of bitterness here, robust, with a dry finish. Extremely hoppy for the style!

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2003 I hold in my hand a great glass of hop nectar.Smells like just that to me w/ great malty balance.This is great...the last time I got this beer I knew it had to be old or somthin(black ring at the bottom of bottle)Still decent,but in its true form it is all out hop/malt perfection.Very smooth drinkin',quick finish w/ lingering citris hoppiness subdued.I must say wow.I just got a truly fresh 6-pk of this and all I can say is Perfect.(if it's brewed in munster,stay away from that new ulm,mn stuff)

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2003 Poured orange, with an off white head.  Citrusy hop aroma, as well as a bitter hop flavor, with some grape taste as well.  Nice malt backbone.  Can be drank more frequently than the Dreadnaught.

As soon as I opened the bottle, my nose was overwhelmed with the aroma of hops.  As I began to drink it, sure enough, my mouth was filled with the wonderful flavor of hops. Boiling, aroma, and finishing hops are very apparent in this brew.  I really enjoyed it.  As for any other flavors, there was a little bit of citrus in it. The color was an orange with an off-white head.  I really enjoyed this one.
Good looking orange/amber body with a small white head. Smell is of pure hops leaves. Big hoppy and fruity taste, an excellent pale ale.
Very good beer.It has a very clear orange color.Excellent fruity smell.Kind of bitter on first drink.Great mix of hops and citrus taste.I recommend it!

Mmmm, mmmm.  Great brew here.  Citrusy aroma, with hops as well.  Fluffy white head that persisted through most of the drinking.  Redder color than I expected, but I thought it looked great.  Crisp taste, and bitter as well.  A bit of citrus, and hops too.  Very good, glad I picked up a sixer.
I found this to be very strange. The aroma reminded me of oatmeal and was very heavy. Taste was special, alot of hops, slightly bitter and some taste that I cant describe.. not bad

That was a surprice. Alot of hops and weird malt and spices. Smelled a bit like smelly feet, and some other smell i cant describe, weird though. Ther taste is fairly nice, alot of hops again, bittersweet and rich full body.
I had the beer that were brewed in MN.  It was a great hoppy, malty Pale Ale.  Excellent crisp flavor.  Rivals the Victory, but not quite as hoppy.  Citrus aroma and sweet flavor.

Interesting pale ale.  Tends more toward the malt end of the flavor spectrum than do most pales.  This is not bad however, as the malt is quite tasty.  Nutty aroma, pours up nice off white fluffy head.  Beer is chesnut colored.  Nice flavor with initial roasted malt taste followed by a very short burst of hop bitterness.  Definitely a quick finish as there is no follow through on the flavors at all.  This is good beer.
very hoppy and slightly overpowering aroma.Taste is a little bitter but still nice and malty.overall a well balanced hoppy brew that is very drinkable
Cloudy Orange, and is that a green tint, as well? Tan head. Earthy Pinecone aroma and flavor. Messy Bitter. Loooooong finish. More, Please...

Pours a medium amber color, kind of looks like an english bitter or pale ale.  Aroma is hugely floral and hoppy, massive hops aroma.  Very nice, though.  Flavor is not as hoppy as i expected, and malts really come through well.  Great balance, the likes of which I was not expecting.  I'm impressed with this beer, as much as i thought i wasn't going to like it.

Reasonable head, clear copper color. Impressive, bittersweet and almost overpowering hop aroma, complementing an outstanding clean and numbing palate. Slides across the tongue... Amazing. Taste is pale ale bitter, but still nice and malty. Packaging was colorful - the art was striking - but taken as a whole the bottle can't match the finish of your average premium microbrew.

Initial head minimal and fizzy, off-white in color. Nice hoppy nose, medium bodied, fairly balanced. 
Drinkable and enjoyable!

Big grapefruit nose.  Copper/amber hue.  Big sticky off-white head.  Pale malts, supporting a very well balanced medium bodied brew.  Caramel, light bread...Big heady hops.  Pine needles and resin.  This brew is so drinkable.

Do I approach the King with an unfortunate air of ennui?  Surely I must prostrate myself before such a beer and arise to speak in the most praising terms?  Unfortunately, I cannot so bend my will to the King.  I may revel in the bountiful odor which eminates from him, and I may admire the attractive head sitting on its body, but I will not proffer obedience and infatuation which extends to every flavor I can lick from him.  The King is, afterall, no greater--morally speaking, anyway--than his peers.  He carries some respect for his glowing appearance, and earns plaudits for reaching my nose with an attractive floral bouquet, but for flavor I give only what is due, and what is due is the same respect that every hopping, bitter citizen of the pale ale world gets.  No more, no less.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2003 They say you can't judge a beer by its label, and this brewer has a great reputation.  Thus, the Alpha King in my hand.  This one is what a pale ale should be: crisp, clean, and aromatic with strong but not overpowering hopping.  I am enjoying the Alpha King.  When I'm in the mood for a bounce in the step and a jump in my mood, I'll gladly take my hops Three Floyds style.
Updated 9/23/03: like the Scottish Ale, my original tasting of this Pale was of the contract-brewed version.  The Munster-bottled Alpha King is very piney, with a caramel/dark amber color and a thin tan head.  Flavor?  Pine, pine, pine.  Nice malt balance too.  And, did I mention, pine?  Thicker than the contract-brewed version, but not my favorite pale, even though gymnosperms ain't so bad.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2004 Led to believe that I would be bowled over by the hops. Actually glad that I wasn't. While I love bitter, I've had over the top and much prefer balance. Maybe a supreme balance wasn't achieved, but not a bad starting place. Plenty of aroma and hop essence, but not like the IPA styles that I know. And it isn't calling itself that, so I guess I would say all in all I enjoyed it. Again, thanks to hopsrus.
Re-rate - Enjoyed as much or moreso than previously. And not to insult anyone - The Arrogant Cousin.

Nice  light amber color with little head.nice hoppy aroma slightly, sweet malt as well thrown in.Taste was very well hopped with some maltyness in it but definately well hopped it shows up through out the beer.the finish is hoppy as hell with a slightly watery hop finish that is mild but pleasant  a very well done brew that is well worth the effort in getting.
I'm not sure this one lived up to its high rating, although it was a very tasty beer.  Deep amber color with a malty start that was quickly overpowered by strong hop flavor.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2004 Dark amber. Tons of lace. Terrific amounts of hops in the nose. Loaded with grapefruit and pine notes. A bit on the thin side for a beer of such gravity and bitterness.
I think this maybe the best APA I have tasted yet! A very well balanced brew. Nice aroma and finish.
I enjoyed the appearance and flavor of Alpha going down, but the hop kick doesn't lend itself to smooth drinking for me.
Awesome label art.  sweet fruity nose, with sweet front and fruity hops finish.  Much sweeter and less hopier than I was expecting, but still very good.
Wow, hoppy, fruity, dark copper. This pale ale is awesome. I loved this brew and cant wait to buy more!!

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2003 Reddish gold with a small light head.  Nose of hops.  Taste astingently, dryly refeshing.  Hops and sweet malt, but less malt backbone than I would have expected.  Different from Hop Devil, Different from Stone Ruination.  Less pine and orange than the first, less grapefruit than the second, less malt than either.  Great dry and bitter finish with sticky hoppy mouthfeel.  A really enjoyable pale ale.
Light amber color with a small white head. Fruity hop aroma. Flavor is sweet, a little sour, bitter, hops. A really great beer
UPDATED: MAY 2, 2005   Like the dreadnaught but toned down a little.  Nice orange/copper color with a slight head and loaded with hops.  Very welll balanced with malt.
A very nice pale ale, yet another of the beer payments made to me for painting brock's basement.  Lots of hops as would be assumed. Interesting malt flavors involving some fruits of the citrus kind.
Full-bodied (especially for an APA) and hopped...definitely with a purpose. Fruity and dry but not overly so.

smokey bacon/wood chips aroma with some spicy hops too..chewy mouthfeel with hops fading to maltiness and grapefruits..lots of that "three-floyds" grapefruity flavor that i seem to get from all the three floyd brews..nice pale ale.

This beer pours to a very cloudy orange color and not much head.  Upon pouring this into a glass, I notices a lot of various things floating throughout the beer - don't know what that is, but it's a little strange.  The aroma holds the scent of fruits.  The taste was very strong in character - tasting like some mixture of fruits and hops, with a bitter aftertaste.  I prefer others because of the strength of the taste.

Cloudy orange appereance. Wonderful hoppy(!) and fruity (citrus) aroma. Flavour has mild malts and fruits followed by an overwhelming hoppy bitter and acidic (grapes?) finish. It's not normal - and thank God for that!
Good Pale Ale. Has a nice texture and bite to it. There is plenty of hops in this bottle for a citrus flavored ale.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2003 The GF and I went on a tour of their brewery. For $5 you get a 12oz glass of 3 of their beers. The head was mixed with large and small bubbles. The color was medium amber dark and you could see through it. The beer was the 2nd best of their beers that we sampled. Hotstuff did not try it.

Pours with a beautiful clear deep amber body topped by a thick sustaining head that leaves lots of lace hugging the glass.  Sweet and fruity (apples & grapefruit) aroma with flowery notes.  Sweet and fruity (apples & lemons) hop flavor with a strong bitter hoppy finish.  Medium bodied, slightly oily and relatively smooth with a dry finish.
UPDATED: APR 9, 2005 Hazy orange, almost red. Nice hops flavor with a citrus hint. Seems very well balanced. Goes down smooth with just the right amount of hops bite.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2004 Nice orangish-copper color with a strong cirtrus hop aroma.  Smells like I¬ím sniffing my hops before I add them to my homebrews.  Medium body dominated by hop flavor and semi-dry, bitter finish.  Drank at room temperature which really brought out the hop aroma and flavor.  
Its one of my ¬ígo to¬í beers when I¬ím looking for something semi-lite and flavorful.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2007 Nice hoppiness with a delicious orange finish make this a beer worth repeated purchases...a master brew and a simply exquisite APA!

Nice.  Dark, opaque honey color.  A short head, but it sticks to the glass all the way down to the bottom.  Citrus aroma is equal in strenth to the hops...odd.  Perfect carbonation, almost creamy on the palate with tiny bubbles just a swirl away from a fresh head.  A late, but short lived finish with a light aftertaste.  Good hops balance, not overwhelming, but clear and intentional.  Light malt flavor balanced out the hops and some of the citrus.  The flavor definitely improved as it lost the chill from the fridge.  I'd leave it out 5 minutes or so before serving for this beer to make it's best impression.  Yummy.
Hoppy nose.  Strong, dry hop finish without being terribly bitter.  Just a tad watery.  Dry orange-hoppy, pistachio notes.  Nice looking mahogany-orange.  Quite good.

My favorite pale ale. Perfec in almost every way. This was purchased at the brewrey in a growler and enjoyed during the Super Bowl. The most beautiful aroma, very flowery, citrusy. Perfect balance of malt and hoppy finish. Had to sniff the bottle the next morning. Again this was a growler bottled at the brewrey so freshness was peak. Nice thick head. Delicious orange/amber color. Very hppy but with a nice malty spike that made it so enjoyable I almost drove back to Munster, IN for another. So far this is my favorite pale ale.

Medium gold color. Medium head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. A medium bodied pale ale. Nice citrusy floral hops, balanced by sweet crystal malts. Great malt and hops flavors that are different and distinct, yet still well balanced. Very tasty. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and kind of dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. VERY nice beer.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2006 Pours with a cloudy orange color, small head.   Strong citric hop aroma and taste.  Good mouthfeel, thick, and finish, mild dry.
Copper / amber in color, large dense head.  Big hop aroma with crisp hop flavor.  A top of the line Pale Ale.
Copper color. Medium head. Nice Cascade/Centennial hop aroma. Some malt aroma. Slight crystal malt sweetness. Nice underlying bitterness. Medium body. Great balance. Very nice beer!

Pours a cloudy light brown color with a small, tan colored head. Aroma is definitely citrus, with lime notable, as well as hoppy, yeasty and slightly creamy. Flavor is pretty hoppy, with just a touch of malt and sweetness, and a rather bitter finish. Overal a nicely complex pale ale. An excelent example of it's style.

This is my favorite pale ale (though it migrates at times into IPAville).  The hops are bursting with grapefruit flavors and the lace is complex.  One of the beers that inspires me to smell the glass afterwards.  This is a hop-lover's dream.  Cannot wait to try the famous dreadnaught- can anyone help?

Hits the nose with a musky sweet lemon aroma, very subtle, but very much there. It pours a slightly hazy copper. Nice head, a little thin, but a solid white coat over the top. A little bit of licorice and a big load of citrus bitter hit you up front. The middle is very malty sweet. The end just a touch of pine. The has to one of the more interesting pale ales I"ve had. It"s pretty big, not exactly easy drinking, but I like it, an interesting blend. Thanks igneousboy.

Fantastic.  Nice orange color, a dissipating white head.  Citrusy aroma and flavor, as the label suggests.  Extremely drinkable, and quite a bit of sweetness on the back end, along with a sort of thick maltiness.  The sugar is very ¬ípure¬í tasting, almost crystaline, and complements the hopping perfectly.  Not sure where they get this "dry finish" business in the Commercial Description -- I"ll update next time I have a bottle if I figure it out.  Wish I could get this on tap.  Between this and SN Celebration, there"d always be a hoppy PA I"d be happy to order a pitcher of.
A great overall beer with much more hops than malt. The aftertaste is very quick and full of hops!

I like the mild better than Alpha King and, as that seems to go much agaianst the wisdom of the rest of you, I¬íll explain.  Both beers have strong hop fronts but the harder grapefruit surge of this one compares unfavorable to the sweeter lemongrass of the mild - so I guess it¬ís probably the hop varieties I¬ím reacting too.  Both beers have a good malt backing and this one is toasty - interesting!
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2003 Cooper color, thin white head, citrus taste.  Nothing extraordinary but nothing obviuously wrong wither.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text:
Golden body with a thin white head. Some lacing.
Aroma is of hops and citrus. Some malt appeared after my second beer.
Taste is a nice balance between the hops and the malt. Surprising, thought this was another 90-minute. Definite malt backbone that I like in my pale ales.
Low carbonation helped to hold in some of the more subtle hop character.
Victory is next.

1/5/03:  bottle.  a nice amount of head when poured which reduces to a thicker line of carbonation than average.  head is also frothy and rocky with better than average lacing.  nice amber- orange colour with lots of carbonation and activity.  perfumed nose, with notes of sweet malt.  tons of flavors for your whole mouth to enjoy.  malty, hoppy, and i definitely taste some grapefruit in the aftertaste.  very complex, i can¬ít pinpoint every taste going on here.  i really dig the label as well.

This one pours a clear copper color with a small white head that doesn¬ít linger long. It has a very nice fruity hop aroma with just a hint of malts. Medium bodied with a malty sweetness up front. The flavor erupts with hops and malts toward the end, finishing with a hoppy fruitiness whose bitterness is neutralized by the malty sweetness. An outstanding American Pale Ale.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2011 ReRate-1/4/03 at the brewery in Munster, IN-This was way better on tap than in the bottle even though i didn¬ít bump up the ratings much. Everything is bigger-malt and hop presence is more apparent.  Very good beer.  A robust beer with a thick look.  Full of flavor and hops.  very unusuall for an APA to have this much malty middle, but definately a good thing.  very complex for a pale-made me realize that SNPA is pretty one dimensional to this one, but its still a good beer
RERATE 2011-after numerous subsequent samples of this beer over the years, it has gone downhill quite badly.  When its VERY fresh its pretty good but over a few weeks old, it turns really bad.
An amazing amount of "things" are going on in this brew.  Almost overwhelming.  Mix of slight malt and citrus flavors.  Don¬ít let this one approach room temp or get a warm pour.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2003 Poured out of bottle, bought at Sam's Wine & Spirits in Chicago, 12/10/02.  Very lovely, strong scent of hops (almost like a pine scent).  Pours to an average head that lingers.  The beer has a sexy medium amber color, and tastes richer and feels fuller than one would expect from the way it looks.  Very crisp with hops and strong citrus flavors (grapefruit is right).  Goes down with a little spice in the crisp finish.  Very solid beer.  Very drinkable and very enjoyable.  Maybe a little *too* shocking to the palate to allow for long nights of drinking, but it's a good one while you can handle it.

Here¬ís a real yardstick beer. The aroma hits you well before you get the glass to your lips. This is more full bodied than you would expect. It has to be to serve as a carrier for all those hops! Very crisp up front, yet some subtle hop components underneath. Pretty grapefruity. Almost orange color, off white lingering head. A real piece of work that needs to be experienced. Not quite a session beer because you may sprain a tastebud after three or four (or five...)

I stopped by the Three Floyd¬ís Brewery on my way home from school this past week, it was a nice break from driving.  While my growler  of Dark Lord was getting filled I enjoyed a complimentary sample of the Alpha King.  This pale ale was fantastic.  It has a really complex hop flavor.  Hazy pale color.  The description says,"medium body", but I found it fairly full-bodied.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2004 Pours a nice orange hue with a nice head.  Strong hop aroma.  Malt backbone with a hop powered kick.
This is either a flavorful pale ale or an average IPA.  Very nice aromatic flavor, although the finish is a tad sharp/bitter.  Very decent.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2003 It looks and smells like a mighty fine IPA (even if it isn't), which set me up with certain expectations.  The flavor isn't as hoppy as an IPA, there seems to be this ongoing battle in the flavor between hops and a strong, citrus taste.  There is also a subtle malt presence in it, but not quite enough for my taste.  It lacks some body, but it is a decent drink. Re-Rate [originally 3.6]  I was excessively unfair to this beer in my original rating.  This is citrusy, malty, hoppy, sweet..a highly original and outstanding pale ale.
As fine a Pale Ale as is made east of the Pacific Coast.  Nice hoppy flavor that pleases tremendously, but does not overwhelm.  Currently, this is my "house" beer.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2004 Nose is rather dissapointing, it just gives the tell tale smell of an IPA.  However, the hops make up for any other shortcommings.  Definately one of my favorite APA's.  Nice malt flavor is not overpowered by the hops, but definatley a great drinkable beer.

the best APA I have tried. Copper colored with a small, lasting head. Strong pine hop aroma, Flavors are also hoppy with a solid backbone of malt, finishes abrupt and powerful. For anyone looking for a beer with raw power this one is for you.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2005 Hoppier than Sierra Nevada with a fantastic grapefruit aroma.  Some toasty malt flavors still make it to the tongue, but this is all about the hops.
very citrusy, in the aroma, the flavor and the aftertaste. not very hoppy, yet tasty, although i have to say that i found the citrus a little overpowering and could have dealt with less of that.
Ahh, hops.  Citrus, mostly grapefruit greets you as you raise the glass.  Quite nice.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2011 In Bottle: Nice amber pour, good head with small bubbles fair retention.  Hoppy nose, with rich malt aroma.  Hops carry well in the taste, and the bittersweetness of the hops makes it taste like an IPA.  Comparable to Sierra Nevada, but Sierra is still seems hoppier.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2003 I've had this in bottles and I've wondered what all the excitement was about.  Had it on tap, and found out for myself.  Very hoppy, I wouldn't call it a pale ale seems more like an IPA.  Strangely enough 3 Floyds doesn't make what they call an IPA currently.
A fine pale ale.  Big taste.  Citrusy - a grapefruit in every bottle - but a nice ripe one.  Not too bitter for a hop-filled beer.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2005 Draft:Complex malt aromas and flavor with just enough,juicy,hop aroma and flavor.  Dark,cloudy,appearance for a pale ale. Taste is suprising for the aroma.Big time malts and appetizing bitterness are balanced.In my experiences, impossible to find a good six pack though.Tap rating would be higher probably.

From bottle. Great hoppy-sweet aroma. Caramel red in color - full foamy head but it didn¬ít last long because I think it was a dirty glass. Medium carb and medium body. Nice malty flavor, good bittering and overall melding of flavors. Crisp. Really a nice pale ale.

got via trade from hopsrus.  awesome - truely an Imperial Pale Ale without being an India Pale Ale.  Lot¬ís of malt, balanced with a healthy (not excessive) amount of hops, backed up with a bit of alchohol.  little on the dry side.  nice finish. An excellent ale.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2006 One of my favorite Pale Ales (it¬ís up there with Lost Coast Indica as my number 2 & 3 beers).  Floral hoppy aroma, along with some caramel.  Flavor is sharp and crisp - hoppy with some floral flavors as well as a predominent citrus grapefuit.  Finishes with a nice lingering hop bite.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2006 Blind rating, bottle.

Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is medium amber.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately to heavily hoppy (grapefruit, resin).

Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Way overdone and one-dimensional.
If you love hops, you¬íll definitely like this one. Like Victory¬ís HopDevil and Blue Ridge¬ís HopFest, Alpha King is an over the top extremely well hopped ale. Highly recommended.
Citrus and melon nose, Hop bite from middle to finish.   Delicious, esay drinkin¬í, refreshing, hoppy but balanced well.
Very hoppy ale.  If you¬íre not a hophead, don¬ít venture here.  Otherwise, smooth and decent.
What a nice suprise!  Great aroma, I didn¬ít want it to end.  Nice hop and great malt.  By letting it warm up, the malt really comes out strong.  Glad I made the trade for this!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2003 Excellent malt is simply a magic carpet ride for the greatest hop presence in an 'every day' beer!  This is my session ale, widely available near me, a near perfect brew that I enjoy all year round. The original growlers from the Hammond brewery were out of this world with hops and malt.  Just recently I have come across hand-pulled A.K.'s and love it equally. I'd love to watch a group of British Cask drinkers get their hands on this, it would turn them inside out. Massive flavor. If I could drink only one beer, Alpha King would be the one.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2004 Clear dark golden color with a short-lived fizzy white head.  Slightly bready, citrusy aroma.  Unassuming malt but with a sub-IPA hoppiness.  A slight sticky-sweet aftertaste hurts the finish on this beer.
Excellent. Big flavor with nice head. One of my new favorites.
Big citrus/tropical fruit nose. Nice hop bite at the front with a good malt back. Balanced very nicely. Now if I could just get some Dreadnaught...
Deep copper colored with a white frothy head.  Very well hopped with a good malty balance.  Dry and crisp with fruity undertones.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2003 This is a big APA and happily easily found around here.  I find that the flavor profile seems to work in reverse--there is a lot of citric hop bitterness in the front, followed by a pleasing, rich maltiness (still with plenty of citrus, but other fruit as well) which draws up in a final citric dryness.  Let it warm up a bit to get the most out of the tremendous malt.  Wonderfully made stuff, this.
beautiful citrus hop aroma, nice bitter taste w/ a clean finish. A very nice APA

This is one of my favorite APA¬ís.  It is far from the ordinary Pale.  Huge citrus aroma, I¬íd say a cross between orange and lemon and a bit floral too.  Taste is very appealing but hard to fully describe.  The best I can do is like a hoppy lemon iced tea, sort of.  Doesn¬ít sound great but it is really quite good and thirst quenching.  It may be an acquired taste though.

reddish copper color, excellent  creamy off white head. very hoppy aroma rivaling many of the top American IPA¬ís in intensity. very citrusy bitter flavor with a bit of brown sugar sweetness...i personally think of this beer as more of an IPA. OUTSTANDING to put it mildly

Expecting to gain new enlightenment according to the rave reviews regarding this APA, I was a little disappointed after trying Alpha King¬Ö but only slightly. The initial taste surprisingly seemed a bit bland and almost watery, if only for a fraction of a second before you are bombarded with citric hops. It starts off bitter and smoothes out as it approaches a dry finish. The 6er I had tasted a tad stale or maybe ¬ìdirty¬î, and didn¬ít have the ¬ìfreshness¬î I normally  associate with PAs. Bad batch? I may have to try another and return for a re-rate. All the same, it is a very enjoyable beer that is easy to recommend.
Wonderful citrus hop aroma, poors a light amber with nice off white head, taste of citrus and hops,hops, wonderful hops, followed by a touch of maltiness in the finish. a wonderful pale.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2003 This beer has changed the way that I look at pale ales.  I absolutly love this beer.  Everything about it is flawless. Yes, there might be beers out there that deserve a perfect score as well, but I could not think of a better beer to sip on during the late spring and early summer.  An outstanding beer and well worthy of the perfect score.
A well-hopped, quality product from the folks at 3 Floyd¬ís.  Nice logo, but they have a weird website.
Very hoppy beer.  Very hoppy.  If you like a lot of hops this beer is for you.  Neat logo too.
A surprisingly red color, good lace. Strong smell of hops. Tastes of lemon and LOTS of hops. Normally I don¬ít like this much hops in my beer, but this is fantastic.

UPDATE:  I have now had this on tap, and it is just better.  3-4-02:I love this beer.  The flavor is great with all the sublties that the commercial description implies.  It does finish dry, but that just makes you want to open another one right away.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2005 Day breaks in the forum of divinities as lemons and daffodils are being picked for the Alpha King¬ís afternoon nectar...The harvesting angels notice a few ripe berries on a distant cloud and decide to include them in their creation...Of course, hops are the main ingredient, luscious bitter hops, which the King adores...Whenever I roam nearby this heavenly world, I beg for a sample...

Too citrusy for me. It has the appearance and flavor of grapefruit, which is ok in pale ales but not to this extreme. I was unaware of the robust alcohol content until coming to this site so the alcohol is well masked. If you are in the mood for an unusually strong pale ale, and just plain unusual beer, then this beer is for you.

unreal taste 

the aroma is that of an freshly squeezed oranges with a hint of lemon too.

the appearance is a dark gold color.

the flavor is the taste of oranges.

the palate is smooth and citrusy. alot of hops surround the citrus taste.

no taste or hint of alcohol in this beer even though this beer rates at 7.25% in abv

I was let down to know that Three Floyds bottled beers are contact brewed. However, the beers are very good. Also, I question the alcohol contents of their beers. IMO the figures from their web site which are listed as ABW are really ABV. Now to the beer. Super floral nose. Hoppy as can be. Great head and lace. The palate is very flavorful. Very hoppy and earthy. The earthy quality lets way to a very complex malt profile. The beer is very fruity. Dry finish. An awesome APA!

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2005 Rerate July 2005: Had this beer on draft and it¬ís a far cry from the contract brewed bottles once available in Atlanta. The hops tingle the tongue and the nose over a malty body that supports the hops nicely. Great APA, although it could really pass for an IPA just as easily.

The appearance isn¬ít too much. Color of one of the lighter shades of leather with an off-white head that was neither large nor long lasting. Nose is malty with hops that are dominated by the Christmas tree-like over the citrus but both are present. Flavor is surprisingly thick malt for a pale beer with a nice balance with the hops. Kind of a slick mouthfeel, but not as slimy as some.
extreme hops.... not for the faint of heart!  If you like IPAs, then try this one!

sorry, i have to fling aspersions at the label: what¬ís with the corpulent voodoo-zombie freak sloughing off bits of his green skin into the beer? were supposed to think that¬ís cute? about as appetizing as a squirming junebug on a bagel, christ. that said, this is an amazing libation: tinglingly tart tangerine in a glass. baked yam in color, wispy crown of lightly nutmeged foam. bursting aroma is a scent for sore noses. my own home grown september cascade hops are as big as bottle caps and dripping with pollen, but this citrus-ginger nectar is more potent still. perfectly engaging carbonation, light sweetness, and woody malt interior render the ghoulish zombie alpha-king into something far more lifting and angellic.
Red beer.  Can smell the hop before you get it.  Smooth flavor with hop follow-on that builds into the aftertaste.

This beer isn¬ít classified as an India Pale Ale but probably should be.  Very nice hop, citrus flavor.  Very reasonably priced and is a mainstay in the fridge.**Just had to upgrade this beer as I was lucky enough to have in on draught.  WOW!  Had to buy a kegerator to enjoy at it¬ís fullest.  Best investment I ever made.  This beer isn¬ít quite a hoppy as Ruination, but for Midwest beers, it rocks!
This was good - but Dogbrick is crazy if he thinks it is better than GL Burining River!  This has a cool bottle and a nice balance of hops and spice.
A nice ale with a lot going on in the flavor.  A very good Pale Ale, but just not my favorite style.

This is about the best APA I have had. It might even edge out GL Burning River. Pretty copper color with a thick beige head and nice lacing. Strong hops and ginger aroma. The flavor was excellent as well. Citrus, ginger, brown sugar and hops were all dancing around in there. Hops did not diminish at all throughout the glass. This is a crisp, good tasting beer that will set the standard for APAs for me for the forseeable future.
A very hoppy ale all most to the point of having a burnt coffee taste i¬íll have to try it again I wasn¬ít impressed

Nice and thick as it poured out into a my glass, smell reminds me of Stone Ruination IPA. Taste is more like an IPA also.I like it, maybe I ought to have bought a six pack instead of just two.Very Hoppy, with citrus flavors, well balanced, bring on the barbecued Ribs.

Snappy hops flavor, nice light coppery-amber color, aroma is not quite as strong when it comes from the bottle as on tap but on tap it smells quite strong.  Great citrus-hop flavor, very crisp.  Still a good balance and the toasty, malty side of the beer comes out stroger when it¬ís not as cold.  Recommended for fans of beer with high hops content.  I¬ím quite proud that something of such high quality comes from my home state of Indiana.  Three cheers for Three Floyds!

Poured with a nice thick head and nice lace.  It was a beautiful coppery orange color.  The smell of hops and malt  complemented each other nicely.  The hops and malt also complemented each other nicely in the taste, with the hops winning out in the end.  A very HOPPY finish to a GREAT drink!  If you like hops, you¬íll love this beer.
Had this at the Map Room in Chicago,it blew me away.Citrus city mixed with a massive malty body not your everyday American Pale!

Best Pale Ale I¬íve had.  This has a slight citrus aroma/flavor without being sour.  Strong hop presence but the finish is very well balanced which takes the edge off the hoppiness.  Great summertime beer.

If there is a great god of hops, this (and Bell¬ís Two-Hearted) were created by his mandate. Beautiful bronze color and with playful bubbles dancing everywhere.  If you put your nose to close to the glass, you get some tingles from hops and carbonation.  Powerful hops character in every pull.  Long lasting hop finish.  A great beer.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2003 Pours a glowing amber-copper color, nice thick head,decent lacing. Strong grapefruity cotten candy, hoppy aroma. Medium body, soft creamy palate, Strong citrus hoppy with some caremel flavor, good session brew, easy to down a few.

I was hoping this would be a better beer, but was slighlty disappointed.  The aroma was nice, slight citrus; but flavor was nothing special---sorry, but I have had Leinies that tasted better.  Maybe the batch was old...? Seemed to taste alittle ¬ímedicine-y¬í?
Golden color, minimum head, but stays well.  Smells of lemon, floral, with a little spice.  A bitter, smooth clean taste.  A very good beer.

hazy bronze color with a dense bubbly head. floral aroma. the taste is all hop. it starts out on a mild note with a malt /hop balance but the finish is pure  hop.  hasa zesty citrus grapefruit tang to it.
thesmooth dry palate only adds to a great beer

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2005 This beer rocks.
Bottle... hazy, amber ale with lots of yeast in the bottle.  A citrusy, piney aroma with lots of caramel. Moderately bitter, citrusy flavor that¬ís loaded with grapefruit. Medium-bodied and crisp with lively carbonation. Bitter, grassy finish. World class brew! A joy to drink!
A great beer that varies slightly throughout the year.  Good malt flavor with strong hop presence.  Bold but easy drinking for hopheads.  Good dark orange color with small head.

This beer had a nice dark amber orange color to it. It formed a nice light tan head that left some nice lace. A slight hop and malt aroma to it. The flavor had hops and malt with a sweet, but not too sweet, citrus and caramel taste. It has a medium body and finish. Not as dry of a finish as their Pride and Joy, but a good beer.
